description:
Great lunch spot! 

There are many lunch spots on Kearny. It's definitely not short on sandwich shops. I like Boxed Food because it has reasonably priced sandwich and salad combos. I always go for the steak panini with salad. The horseradish dressing definitely makes it! The other options are great, too, especially the chicken salad sandwich. Prices recently increased by a dollar, so it's becoming more comparable to its neighbors. There are a few tables to sit and eat, but it doesn't have the best ambiance. You can often hear the sound of the refrigerator. 

The portions are good even with someone with a healthy appetite. Usually I can eat the sandwich in one sitting, and I save the salad as a snack at work. 

This place is good and reliable. You can also order ahead using the Ritual app. Sometimes they have promos on the app. Boxed Foods is also part of the MealPal service.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Boxed foods you are not that bad. I saw some of the negative reviews and had low low expectations but I went with the Boxed Chicken Salad which seemed to have reviews all over the map and was very divisive. 

Boxed Chicken Salad $12 Chicken seasoned with extra virgin olive oil, lemon, thyme, basil, served with applewood smoked bacon, granny smith apples and champagne-apple vinaigrette

I really like the combo of ingredients along with the apple vinaigrette and could see myself returning to this place.

Food came out pretty quick , there wasn't a long wait when I went as well.  

The 3 star rating isn't a big knock considering I have my #1 ranked place below at a 4 star rating .

I like Healthy Foods...occasionally ...lol. For the past year or so I workout multiple times everyday so I typically try to eat at least one Salad a day. Often times I bring my own salad for lunch but sometimes I venture out in the city for some healthy greens.  

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the Chicken and Waffle Establishment in the SF Bay Area. They are all pretty good this is just my take. 

Rod's San Francisco Salad Rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). I have rankings various foods like Boba, Ramen, Steakhouse, Chicken and Wafffles(random right?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews. I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places 

Ranked from Fave to least fave (Business owners don't hate me, all these places are good) 

1 Café du Soleil-Nicoise Salad
2 SweetGreen-Pesto Chicken
3 Darwin Café-Baby Spinach 
4 La Fromagerie-La Mancha Salad
5 Mission Picnic -Deluxe Cobb
6 Mixt-Mixt Cobb
7 Plutos-Custom salad
8 Tender Greens-Chinese Chicken
9 Blue Barn Gourmet-Cobber (Cobb Salad)
10 Split Pea Seduction-The Squash salad
11 Boxed Foods-Boxed Chicken Salad
12 Kitava-Pesto Chicken Cobb
13 Soma Chicken-Caesar Salad
14 Proper Food-Lemon Quinoa Salad with Chicken
15 Eatsa-Various Salads/bowls 
16 The New Spot on Polk-Asian Chicken
17 Organic Coup-Kale/Caesar Combo 
18 Uno Dos Tacos-Fish Salad Bowl
author: Rod M.

description:
New hood, new lunch.

Despite the price-inducing groan at check out, I usually prefer by the lb salads because I like a little of this and a little of that. I am a picky salad girl and sometimes the make your own/pre-made salads short you on my favorite items. (Where my mushies and brussels at?)

Boxed Foods was a PLEASANT surprise! After being drawn in by root veggie salad (2 types of beats, parsnips, carrots, roasted onions, sub feta for goat cheese, and walnuts), I was pleasantly surprised when all these items were plentiful in my salad. The only downfall was the bread included in the salad was a bit stale. But, since I wanted a salad #nocarbsgiven. The salad was pretty sizey too!

I also spied some kombuchas, peanut butter brownies, and more items. Service was pretty quick and everything tasted fresh. The only wish is maybe a few more veg salads that don't need tempeh/tofu. I always like to like veggies shine. 

I am a woman of predictability so if I returned, it would be for the root veggie salad. 95% rate of return. Satisfied customer.
author: Libby J.

description:
Mediocre steak salad, I didn't taste any mint in anything but it was on the menu. 

The onions were raw too... Not good for work breath!

The portion was decent for the price but I just didn't feel like it was anything great.

It honestly tasted like a salad you'd get at a work Cafeteria.  Maybe I should have tried the chicken salad with bacon?

The steak just didn't have much flavor and the dressing was meh.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Ordered through Mealpal app for lunch. Refreshing and light chicken salad for those looking to refuel but not feel crappy after a meal.

Pros:
+ Mealpal sign at the counter
+ Prompt service/pick-up
+ Satisfying and delicious salad

Cons:
- No complaints!

Recommendations:
+ Chicken salad, 5/5

The chicken salad is enough to make you feel 65% full, ideal for those who want lighter lunches. I like to eat and judge my salad by how it tastes without the dressing, and this one passed with flying colors! Loved everything about it, from the chicken pieces and bacon bits to the greens and thin slices of green apples. I didn't care for the bread, but it looked pretty soft also. Side note, I like that the chicken isn't cut in cubes. Small detail but I noticed and appreciated it.

The great thing about Mealpal? It lets you try a restaurant at a lower cost, and if you like it, whoo! If not, little harm done. Will be back to try other salads! Yum!!
author: Fanny W.

description: Looking for a quick healthy lunch to go, and this fit the bill. I got the pulled chicken salad, and it was pretty good, but not much flavor. Chicken wasn't breast meat. My friend likes things simple, so for the turkey artichoke panini, hold the artichoke and spread, add cheese, so basically a turkey mozarella sandwich, but it looked pretty good.
author: Amber E.

description:
First time here, got the steak salad. It was good, but nothing special. Mixed greens, sliced cucumber and tomatoes(big chunks for a salad). They also put a lot of feta cheese. The steak was pretty good. It usually comes cold, but I asked them to warm it up. I wish there were more veggies in the salad. It was pretty basic for $11.50. 

Also, not much space to sit in there. And very stuffy.
author: Raisa G.

description:
I've been here for weekday lunch a couple of times. Once because I was near by and saw it on yelp, and two more times via Mealpal.

The place seems to cater mostly to people who take their lunches to go. There are some seats to the right side of the counter but the space is rather small and I rarely see people sitting there. There may be additional seating in the back but I didn't explore.

Overall I like how their salads tend to be a bit different in taste compared to to other salad places around the area. But their serving sizes are smaller. It's a decent place to go if you're in the area and just want to fill your stomach with something healthy, but not really something I would recommend to a friend or personally crave.
author: Lily L.

description:
I decided to be a little healthier that day and go the Turkey Artichoke Panini. I mean, all their items are relatively healthy, but I felt like turkey was a good choice for that day. I don't know if it was just me, but the sandwich was kind of small. It did come with a small side salad though. The sandwich itself was decent. It had a spinach artichoke spread, asiago cheese, tomato, grilled onions. I thought the bread was a tad stale and i'm not sure if it's from the steam and an enclosed box. The flavors were pretty good though, but it was nothing super impressive. The salad was pretty good too though it was super simple.

Overall, it was a decent sandwich, but it's super pricey for what it is.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Weak 3 / 3.5- tasty pick-up place for sandwich/salads with potential to be awesome, not sure if worth the $11-$13 price tag.

A bunch of friends and I chose this place based on someones recommendation but we were surprised that they didn't allow people to eat inside as was allowed before.  Also was surprised that the employees didn't use gloves when handling the food (so hope they have high cleanliness standards to make up for that).

I ordered the boxed chicken sandwich ($11) without apples, added brie cheese ($1.50) and switched the champagne apple vinaigrette to balsamic (no charge).  Flavor-wise, it was good.  The bacon was crunchy enough to add some good texture to the salad but not so crunchy that it crumbled into tiny bits and pieces.  The greens though were kinda wilted- would have been nice if they were cold or crisp so that it would be more refreshing.  Although the flavor on the chicken was great, it had a weird consistency.  Maybe because they used dark meat, but for some reason the chicken had a slightly slimy texture to it like dark meat does when it's been sitting around too long... not exactly the best feeling / thought when I'm eating a lunch.  

I think this place has the potential to be amazing, given their flavors.  However, not sure if it is worth the price tag, especially since I would have expected slightly better quality for that price.  Hopefully it will improve over time- I'll probably come back just to break up my usual lunch routine and to see if I enjoy it better
author: Audrey H.

description: It was alright. Store was dimly lit and not super welcoming. Could have been a little cleaner/more polished. The salad I got was average
author: Evan M.

description: I guess they serve smaller portions with Meal Pal but what I got was a small side salad.  Salad was OK.
author: Trish M.

description: I had the Boxed Chicken Salad here for lunch, but wasn't super impressed. It sounded delicious on the menu, but I was missing the aioli taste that I was looking forward to and generally found the portion to be on the lighter side. But still comes at $11. I guess, slightly cheaper than some of the other salad options in the area, but I also found the others to be way more exciting. I guess I'd be back to try the sandwiches, but probably get my salad elsewhere. Also, there is no seating, so you would need to take it back to the office or the park, if the weather allows.
author: Katja S.

description:
The boxed chicken salad is one of my favorite salads in the FIDI, but for $10, the portion is pretty small. It'll only keep you full for about two hours. I only get it when it's offered on Mealpal. The shredded roast chicken + apples + bacon + whatever magic vinaigrette combination is perfection! 

All of their salads and sandwiches are always fresh, and I'd easily recommend all of them, especially if you're trying to eat healthy! But again, on the smaller side. Though - I WILL say that the root veggie salad fills me up pretty darn good.
author: Emily C.

description:
Admittedly, I probably wouldn't have gone to Boxed Foods if I knew their pricing had significantly increased since the outdated photos were posted on Yelp, and I almost walked out because they were having some serious issues at the register. But I'm glad I went, as it's one of the few $11-12 sandwiches I've had that can justify the price. I wouldn't call the tempeh sandwich healthy (I could actually see small oil pools in the crevices of the bread), but it was flavorful, filling, and comforting. Tempeh isn't the easiest meat substitute to work with and they did a great job.

There's not really seating inside, so I recommend ordering online and walking up a block to enjoy at the park.
author: Cristina S.

description: I was pretty disappointed in this one. I had seen this place a couple times, so I decided to try this out with a co-worker. I ordered ahead and did a 12pm pickup. I ordered the Boxed Chicken Salad which comes with some bread on the side. I did get full from the food, but the food itself (with a tea) cost $17 bucks! The salad didn't have much taste and was just a bit too "healthy" for me. The dressing was decent though, but I just wish they gave more food for the price. The staff was friendly and there was other things on the menu that I might try out in the future. But, for what I got I wasn't too impressed.
author: James R.

description:
You'd be wise to order ahead of time for pick up if you want lunch, as with all lunch spots in the financial district, this place can get packed. I ordered two grilled flank steak salads through their website (convenience fee was $2.50 or so), pick up was a breeze (+1 star) as the food was ready and already paid for online. The steak was a bit on the tough side (-1 star), but it was tasty and tender enough. The bed of green were fresh, the onions were a nice touch, the tomatoes were fresh, the balsamic dressing provided a good balance and was not overly powering. 

The portion (-1 star) was kind of small for a 12 dollar salad, but it was enough for one person's
author: Long C.

description:
Last Friday, June 3rd, our office got lunch from Boxed Foods Company. We ordered catering using Forkable. Lunch arrived earlier than the time indicated. I believe a little after 12 noon.

I got the "Boxed" Chicken Salad: Chicken seasoned with extra virgin olive oil, lemon, thyme, basil, served with applewood smoked bacon and champagne-apple vinaigrette, no granny smith apples ($11), add Brie cheese ($1.50). It was a very good, basic salad. Fresh and flavorful. I enjoyed all the ingredients: crisp lettuce, crunchy bacon, tasty chicken, etc. I also didn't mind the vinaigrette as it wasn't too sweet. I was afraid I wouldn't like the apple in it, but it was very subtle. The salad was a good size and I used the brie I added for the bread they provided with the salad. It was a good amount and nice and creamy.

I haven't had Boxed Foods in a while. One of my coworkers and I used to come here all the time and get their sandwiches and salads. Glad I got a chance to revisit. They do make a tasty salad.
author: Elena N.

description: Got a baked tofu &  noodle salad. Tofu taste very good and is not overly firm as many other baked tofu do. My favorite part is the salad dressing, really enjoy the asian style dressing with perfect amount of sesame taste. Rice noodle also compliment very well with other ingredients like tofu, spring mix etc. My only complaint is the portion size is relatively small.
author: Wenjing Y.

description:
Shared a beet panini and tempeh salad and sadly both were underwhelming. The beet sandwich was falling apart, and the middle of each slice was soggy. Also the flavor was kind of bland. The tempeh on our salad was good and so was the dressing, but the rest of the salad was basic/forgettable (lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers). Both really could've used another ingredient to add some flavor.

I like that the store's ingredients are organic and mostly local from good farms. However I most likely won't be coming back because the food didn't seem that flavorful, especially when there are so many other restaurants in the area.

One good thing is that our food came out very fast. We came to order lunch right before noon and didn't experience any wait.
author: Jean L.

description:
Came here for lunch after hearing such positive reviews from my coworker, but was left disappointed.

I ordered the Boxed Chicken Salad ($9) which was good... except it tasted completely dry - there was little to no dressing and I was left eating basically greens and chicken.

Kind of like how soup makes or breaks a ramen bowl, the same goes for the dressing.... 

Maybe next time I'll ask for it on the side (& more)... but I haven't lost complete hope. Their menu looks delicious & I definitely want to come try more.
author: Carrie L.

description: I had the tempeh salad ordered through MealPal. The salad was good overall, the tempeh was on the salty side. They have a lot of healthy options here!
author: Amy Z.

description:
Gourmet salads and sandwiches.

Honey lime chicken avocado sandwich complimented well with each other.

The place is easily passable because the outside (nor the inside) draws that much attention.  There are a few seating tables.  It's a simple, wholesome, sandwich and salad shop.  

Tip: If they fixed up the interior, it'll be more appealing and welcoming.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Don't go!!!!:(
If you order the BLT you must request them to toast your bread,,or else you will get a soggy 
BLT like me :(
author: Frank I.

description: Got food to go and when I got back to work and opened salad, 2 bugs crawled out of container.  Had to throw away.
author: Nancy D.

description:
Extremely mediocre meal.

After asking the staff, they recommended the Boxed Chicken Salad ($11) as the #1 salad option. This salad of greens, pulled chicken, bacon, apples, and champagne-apple vinaigrette sounded pretty good but turned out to be a pricey and very boring meal. The vinaigrette quantity was enough, but it was extremely acidic. The chicken was really bland and not that tender. There wasn't a lot of salad either, so I was hungry again in an hour. My friend's Proscuitto Mozzarella Sandwich ($11) was much better and had I known it came with a side salad, I would have definitely chosen this instead.

Also, it really bothered me how unorganized the store was. The drinks, chips, and counter were all on different sides, forming a triangle. This makes for a really chaotic ordering process where nobody knows where the line is, and you're forced to go all around getting what you want. The order numbers are haphazard and not in order, going from 60 to 95 all of a sudden, making it really hard to listen for your number in a predictable manner. That on top of the staff not really yelling the numbers and the loud crowds made me miss my number, and when I asked about my order, the staff guy grumpily handed me my meal.

Seating is really limited. Food prep is a bit slow. Takeaways: save your money and go elsewhere. If you must come here, stick with the sandwiches.
author: Alice T.

description:
The food itself is good but the entire experience of the place could be improved.

First of all, I love Boxed Foods Company's philosophy and was really stoked to go on my lunch break. I was expecting a long wait, but I actually was able to get in + out with my food in less than 5 minutes. Given the fact that their food is a bit more on the pricier end, I was expecting a really nice, clean interior. This wasn't quite the case, the inside looked kinda run down, which didn't leave the best impression.

The Boxed Chicken Salad, though, is pretty darn good! All the ingredients tasted really fresh, and as someone who doesn't always love salad, this was a good option. The granny smith apple adds some nice sweetness, the chicken is good, and the dressing is a nice touch. I liked the flavor addition of the bacon (although it definitely prevents the salad from being as healthy as I'd like), but I found that it was definitely too crispy, to the point where it gave the salad a strange texture at times. Also, fair notice that the salad isn't super filling, so if you're starving, I'd recommend going for a sandwich. But for a quick bite, the salad definitely did the trick.

Though Boxed Foods Company isn't the most innovative or original place, they provide yummy & fresh lunch options for all you FiDi corporate slaves out there ;)
author: Desiree S.

description: Have now also tried the caesar salad with chicken and the caesar with tofu and I do not recommend either additions.  The chicken is dark meat and really fatty and unpleasant and the tofu is marinated in an asian sauce that doesn't go well with the caesar.  I like the plain caesar a lot because the dressing is super authentic - really garlicky and has great anchovy flavor, but a caesar salad doesn't have much nutritional value and I'd like it better if I could at least fortify it with protein.  If Boxed Foods got regular grilled white meat chicken as an option to add to the salad, I would seriously eat there everyday *suddenly realizes I should just bring my own chicken to work to add to this salad*
author: Emma H.

description:
Great place. Amazing food and a very helping staff.

We went there for a lunch and the place looked appealing from outside. As we were looking through the menu and trying to figure out the meaning of couple of ingredients, the gentleman at the counter asked if we needed any help. He helped us out with selecting the right sandwich once he knew we were coming for the first time and that we were vegetarians. Nice guy!

We tried Tempeh sandwich and baked tofu and noodle salad. Both of them were absolutely delicious. The portions were huge though. But overall, we enjoyed the meal. 

The place is quite congested and I guess most of the orders are for to go. There is a large kitchen area and couple of two and four seater tables lined up on the other side. Adequately lighted. 

Great place to have grab a quick sandwich or a salad. Definitely recommended!
author: Jay M.

description:
I was so happy to find this place on Kearny, since I moved office buildings I have access to more places and Boxed Foods Company located in FiDi is one of my favorites.

From afar, Boxed Foods Company may seem like any other sandwich and salad place. What is different, however, is their gourmet menu - distinctive, heavenly sandwiches and salads! All of their sandwiches are made with artisan breads and come with a side salad.

These are the sandwiches I rave about:
Honey-Lime Chicken with Avocado ~love how this citrusy tasty blends into a delicious flavor served on a herb ciabatta roll
Boxed Chicken Salad ~applewood smoked bacon, granny smith apples on a sesame kaiser roll sounds interesting, tastes even better
Pear and Brie Press ~love anything with brie
Grilled Flank Steak ~ with Horseradish Aoli on sliced sourdough another favorite

There are also vegetarian options and makes every effort to use organic ingredients. Prices are under $10 and is money well spent! I also love the beet salad.

They also serve and hand drip Blue Bottle Coffee, which has a rich, chocolaty smooth finish.
The positives:
Price: Most everything is $10
Speed: Food was prepared within 10 minutes
Quality: The sandwiches are some of the best sandwiches I have tasted in years (so yummy)
Sides: The sandwich came on a bed of greens --- I did not have to order a separate salad

Nothing negative for me about this place! That is why I keep coming back for more since I know whatever I get will be delicious.  Oh and don't forget to try their chocolate chip cookies.
author: Maria M.

description:
Food was wonderful but the place is just not sanitary. Not ONCE did I see employees use gloves and they were doing everything from laying the chicken to leafing the lettuce to cutting the tomatoes. The shop itself was also not that clean. I accidentally fell in the shop (lol) and my hands were black with dust :/ Employees also didn't bat an eye at that so hm..not the most friendly staff I've seen either. Also they forgot my order even though I ordered the same thing as the person after me and they gave it to him first.

On to the food though. I tried the honey chicken avocado sandwich and it comes with a small salad for $11. For what you pay, it's pretty good and keeps you full! Really liked the dressing they use for the salad and the sandwich is yummy too. Come after 1 if you want to avoid the line, if there is one.
author: Tiffany E.

description: Got the steak salad. raw red onions, tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, feta, balsamic vinaigrette. it wasn't anything special. it took a lot longer than the chicken salads we ordered to prep. The steak was super chewy and i found the salad to be dry. the other options weren't too appealing, a lot of fruit and not to much variety. I prefer burratta salads down the street, but it's an easy pick up if you're starving.
author: Zara S.

description:
Spent $16 on lunch, that's for a sandwich, chips and tea 
Ummmm..... Food was ok, but pricey for a "basic" sandwich meal
author: Jewely F.

description:
I use to come here all the time! Nice people, good salads, average price for the area...

Then I came one day and saw the guy at the register handling the money, then jumping onto the line and touching all the food- no one was wearing gloves, then the manager wiping the counters down with a brown rag (it's not suppose to be brown). 

Haven't been back since.
author: Mandi W.

description:
It's my last day in SF for a while, I should get some greens before my carb loaded flight, but screw it, I'll get a killer American Italian style sandwich instead!

I had the mozzarella and prosciutto sandwich, on a toasted ciabatta style bread. It's the kind of sandwich that makes you want to move close to this cafe so you can eat this sandwich every day. Not healthy at all, but so perfect in every other way.

The side salad was also a taste sensation, what's in that dressing?!

Sure the place could do with a makeover, but the food is incredible.
author: Laura D.

description:
Not normally a fan of panini's, but the Prosciutto & Mozzarella Panini was all-around very good. The meat/cheese combo was excellent, as was the thick sourdough bread. The lemon-vinaigrette was lite, and complemented the sandwich.

The Pear & Brie Press sandwich was also good. I wasn't a fan of the multigrain wheat that it was served on, and the bread lessened the overall taste of the sandwich. The bites with just brie and bread weren't very good, but probably would have been significantly better on sourdough. I'd give the option of having it on multigrain, but I'd serve it normally on sourdough.
author: Marc B.

description:
The boxed chicken salad with the light vinaigrette sauce and thin cut apple sticks is my new favorite! It's $9 on the menu and it's a good size. Ordering was fairly quick but they did take a bit long preparing the food. 

Tip: If you walk to the back up the stairs there is an alley with tables where you can enjoy your meal in an outdoor space.
author: Suna L.

description: Great, tasty food, reliable, and with prices that are predictable for lunch spots in the area. If you've got the funds to blow on it on a daily basis, this is a great place to do it. And cheaper than Mixt across the street.
author: Lori J.

description: I ordered the Honey Lime Chicken Sandwich (to go).  The menu lists avocado spread as the first ingredient... so it better be on the sandwich.  But it wasn't.  #FAIL   In all other respects, it was an ok sandwich.  I thought their aioli was quite tasty, and I'm not a mayo or aioli fan.  But overall, as I was eating it back at my office, I kept thinking I needed some avocado.
author: Chris L.

description:
Solid lunch spot in the FIDI.
I love their Boxed Chicken Salad and Raw Salad.
Prices are pretty standard for the area $8-$10 for sandwich or salad.
Service is quick!
author: Angela D.

description:
For lunch, I prefer to keep it light so a salad usually prevails as the obvious, easy choice. However, the art of the perfect salad is deceptively difficult because only a handful of FiDi eateries nail 'em.

And Boxed Foods does.

My go-to salad at BFC (the Boxed Chicken Salad) is topped with grilled chicken dressed with lime, Granny Smith apple sticks, bacon, olive oil, a touch of aioli, fresh herbs, EVOO, cherry tomatoes, red onion and then it's all lightly tossed with a complementary Granny Smith apple vinaigrette. Great, but I make it fantastic by adding avocado. For under $10, I get to eat a salad that nourishes and wonderfully sates!

Some day, I'll try one of their sandwiches but for now I know a dream of a salad waits for me at BFC.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
I love pears.

I love brie.

Thus, the $8 PEAR & BRIE PRESS SANDWICH called out to me.

Served with a small mixed greens salad, the sandwich is petite (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/boxed-foods-company-san-francisco?select=_5puZNq7UWWTTX_hLeyphw#_5puZNq7UWWTTX_hLeyphw). As many other reviewers have mentioned, it's a good light lunch for a normal appetite, but insufficiently satiating for anything greater.

Now, one can't go wrong with the glorious combination of Bosc pears, caramelized onions, walnut pesto, and brie. The flavors meld together perfectly. The rude awakening is the bread: a hearty grain bread with the toughest crusts ever. Yes, biting the soft center is a euphoric experience, but the small circumference of the bread slices left me with a whole lotta tough texture that took away from the beauty of the ingredients. Also, the sour raspberry dressing with my salad didn't mesh with my palette.

My friend ordered the $9 GRILLED STEAK SALAD, with lightly seasoned, medium-cooked strips of steak. The steak is great, and the accompanying vinaigrette is fitting.

All in all, I'd avoid the pear & brie press sandwich not because of flavor, but because of texture. That crust, bleh.
author: Adele F.

description:
Tempeh salad. Any place that does tempeh needs to do it well because, well, it can be downright awful when it's not properly cooked. Fortunately, a lot of places are getting there - like Boxed Foods. A good seasoning and grilling go a long way.

The rest of the salad was more or less like any other place that has ever done salads ever. Not super inventive, honestly. A bit traditional, even boring.

But the tempeh, man. Whew!
author: Andrew R.

description:
Oh man, I didn't even know this place was place! Rita I and I walked past on lunch today to grab some Thai food, and smelled paninis and we were sold. 

They have a good selection of sandwiches, salads, Panini, chips, drinks, and sides. I got the Chicken Salad Sandwich Box ($10) plus a bag of jalapeño chips for $2. The sando was large and in charge, though the bread was a seeded bun that was pretty thick. The shredded chicken and thick cut bacon went well together and the pesto spread and tomatoes brought the sandwich together.

Minus 1/2 for price, ouch, and another 1/2 for having no hot ANYTHING in the entire place. No hot sauce, no jalapeños, no crushed red peppers. I saved half of my meal and finished it off with Tobasco sauce at my desk. Overall, pretty dank. Rita had a Panini and really liked it, so I'll opt for that next time.
author: Crystal C.

description: i ordered the turkey artichoke panini which comes with salad. i really like the panini because i'm a fan of turkey and and artichoke, but the portion size was a bit small. at least it came with salad so i had more food to chew on haha. but you really can't expect much from restaurants/food shops in the financial district to overcharge customers with small portions of food. there's limited amount of seating and it's usually really busy around lunch time.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
Good things come in boxes it's true
but these boxes are not small or blue.

They are of the bio-degradable kind
that comes with big portions which can be so hard to find.

You can get sandwiches or salads that are big enough for two.
You can even get free high fives or a side of love for $1.50 if you are feeling blue.

The staff is nice, the food is local and fresh if that's what you crave. 
The turkey and artichoke panini and wedge are my fave.
author: Kristi G.

description: Don't order delivery from them. I placed two orders for work meetings with 24 hours notice and one was 15 minutes late and the other was over an hour late- completely missed the meeting and left folks hungry. When I called the person I spoke with couldn't have cared less, offered zero apology or discount for the inconvenience. Terrible customer service in such a competitive market. I will not order from them again and I encourage others not to if they care about delivery times. Also the food is just "ok" so definitely not worth the wait by any means.
author: Carrie C.

description: Delicious sandwiches. Lots of mistakes on orders. Staff is rude. They will stare at you like "so what" when you point out that they forgot the dressing on the salad, for instance.  So if you wait in a long line for an expensive sandwich and are ok with being made to feel bad when you ask them to correct their mistake on the order, you will be fine with this place.
author: Alexander G.

description: I admit I finally decided to give Boxed Foods a try because the Chipotle around the corner already had a long line. Regardless, glad I discovered this spot!  I always thought Boxed Foods served their meals pre-packaged because of the name (like Proper Foods), but it's actually made to order. The pulled chicken is yummy! And the bacon! Prices are medium-high for the area (~$11 for a sandwich or salad). Not my go-to place but I'll be adding it to the lunch rotation.
author: Connie Q.

description:
More like 1 and a half dollar signs, as their sandwiches/paninis are $11+.
But great when I want to treat myself.
author: Heyun J.

description: I have tried the grilled chicken salad and the prosciutto mozzarella panini and they are delicious! This place uses fresh ingredients and each menu item has an interesting flavor to it. For example the prosciutto mozzarella panini has a lemon aioli which is not typical for this kind of panini and it absolutely delicious!
author: Sarah G.

description: This place made a good sandwich but...it ought to be for $11.95. For just a sandwich. There are some leaves in the box but that is all the salad is. They also had very few vegetarian options. Don't get me wrong, I really appreciate the creative and gourmet ingredients but that is a costly sandwich, even in the FIDI. I would expect a more substantive salad or side to accompany it for the cost.
author: Laura M.

description:
Just call me Salad Man 'cause that's all I am most work days. As they've been around for the better part of the last decade, the simple execution at Boxed Foods is somewhat deceptive, as they clearly use high-quality ingredients in their abundant salads. But I always feel like I need to gird my loins when I enter this claustrophobic space on Kearny at lunchtime because it means I'm spending a bit more than my usual budget allows. On the other hand, now that I'm going more flexitarian these days while still being too lazy to bring an unimaginative salad from home, maybe I am worth the $9 price tag on the Roasted Veggie Salad. It's really delicious and a lot more healthy goodness than a chicken salad sandwich from Lee's Deli.

It comes in a fairly large egg-carton-thick container where it's anchored by a bed of fresh mesculun greens and topped with huge slices of red and golden beets along with carrots, parsnips, caramelized onions, walnuts, orange slices, and bits of a high-end goat cheese - all doused with a balsamic vinaigrette mixed with fresh orange juice (see photo). As urban salads go, it's a relative treasure trove if you're looking for a lot of sweetness to go with your greens. I've had their grilled chicken and flank steak salads before during heartier days of carnivery where meat passed my lips like nobody's business. Space is tight in here with just a few cafe twofer tables that generally get snapped up quickly, so be prepared to take it to go.

FOOD - 4 stars...a hearty, healthy salad may be a bit overloaded and pricey - but who's complaining?
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...bright and tight...they box it for a reason
SERVICE - 3 stars...not very memorable
TOTAL - 4 stars...I loves me some beets and sweets in me salad
author: Ed U.

description: Friendly staff, nice rounded prices (the prices include tax), short lines during lunch (surprise!), ... I think I was most impressed by the balanced flavors of the boxed chicken salad and the above par portioning of the salad.  It is rare that I find a place that has appropriate and healthy portion sizes.  Will repeat.
author: Rebecca R.

description: One of my favorite spots to order lunch from for our office. The food is consistently good and they are always great about any modifications (a lot of places on Caviar aren't). The portions are filling, but not overwhelming. Great place for a quick and healthy lunch.
author: Kelsey O.

description:
Dayyyyyyymn this place is hella good! Hearty, fresh, savory sandwiches and salads. All sandwiches come with a side of the house salad. My two favorites are the boxed chicken salad and grilled flank steak sandwiches. Super filling and satisfying. Favorite salads are the classic wedge and roasted veggie. Sooo yummy! 

You can taste the freshness in every bite. Definitely farm-to-table ingredients across the board. Other premium ingredients like Straus and Acme products really seal the deal for me. These small, quality details make this place special. 

Yes! The wait is long. Sometimes out the door and around the corner. This is simply an indicator as to how great the food is. I crave this place often but they're only open for lunch. If you haven't experienced boxed foods it's worth a taste!
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Ewww, hair in my tempeh salad today (it was on the tomatoes, a short dark hair). I feel like this place has declined in quality.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I love this business. I'm an event planner and have used them several times for group lunches. I call ahead or email, and they have all the box lunches ready for me at the agreed time. They've been super flexible and work with me on a convenient pick up time. 

This is one of the few places that is able to meet all of the dietary needs of the diverse groups I work with. Super fresh ingredients, really quality food. I will definitely continue using them in the future.

Plus friendly and conveniently located.

Thank you!!
author: Jen A.

description:
I had the chicken sandwich with avocado and lime aioli. The flavor was meh and like so many places, there was too much aioli. The bread is definitely ok but the side salad just tasted unbalanced. For $11 I expected more.

I may be willing to try this place again if a co-worker is already going, but I would order something completely different.
author: Brett G.

description:
The food is good, if a little small.  Their customer service really needs work.  I have had a few issues previously, but overlooked them because I like the food.  Until yesterday.

Walked in, and the cashier was sorting through what looked like a large order, but no line.  Was told to wait with a finger, indicating what I thought would be 1 minute.  Fortunately I had a friend there, whom I talked to while waiting a good 5 to 8 minutes, after which, the cashier looked up and informed me that they did not have bread.

It is absurd that this was not done when I walked in the door.  I have had a similar experience a few months ago, when they were out of beef, which I was informed of only after making it through their lengthy line (perhaps consider a sign on the door for these outages?).

This caused me to go explore Foundation up the street, which I have found to be far superior.
author: George L.

description:
Got the yummy-sounding Pear & Brie Sandwich & unfortunately it was anything but..... 

There was a small dollop of brie & thick slices of pears that were paired w/ a basil pesto.  The pesto added a weird flavor layer to the sandwich that didn't work for me and it needed ** a lot ** more brie.  

Replacing the basil pesto w/ something sweet, like pears scream for - maybe like a fig or walnut chutney - or maybe even an apple-butter, would have made for a better compliment to the sandwich

It also had these extremely undercooked caramelized onions that had had no time to get dark & sweet - resulting in a still-harsh onion flavor...picked them off  

So moral of the story here is that I'm still trying to find their sandwich / salad that clicks for me.  I like their lineups & am confident we will find a match

But have to say the Pear Sandwich at Madeleine Cafe is much, much tastier & therefore, I've experienced better.  Sorry guys!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Great for a quick lunch. Boxes and utensils are all biodegradable as is the San Fran way.

Make sure to hit up the cool seating out back as there are only a few seats inside. Food is fresh and healthy for the most past with most items in the $10-12 range. Would recommend taking out if you need a quick bite while in the Financial District.
author: Elisabeth B.

description:
I've tried the Boxed Chicken Salad Sandwich and it could use a little more pesto sauce and maybe oil to keep the chicken moist. The apple adds a nice touch of texture and flavor and it's my favorite part. For the size, $9 is a bit too much. I can go somewhere else for sandwiches and for the same price I can get doubled the size. 

There's only one cashier so service tends to be slow when people don't know what to order. There's about 3-4 people making the food, so once you ordered you only have to wait a little longer. Best time to come here for lunch is probably after 1:30pm. That's when the line isn't out the door. 

I might come back to try their salads, but I would definitely prefer paying less than $8 for my lunches.
author: Renee Y.

description: Really good, solid salads and they have daily salad specials with ingredients that are freshest.  There are some seats inside and also in the alleyway in the back.  It is a popular place so get there early to beat the lunch crowd and/or get a table.
author: Maile N.

description: Not that crowded during lunch hour! Prices raided $1 each tho since the last menu picture.
author: Kerry G.

description:
I used to love Boxed Foods.  They had healthy and tasty salads and sandos.  Today I went in to grab lunch to go and was so disappointed. 

I ordered the Turkey and Artichoke Panini.  It's supposed to have spinach spread and grilled onions.  It was barely grilled and served luke warm.  The sandwich was dry and the side salad was a pathetic few bad (so bad they were brown) wilted pieces of lettuce.  And, this is my biggest pet peeve, there was a tomato slice with stem on the sandwich.

What the heck happened?  Won't be returning any time soon.
author: D C.

description:
First time I came here, I ordered the roasted veggie salad (I am always in the mood for ROASTED BEETS) and was very impressed by its size and deliciousness.

Then I did something horrible.
I forgot about Boxed Foods Co and did not revisit for almost an entire year. When I finally made it back recently and ordered the same salad with roasted beets (now called the root veggie salad) I realized I had made a huge mistake. Why haven't I been eating here for lunch EVERY WEEK??

Those beets, oh those large glorious juicy chunks of sweet roasted beets. I could swim in them forever. So many of them resting on top of a bed of springy greens, mixed in with big nutty chunks of goat cheese, crunchy toasted walnuts, and sweet roasted root veggies (carrots, parsnips). How could I have ever forgotten about them??

I am instating a weekly pilgrimage to Boxed Foods from this day forward. Beautiful roasted beet salad from Boxed Foods, I will never wrong you again!!
author: Amanda C.

description: This restaurant is fairly efficient. The food is fresh and fairly tasty.
author: Jon F.

description:
We haven't had our greens in awhile, so we decided to check this place out. Actually, I lied. I saw pictures of the massive honey-lime sandwich with avocado on Yelp and I knew I needed that in my life. The menu is written on the wall and has some specials such as free high-fives and Love for only $1.50, but I decided to pick avocados over love (again..).

That choice still hasn't failed me. Sandwich was perfect and there was enough greens in the box to also be used as a side salad. Maybe I'll buy love here one day, but I'm not entirely sure buying love is legal.
author: Jay R.

description:
Healthy tasting sandwiches and salads. Even the sandwiches are put on top of salads!

I usually don't like bleu cheese, but they do a good job here pairing it with apple slices and dried fruits and nuts.
author: Thomas C.

description:
I absolutely love this place! The food is fresh and delicious. The staff is always super friendly nice. The grilled chicken panini is my favorite! Suprisingly whenever I go here for lunch the line is never that long, which I don't understand because everything I tried from here tastes pretty good!

I docked one star because they always put onions in my sandwich even though I always ask for no onions.
author: Gail M.

description:
News alert.
I am nearly ready to call this my favorite "spurge casual lunch" in SF's Fidi, I hesitate since I have only been here once for the first time today. But the sandwich I had - Boxed chicken salad - was phenomenal. Pulled rotisserie chicken, Julianne apples, bacon, and a generous spread of really garlicky pesto on a dense seeded roll (which if I was to quibble I might have liked toasted or warmed a teeny bit).  The service was genuine, fast and enthusiastic.  The special sounded amaze-balls - peach and cheddar cheese Panini. I was tempted, but the cheap-o curmudgeon in me couldn't spend $12 for a grilled cheese sandwich. As it was I spent $9 on the Sammy with a small side salad (and I tipped a buck at the counter - which I would not normally do - so that is saying something!)

My current job is ending - so not sure if I will be back in the near future but I sure hope my next gig is nearby for the occasional splurge.

I gotta turn the admin gals at my company on to this place for catering!
author: Amy W.

description:
Back in the day - it seemed that Boxed Foods Company was one of the few spots in the Financial District that was dedicated to bringing organic - healthy sandwiches and such to the business masses. But luckily there are now a slew of new healthy and local focused spots in the area. 

Despite the growing amount of nutrition focused spots in the area - Boxed Foods Company still has it's mojo - as evidenced by the busy line which typically forms outside of it around lunchtime. 

I decided to revisit Boxed Foods today for pure nostalgic value. It was later on in the day and I was one of the only people there. Their sandwich menu looked very similar to what I remember a couple of years back - although there was definitely a slew of new delicious sounding additions.  I wasn't as taken with their salad menu though. It was fairly lack-luster sounding.

I ended up getting the vegetable salad - which was decent and while I enjoyed the parsnips, carrots, beets, and walnuts which adorned it   - I wasn't particularly wowed by it - and would probably prefer to go to Darn Good Food and make my own. 

Still - I have to give some big props to Boxed Foods for being ahead of the organic trend early on and for keeping their local mojo going.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Lettuce, chicken, bacon, and Granny Smith apples. 

One of the best salads I have had. 

After trying Mixt Greens several times and leaving disappointed, I knew it was time to find a new lunch spot. 

I was not expecting much from Boxed Foods, but boy was I wrong.  I ordered the Boxed Chicken Salad which is relatively simple. To be honest, it did not even look that good when I received my order, but after the first bite, I was blown away.  The ingredients are simple, but they just blend so nicely with the champagne vinaigrette. 

Goodbye Mixt Greens- I found my new lunch spot!
author: Juliana K.

description:
Salad's are delicious and fresh. Be prepared to wait in line a bit. I work right next door (don't stalk me), so it's a daily option...depending on the length of the line outside.

Why the 3 stars? Honestly, nothing stood out.
author: Carina M.

description: Update: I got a message from this company after the previous review I left. They treated me to a complimentary meal ( THANK YOU). And oh man my spirits are back! I ordered the honey glazed (lime?) panini, mmmmmmm just so yummy and warm, and 100% fresh.. So happy that I gave this place another shot! Thank you !!
author: Daniella G.

description:
This place is just delicious--flavorful food that really fills you up. Other places in the financial district will charge you as much or more for a quinoa "salad" (read: quinoa with some corn and tomato) that leaves you hungry in an hour. After eating lunch here, I usually have leftover for the mid afternoon hunger attack! I have yet to try anything that isn't amazing. 

It's great for a quick to-go lunch run in the middle of the work day, and even if there's a line (because who wouldn't want to eat here?!), it goes pretty quickly. I can't wait to eat everything on the menu!
author: Jessica W.

description:
3.5 Stars. Solid lunch place if you want a fresh salad or panini.

Boxed Chicken Salad ($10.00): Chicken seasoned with extra virgin olive oil, lemon, thyme, basil, served with applewood smoked bacon, apples, and champagne apple vinaigrette.

I haven't tried any of the other salads but this one is pretty good. I'm usually not a fan of cold chicken in my salads but this is seasoned well and not too dry! The amount of dressing they give you is small so I would recommend asking for an extra container unless you like it pretty light. I would also recommend getting here early before the lunch rush. I got here at 12:15pm once and they ran out of avocado. Got here at 12:45pm another time and they ran out of salads...

Overall, I think it's a great lunch place. Price is reasonable for Fidi and the portions aren't too small. If you have the Paypal app, you can get $5 off as well!
author: Julia H.

description: Love this place because it makes me feel like the food was designed to be taken to go. (Very practical concept if you work in FiDi.) I ordered the boxed chicken salad because it seemed to get many good reviews. For $10, it's filling, fresh, and healthy! They give a generous amount of chicken and bacon, though there is not much dressing. Salads do not usually fill me up, but they serve just the right amount. Stop by on your lunch break!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
There is no "for here" option at Boxed Foods - everything comes boxed! There are tables inside and a quaint outdoor seating area hidden behind the storefront (head towards the restroom). Boxed has an assortment of mildly high brow lunch sandwiches and salads.

I chose the Nectarine Panini ($11) - prosciutto, ricotta, nectarines, and arugula sandwiched between two slices of lightly grilled sourdough. I realize this sandwich is relatively easy to make at home, but the ingredients were very fresh and the ricotta was so delicate. Prosciutto and nectarines are an excellent light and satisfying lunch combination. I wish the panini was all grilled for a bit longer, but I guess that's what you get when you're looking for a quick bite for a working lunch. The salad that came with the panini was not pleasant; the lack of dressing was healthy, but I was literally shoveling dry leaves into my mouth.

The salads looked like they had a lot of colorful toppings, so I'll be back to try one. The prices are steep for the simplicity of food preparation, but it's not any worse than the usual Financial District price markups.
author: Jessica F.

description: The grilled flank steak salad was very tasty. The ingredients were very fresh.  In fact, co-workers were walking by asking what smells so good and fresh!  Must have  been the mint.  I know Boxed Foods is more of a take out but I would liked to eaten in but all the tables were taken and there was no seating next to the window or outside.  I will definitely be back but just on my days that I will take out and eat at the office.
author: Linda N.

description: The roasted vegetable salad was amazing! So filling, colorful, and fresh. It's a great option if you're looking for something convenient and healthy in the financial district. Will definitely be back again for it!
author: Allison D.

description:
Decent salads, I would lean more towards one vs a sandwich-A bit on the expensive side($.20 of chicken for $4-whaaaa!!!)

Get's pretty packed but the employees are very efficient and nice.
author: Diana D.

description: The Boxed Chicken Salad is delicious af. My order is always ready fast, despite there being a line sometimes. Once, they ran out of the regular chicken they usually use and substituted with grilled chicken instead, and it was still soooo good. This place is definitely on my radar for my lunches now, and it made me appreciate salads even more (coming from a person who grew up being a picky eater/meat lover). Wewt!
author: Tiffany Mae C.

description: Great lunch spot. I popped in one afternoon to grab a quick sandwich to bring back to the office and I was pleasantly surprised with the Boxed Food Company. I had the turkey, artichoke with added pesto which was delicious. The food is on the pricier side for lunch but worth it.
author: Tira B.

description: There salads are of a decent size and quite tasty! I had their tempeh salad and was happy with my choice as it comes with bunch of ingredients! My friend also enjoyed their proscuto with apricot sandwich
author: Ilmia N.

description:
If you're in the Financial District and looking for a quick and healthy takeout lunch, you could do worse than visiting Boxed Foods Company. The menu is pleasantly short, so you can save the analysis paralysis for your spreadsheets. Essentially, they have about 7 or 8 sandwiches and salads, all of them made with fresh ingredients, and less than 5 minutes wait. 

I'm giving it 4 stars because nothing I got there ever really blew me away, but it's a solid option when you need a quick grab-and-go lunch at work.
author: Chris W.

description: I dont like it that much, good food, but bit on expensive side. Service is good though.
author: Kash S.

description:
Went here for lunch yesterday before going ice skating at the union square rink. There were 10 of us and we didn't know they didn't have much seating inside but they were nice enough to set up tables for us on their "patio" aka the alley way. Good little spot on a nice day. I love that all of their serve wear is compostable and their food is organic. Everything was fresh an wholesome. 

I got the boxed chicken salad and there was no shortage of chicken or bacon. The salads come with an orange wedge or two and a piece of crusty bread. The vinaigrette was refreshing and light but I felt it could use a little more flavor.

I give this place 3 stars because for what the food is, it's not outstanding but it certainly is still good. I think you're paying more for the organic food than the stand-out flavors. Really and truly, it's a fancied up deli.
author: Steph J.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 3

Came here for lunch on a Thursday.

1. "Boxed" Chicken Salad Sandwich, 10
Applewood smoked bacon, granny smith apples, basil pesto, sesame kaiser roll
~Really good. Loved the apples, bacon, pulled chicken, and sesame roll. Solid ingredients.

Service was really fast, although I wish the cashier had told me which chicken sandwich was the most popular.
author: David L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally came here today to pick up some lunch. Luckily for a Friday, the line was not too long when I got there (but did get busy again quickly). 
I ordered the chicken salad sandwich. They were out of bacon so subbed proscuitto instead. Overall, my sandwich was good- it was light but filling enough portion for lunch and had great flavor (liked the granny apple in there too!). The side salad with it was also a good compliment. 
Prices here are around $9-12 for lunch but worth the good flavor and cool, boxed lunch! Also they keep service running here...didn't have to wait more than 5 min to receive my order.
Would return again to try more items, good place to grab and go and sit somewhere outside.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Great lunch option!

I've been meaning to come here for such a long time but they close so early. Finally made it down for lunch!

 Upon the recommendation of a local, I opted for the honey lime chicken sandwich. The sandwich was quite tasty! The chicken was soft and moist with a deep flavor profile. It came with tomatoes, arugala (I think), and avocado. Delicious! The sandwich came with a side salad that was meh but overall I really enjoyed the sandwich.

There was a line through the lunch hour but it moved quite quickly. This is a great option for lunch.
author: Roehl A.

description:
The sandwiches here are SO good. Portions are a little small for its price, but everything is so good. I've tried the $8 grilled chicken panini sandwich with goat cheese, and their coffee.

I wish I found this place sooner. There's salads, sandwiches, coffee. What else do you need for lunch?
author: Jeanette S.

description:
I'll admit...this sandwich joint is better than your average subway. The food is mildly tastier but perfect for grab-on-the-go. 

The prosciutto sandwich was too chewy for my taste. One bite turned into many mini bites to separate the prosciutto chunk into my mouth. But, the side salad had a nice complementary dressing that didn't overpower the sandwich. 

Bottom line: Still haven't found my go-to sandwich joint in the financial district, but willing to try another boxed sandwich when I'm not too adventurous and not too hungry.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Slightly disappointed, after all the raving Yelp reviews regarding the salads. 

I got the Boxed Chicken Salad, expecting it to be absolutely amazing, especially since the wait for the salad was so long! The salad came with some greens, some bread, some chicken, and I even added some avocado for bacon replacement. Oh, there was also a small little pack of apple vinagrette dressing. 

The chicken was good, not great, but good - at least not super dry. Admittedly, it was fairly unflavorful, so I had to dab it with lots of dressing. Unfortunately, that didn't leave enough dressing for the rest of the greens, which ended up being... well... plain. I didn't have extra dressing in the fridge, so I couldn't even make it taste better and ended up throwing the rest of the salad. 

Had to eat some nuts and fruit because the salad just wasn't filling enough. I suppose the salads are good if you're looking for a super super super healthy diet, but hey, if you're working so hard everyday, why not treat yourself to a little flavor in your life?

Really, nothing special. Probably would not come get the salads again. Will try Blue Bottle coffee and perhaps the sandwiches though!
author: Mandy C.

description: Poor value for he sandwiches which I've had. I agree they taste good but the amount of meat and food they give you dint worth the basically $12 sandwich you get. So many other places to eat near there that this is not worth it.
author: Deal G.

description: Ordered a salad here the other day for lunch. Was surprised at how fast it was, but then realized that the steak wasn't made to order. But then was pleasantly surprised and how good it was. The salad was delicious and filling, there was nothing amazing about it. But it was really good. The steak definitely wasn't overcooked and it had plenty of flavor. It's still not a Mixt Green or Tender Greens though.
author: Vanessa K.

description: This is one of my go-to's since I work nearby. I come here almost every week and I've had most of the foods. I really dig the Honey Lime Chicken Avocado sandwich, and the Tofu Noodle salad. The vegetables taste pretty fresh, and I think for the FiDi, the prices are about average.
author: Sherman H.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee, Sandwiches, Salads

I just had the most amazing sandwich here. It was pear and brie with pesto sauce. I'm totally recreating and reinventing that at home on our panini grill. The salad was good too with the buttermilk dressing. Yes, a little overpriced.

1 Iced Coffee
1 Pear Press Sandwich
_______________________
$10.75

+ compostableware
- need tables that fit more than 2 people
author: Jennifer W.

description:
It is official. I have found my new salad place. I have walked by this place every time I am on my way to get a Chipotle Chicken Salad at Working Girls. But after being ranked #2 in Yelp checking at Working Girls, I decided its time to try a different salad place.

I stopped by Boxed Foods Company, and the salads were 9 dollars. Whoo hoo, better than the $9.25+ tax at working girls. The boxes that people were taking out were some what small... I hesitated, but this was for Yelp, for the sake of trying new things. There were several people waiting, so I thought it would take a while for my salad to get to my hands, but even before I ordered, one of the workers asked me what i wanted so they could start making my order.

I got the Boxed Chicken Salad. Pulled Grilled Chicken dressed with lime, fresh herbs, apples, bacon, and a delicious Granny Smith Apple Vinaigrette. It felt like I bypassed the queue of waiting people as I got my salad before the people in front of me got their orders, but I have noticed that sometimes they ask people if they can wait so they can give them the freshly made ingredients.

The salad looked nice and healthy but a little on the small side. It wasn't until I got to my desk and mixed that salad that all the leaves and meat popped out. The bacon ain't the flimsy or tiny bacon bits found at other places. They were nice thick cut pieces, and full of flavor too. I don't know if the guy really liked me or what, but I got a lot of chicken. More than half a breast at least! All the flavor just melded together nicely; the apples, the herb-y meat, the bacon. Delicious.

Later that week, I stopped by again. It was a long week at work, so I treated myself to Boxed Food Company again, this time I decided to try the Grilled Chicken Salad. It had the same delicious apples and dressing as the Boxed Salad but no bacon and the chicken was sliced instead of pulled. A lot of the flavor came from the thick caramelized onions and grilled peppers. It was another delicious salad, but I prefer what the Boxed Salad has to offer.

I am tempted to try their sandwiches next, but that will have to come another day after I get tried of my new usual.
author: David C.

description:
I've had the honey-lime chicken sandwich before, and it was really good.

Today, I ordered the boxed chicken salad sandwich, and it was bad.  The chicken was overcooked and dry.  Pieces of the chicken felt hard, dry, crunchy and bitter.  And it wasn't just 1 or 2 charred bits of grilled chicken-- it was about 1/3 of the chicken salad.

I'm not a picky eater, but I couldn't finish my lunch.  Something was definitely wrong with the chicken salad today.  They should not have used the overcooked chicken.
author: Needles K.

description:
A couple stars for the friendly staff, but the $10.50 steak salad was not very good. Basically it's spring mix salad with some red onions, a little feta and 3-4" strips of stringy unseasoned beef with a small cup of vinaigrette for dressing. And a tiny slice of white balloon roll on the side. It tasted like a lot of individual ingredients and nothing cohesive. And cutting long stringy strips of tough steak in a box with a plastic knife was quite an unwanted adventure. 

It looks like their sandwiches might possibly have promise, but this salad was very unimpressive and disappointing. I make such awesome creative and delicious salads myself and it's pretty easy, I just don't get it when a place that sells them for a living puts out something like this, especially when it seems they make a lot of stuff Yelpers enjoy.
author: T J.

description:
Ah, beware if you need to rely on this company. And let's face it, most of us will need assurances that the company will follow through on our orders, right?!?

Short story - I am out of state and needed a nice boxed lunch delivery to a group of executives in SF for a meeting. Emailed my order with almost 48 hours notice, then called the company the next morning attempting to confirm. They stated they could not confirm until the end of the day, meaning the evening prior to my event. I noted that I was in a different timezone, as I mentioned in the order, and requested that they not call very late as I had a meeting.

Sure enough they called during the meeting. As if that were not bad enough, they told me that "Sorry, we are really busy tomorrow and can't deliver your 10 lunches." I have never heard of a company telling me they did not want to sell me their food. 

Needless to say they have totally screwed me as I am in another timezone with almost no time left to reschedule another lunch for my group, so I will be left with the most basic of options for delivery at this point. Totally unprofessional and unacceptable and I will pass this info along to all my coworkers in our NorCal offices.
author: K D.

description:
After hearing so many good things here, I finally got a chance to stop by for lunch. This is not your traditional sandwich shop.

Prosciutto and mozzarella on sour dough bread did not fail boxed food company's notoriety. The creamy aioli had hints of lemon that paired well with the thin slices of prosciutto that was surprisingly filling. I was excited for the next bites. 

The sandwiches comes with a tiny morsel of salad with a light balsamic dressing. 

Most friends I've brought here were impressed. The best part: they have fast service.
author: Becky Q.

description: One of the best olive oil salads and steak Panini's I've ever had. The best part is that it's all organic!
author: Fernando S.

description:
They had yummy sound selections of pan inis and salads, but everything was pretty expensive and they don't sell half sandwiches.

I got the Turkey Artichoke Panini. It tasted good but didn't blow me away and was over $10.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
On our last day in the old office building I decided to go somewhere I'd been wanting to go for months: Boxed Foods Co.

The line out the door had been a deterrent in the past, so I went a little early, around 11:40 and voila! no line.

I ordered the tofu and noodle salad, sat down at a table to wait, and before I had finished my game of iPhone sudoku, my salad was ready. 

I have to say I was a little disappointed. Why is there so much apple in this salad? It's weird. There wasn't enough dressing to toss the whole thing, so as I got down the bottom half of my salad my lettuce was dry which was not great.

That said, the top half was quite tasty. The dressing is nice and "zingy", the noodles are what I hoped for, and the tofu is cubed into small bites which makes it easier to eat. I really liked the addition of the peanuts. 

So, I'd give the salad 2.5 stars and the service 3.5 stars for an overall solid 3 star rating.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I walked back to my office, clutching a compostable box with a $9 sandwich from the Boxed Foods Company, and all I can think of was, "Geez, is this sandwich really nine bucks?"  Don't get me wrong, I  don't actually have a problem with $9 sandwiches per se.  Deli Board, for example, has sandos for nearly $10.  The Sentinel is the same way.  And I would even pay extra for sandwiches at Naked Lunch (Sigh, if only it was closer to the FiDi).

But standard-sized sandwiches priced over $7 usually have a redeeming factor, something special that makes them stand out, and I was disappointed that I failed to find that special factor here.  

On a positive note, the Honey Lime Avocado Chicken sandwich was pretty good.  The tangy lime taste mixed in perfectly with the avocado.  Pretty good, except that the chicken was not tender enough, the bread was a little tough, and the sandwich was much too cold.  

Boxed Food Co. does use quality, organic, locally grown ingredients...which is always a laudable feature, but often leads to higher priced items when the added costs get passed on to us.  I hear they serve Blue Bottle Coffee, so I'll certainly find my way back for that. 

Overall, three stars is too harsh for BFC, but I think it falls a little short of four, especially when you factor in value.  I'll likely make my way back to consider an upgrade.
author: Angel S.

description:
Love love love this place for two main reasons

1) Their Brie & Pear Panini is orgasmiclly delicious. Pretty sure I heard angels sing when I took my first bite of melty brie, grilled onions, pear, and walnut pesto....then I added bacon to it. Best decision Ive made :D It added just a little extra flavor to an already purrfect (meow) sandwich.

2) Jake- The wonderful smiling face that takes your order. Such a great guy and he has a great knowledge of their menus and offered me suggestions. He always remembers my name and we always have pleasant conversations which makes me smile. Honestly he is why I keep coming back. For those who work the management there GIVE THE DUDE A RAISE! 

All their sandwiches come with salads (yum!), the service is fast and friendly, and your meal comes in a wonderful compostable box that make it easy to take anywhere (which is great because there isnt much seating in the tiny little place). I like to walk over to the rooftop garden off Montgomery and eat my heavenly meal there. Two thumbs way up my friends.
author: Paige M.

description: I've gone to Boxed Foods several times in the past and enjoyed their offerings despite the sorta-high price tag. (In the past, I ordered the brie & pear panini, the roasted veggie salad and the Caesar salad). I just went again today after a 4-month hiatus, and I don't think I'll be returning. I got the brie-pear-pesto panini again, and the whole sandwich smelled rotten -- it was wafting out through the box on my way back to the office. I've had it several times in the past, so I know what it's supposed to smell like. Back at the office, I took apart the sandwich to inspect all the ingredients separately, and both the apples and the pesto smelled completely off. They were also both discolored -- the apples were brown and the pesto was a weird yellow color. Dubious about all the ingredients, to be honest. Paid an awful lot for an inedible lunch... I'll take my chances elsewhere.
author: Shannon L.

description: Their food is great, but portion sizes are pretty inconsistent. Sometimes you'll get a half filled salad box, which for $10 is a total ripoff. I hope they can fix this because everything I've had there is delicious and they are friendly people.
author: Charles K.

description:
The roasted veggie salad is currently my favorite salad of all time. That being said, I haven't tried the chicken salad because I'm so in love with the roasted veggie (I date exclusively when it comes to salads). For reference, my previous favorite was the quinoa salad from Fleur De Sel; we are still friends. 

The salads come in a cute, brown, cardboard box so the name of the place does not disappoint. Service is really fast, don't let the lines intimidate you. Also, there is extra seating if you go all the way inside to the alleyway, and most people seem to take their food to-go.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Highlights: 
- Honey Lime Avocado Chicken Sandwich:Whoever thought of this was genius. Sweet and savory with just the right amount of tang. It came in a compostable box with a side of mixed greens, mini sauce container of vinaigrette, and a grapefruit wedge. 

Improvements:
- Boxed Chicken Salad: Grilled chicken, field greens, cherry tomatoes, onions, apple, bacon, and apple vinaigrette. It was forgettable, I don't get the hype. 

- Root Veggie Salad: Roasted parsnips, carrots, beets, goat cheese, field greens, and balsamic vinaigrette. Loved the root veggies, but nothing special to note. 

- Salads and sandwiches range from ~$8.50-$9+ depending on add-ons. Pretty steep, but everything is organic. 

- Lines can get long during the lunch time rush and can wrap around since the store isn't really big. Waiting area is not too spacious either. 

Tip: You can add "love" to your order. I think it's code word for avocado, but that's what is listed on their menu. :)
author: Tracy T.

description: I've only been here once, but the honey-lime chicken sandwich was SO good, I had to give the place five stars. That might be one of the best sandwiches in the area, and I like to think of myself as a sandwich connoisseur. They are efficient and friendly, and I got my sandwich only minutes after ordering. I like their drink selection and while the sandwich was large (not complaining about that!) it didn't leave you feeling super full or heavy. I will be back to try other items on the menu.
author: Regina L.

description: Great lunch spot. I love the boxed food chicken salad (and the sandwich version of it). Super good salad dressing & chutney, none of these thick dob of dressing that sometimes accompanies one's salad in other lunch places. Fresh ingredients. I'm never disappointed coming to Boxed Foods. There are also 4 small tables in the back (very hidden around the stair case) if one wants to sit in the sun between 11.30 and 12.30pm (before the clock moves forward in March). For the sandwiches with Focaccia, the bread to middle layer ratio is too large to be satisfactory.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Just bought the rooted veggie salad and it was amazing.  They seriously have the freshest ingredients. Also they really pack an equal amount of different veggies in their salads, not like some other places that give 80% lettuce greens and 20% veggies; boxed foods co salad prices are worth it.  And to add to my salad I got a mint infused lemonade / lemonmint as a recommendation by the cashier, and it was perfect.  Friendly staff, good quality food, and good organic drinks.  Come by and try!
author: Tes ..

description: One of my favorite lunch spot in the Financial District. I have been here about 5 times and every time it gets better and better. I recently had the Chicken Panini and WOW!!!! By far one of the best sandwiches I have had in a while. They load up the sandwich with lots of sundried tomatoes, goat cheese, a large portion of chicken and other ingredients as well. One of the first times I ordered a sandwich and I was pleasantly surprised when they included a small salad with your sandwich order. If you want a delicious , healthy and fast lunch Boxed Foods Company is a must!!!
author: Isabell D.

description:
First of all, nice boxes.  I like the removable, clear top and wide opening so it's easy to eat out of.  

Second of all, good sandwiches.

I literally have not eaten a BLT in over 10+ years due to the fact that my dad made them ALL the time.  And by that, I mean every Saturday.  So I only had one picture of what a BLT tasted like and it was already soured through repetition.  It always upset me on how insubstantial they felt with the measly piece of crispy meat (but don't get me wrong, I love bacon).  

So kudos to Boxed Lunch for redeeming this sandwich.  

The thick bacon combined with the crunchy bread requires a jaw accustomed to chewing beef jerky.  This sandwich isn't for you delicate eaters, soup drinkers, older folk, or denture wearers.  The latter may work since you have new and unbreakable teeth.

Anyhow, the garlic aioli does some wonder to this.  And another prop for including really light dressing with the side salad.  I like to know there are delicious choices other than the fat/cream/lard based kind.

I know it's because of all the businesses and working peeps, but there are way too many sandwich/salad places around here.  Come on people - let's be a little more innovative in our offerings.  At least Boxed Foods produces some good stuff.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Knoll was giving our company a textile presentation and they ordered lunches for us from the Boxed Foods Company. I chose the tofu salad and I really liked it. The dressing was good, the only down side of the salad was the rice noodles. It was too hard and it tasted undercooked.

Not sure about the price since it was bought for us, but I'll return again myself to try the tofu salad again.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Nailed it. I went there for the first time yesterday and was really pleased with my salad. The food was fresh (and fast) and the service friendly. My chai was tasty, too. 

The portion size was perfect (if not a little extra) and felt bargainous at $10.
author: Dee M.

description:
Pros: Plenty of healthy options like salads, delicious salad dressings, paleo friendly, fresh and high quality produce, usually friendly employees

Cons: The amount of protein you get on the salad is meager, especially for the price, and there is always a line at lunch time (but I suppose you could view that as a good thing!).

I put 3 stars at first, but thinking about the other workweek lunch options in downtown San Francisco... changed it to 4.
author: Lauren D.

description: I don't do many reviews, but this place is well deserving of one. The most different sandwich combinations that are RIDICULOUSLY GOOD!! A must try sandwich shop! Nectarine Panini blew me away!!
author: Kevin D.

description:
Love this place! This is a must as far as lunch spots in the city go.

I ordered the honey lime chicken with avocado. All the different flavors blended together perfectly and it was delicious. My friend and I sat in the back where they have outside seating. It's very quaint. There was a small art gallery right across from us and it's a really relaxing environment.

It tends to get busy during lunch hour so expect to wait a bit.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I rarely eat sandwiches anymore because reasons. It's hard to find a good restaurant salad that won't make you feel totally ripped off. I get it, most people who are eating salads want to feel like they are eating food but are actually just consuming something that has a lot of volume, but that's not me, boo. The greens in a salad is just filler, what I'm really after are the fats and proteins.

Enter the Boxed Chicken Salad. Herby chicken, bacon, apple slices, and avocado if you're feeling flush. It's one of the very few take out salads that are worth the money. 

The steak salad here is actually disappointing. I can make you one at my house that's better.
author: Maria D.

description:
So after reading all these reviews I decided to give this place a shot. I ordered the Boxed Chicken Sandwich and it came on a sesame bun with a side salad in a nice little box to go. The sandwich contained real(!) pieces of bacon, whole bits of chicken, pesto sauce, and slices of apple. The side salad was a nice touch to the sandwich and the dressing was light and on the side which is what I wanted. I ordered a BLT for my co-worker and he commented on how fancy the sandwich was so extra point for that. Their food is solid here and I am satisfied with their portions.

I feel kinda ripped off with their sodas and juices (no price tag either) :(. They are QUITE expensive!!! Avoid any cold drinks here.

There is seating here and they will bring you your food if you tell them you're dining in. Also they have an outdoor patio which goes into Claude Ln.
author: Tim G.

description: Blue bottle coffee. No line!!!  Didn't try the food yet, but I'll be back.
author: David L.

description: Food is fine. Service sucks and slow as can be. Oder was over 30 minutes late from ordering online and not even apologetic. If you have a meeting or anything important to do don't go here.
author: Matt W.

description:
I got someone else's order but mistake. So I didn't get my first choice - the  honey lime chicken with avocado sandwich - which would explain some of my whining in this review... pardon me. 

Sadly, that someone else was health conscious and I had to eat a salad. Sigh... Why??? Not that I had anything against salads. I just prefer not to eat like a bunny when I can. 

I think I had a chicken salad with bacon bits.
