1. The salad dressing tasted weird. It was a musky, mustard yellow and smelled funny . I had a little taste but didn't like it so I ate my salad NAKED which ended up being pretty dry since my greens were sadly, not romanian lettuce!!! 

2. The chicken chunks were actually pretty tasty. Marinated in some sort of herb and mayo mix (but not too much of course, this was a healthy salad). Sadly, they gave sooo little of the good stuff. My chicken was out before 3/4 of my salad was gone and so did my resolve to finish it. 

3. Bacon bits were ok. A tad bit too oily and counterproductive to this healthy meal. Not a big fan of bacon but I had had better.
author: Amanda L.

description: I won't be back here the Cesar salad dressing is really sour not good. The salad was 10$ and no chicken. It's an extra $4 for chicken.
author: johnny W.

description:
I'm glad I found this little place. I stopped by for lunch around 2PM and there was only one other person in front of me. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and it took only a few minutes to get my order.

None of the vegetarian sandwiches or salads sounded very appealing to me, so I ordered the B.L.T.A minus the bacon - it was delicious! The heirloom tomatoes were sliced thick and very juicy. The garlic-citrus aioli that comes with it is what made the sandwich for me. I was also pleasantly surprised to find it came with a lightly dressed salad on the side. It was $10 even, which I find to be very reasonable considering the prices charged by all the other FiDi lunch spots.
author: natalie b.

description:
I was visiting the San Francisco/San Jose area this past weekend.  I had some time to kill in San Fran and was walking around Union Square.  I did a little research before my trip and decided to try this place out. 

I ordered the chicken panini.  They only had foccacia left, as it was the end of the day. It was around 2 pm and they close at 3 pm.  It had a sun-dried tomato and olive tapenade which I surprisingly enjoyed eventhough I'm not a fan of olives. I really enjoyed my sandwich, however I think it is a bit overpriced for the amount of food you get (unless I'm just unaccustomed to what things cost on the west coast).  The side salad seemed like 4 leaves of lettuce and a tablespoon of dressing on the side.  The size of the sandwich was also small.  I don't necessarily mind the size because I don't want to feel heavy and like I've overeaten after a mean, but I don't think there's enough product for the price.  Overall, I enjoyed my lunch.
author: Candi D.

description: This place has good sandwiches. The pear+brie sandwich, and the beet hummus sandwich are both very nice. I like the panini toasting and added salad, and compostable packaging. The prices aren't bad, but aren't amazing, and the quantity of food is sufficient but not large. Overall, I'd go here over Sentinel, but not more than once a week.
author: Gatoatigrado A.

description:
This place is interesting.  The line goes out the door during lunch.  I had training in the city the other day and my coworker took me here.  Interesting sandwiches!  

I had the Boxed Chicken Salad sandwich.  They throw in some shoe string apples in there.  Adds good texture to the sandwich and a little juiciness.  Pretty good.  If you like off the way stuff, try this place out.  No where to sit inside, we took our food across the way and sat on the rooftop.  Really secluded and quiet.  Pretty nice on a sunny day.
author: Richard N.

description:
This review is for the coffee only.  

I ate at a place close by with some friends and needed a pick me up before going back to work.  One of the people I was with recommended the coffee here.  There are a number of "chain" places close by and I always like to try the independent places. 

Coffee -- I had the "drip coffee".  This was truly "drip" coffee where they place the grounds in a filter, put it into one of those single drip plastic holder and place the holder on top of the cup for the drip process.  I like coffee and usually when trying a place I get a black coffee so I can taste the coffee and not douse my buds with sugar, cream or any other assortment of flavors.  Verdict:  Coffee was smooth, no bitterness, no sense of any acid, no burnt taste.  This was good.  I know some people like their coffee to grown hair on their knuckles but I prefer something that is smooth and has some taste.  This was good coffee.  NOTE TO SELF:  It is drip coffee so you are going to wait.  Just know that and you will be fine.

On a different note -- my buddy had the Cappuccino.  She has had a few in her day and as we sat back at work I could hear her say -- this is one of the better Cappuccino's I have had.  Ok -- I need to try something mixed now.  

Try the independents -- be patient -- and enjoy the drink.
author: PNotHere E.

description:
Really great organic, fresh ingredients at this place! During lunch the line is always out the door, but it goes by pretty fast.

Not good for groups, there are only a few tables and they only seat 2.

The coffee is really good!

Meals are decently/larged sized, large enough so that you eat everything you might enter a food coma. Not really, but you will leave very satisfied!

All of their foods are priced right around $9.

Sandwiches come with a mediocre side salad. The sandwiches are good, but I'm a sucker for great bread, and the bread is good but not great here. 

All in all, if you work in the area it's worth eating at a couple times a month, not a bad dish on the menu.
author: Kortni S.

description:
line out the door at the moment.

panini was good but a little burnt. still tasty and nice staff.
author: Jack D.

description:
beware - the prices listed on the online menu are all about two dollars cheaper than the menu in the store.

i will remove this review when the store changes the menu on the yelp site to reflect this inconsistency.
author: Scott H.

description:
If you hit this spot during the mid lunch time be prepare to wait. But they work fast and if you have to wait it's still worth it. The secret of any good sandwich is bread. And Boxed Food Co. knows their breads. Delicious combos of food. 

Whoever switched the salad dressing from balsamic to your new sour lemon thing is a complete idiot! Because of that salad dressing switch you are losing half of my usual business. Bring back the balsamic dressing!!!
author: Xela H.

description:
Ehhh

Boxed Foods Company would received a higher rating if their plate proportions were adequate. I understand that making fresh and organic food is expensive but at least leave me full by the time I'm done eating. I used to order the roast beef a lot here but then got tired of it and moved on to their chicken panini which didn't really amaze. The one thing that I really dislike about this place is that half of their menu is sold out by the time I get there. I don't think a restaurant should sell out of anything if you have people waiting in line for it. 

Their coffee on the other hand is pretty amazing and I don't even drink coffee! The location of this place is good and the staff is rather friendly. I have yet to try their salads but I always hear people raving about them. The is a line out the door always and it's kind of annoying. They don't take that long getting your food ready so that's a plus. 

Again, ehhhh
author: Javier G.

description:
Really fresh and tasty.  The honey-lime chicken avocado sandwich was just great.  

You really taste the honey and lime flavor, and although the chicken was a little dry, it was really good.  The focaccia bread was very tasty, but I thought the bread to other stuff ratio was probably a little high.  I had a couple bites at the end of one half of a sandwich that were pretty much just bread. 

The sandwiches come with a small green salad, which had a tasty dressing and a little cheese on top. Also a couple orange slices, which were good also.

I thought the price fo 8.75 was justified by the really good combination of ingredients.  Certainly not a great deal, but for FiDi, it fits right in with nearby places.  I look forward to coming back to sample more of their tasty sandwiches.
author: Dave S.

description:
I just had possibly the BEST sandwich in the financial district and I can't wait to try everything on Boxed Food Company's menu, stat.

In a sea of many quick eateries in the area, one can be inundated with the decision should he/she step outside. It'd been a while since I worked in this exact location so I asked a colleague where I should go within a block or two most. I do not like walking far for lunch.

I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and *everything* about it was divine: perfectly shredded organic chicken mixed w/a very perfect amount of mayo and thyme, impeccably thin sliced green apples (great touch), a thin layer of pesto, and a slice or two of crispy bacon on incredibly delicious and healthy toasted whole wheat bread - potentially the best whole wheat I've ever eaten at a to-go joint.

The prices are high, but you know what? Completely worth it. They've got something special going on here... Kudos to the owner and the very friendly and efficient staff - had I signed my cc slip post food coma, they would have gotten a wee bit higher tip.

I love you, BFC!
author: Meredith R.

description: A great place for lunch in the fi-di. Come closer to noon and you won't have to wait so long :-). But they have healthy sandwiches and salads, all for $10. I've had their beet panini (though it's more of a beet sandwich than a panini) and this asian noodle salad. Both were filling, staved off my hunger and made me feel healthy about myself :-). The next thing I've eyed on their menu that I want to try is their Brie & Pear panini. Mmmm brie :-).
author: Christina C.

description: The perfect salad! I'm usually not the type of person to buy a salad at a restaurant, because most of the time it ends up being very basic and unsatisfying. That's not the case with Boxed Foods Company. I got the boxed chicken salad, which comes with delicious greens (somehow just the basic greens taste better than anywhere else), juicy apples, grapefruit, pulled chicken and bits of bacon. The chicken is delicious on its own, which is again usually not the case with other salads where the chicken is not great on its own. I would even skip putting the dressing on, because the salad is that good. It makes me realize that dressing is really used to disguise the plain taste of other salads. Lastly I must note the great packaging that salad comes in, which makes it easy to toss and eat anywhere without making a mess.
author: Leon R.

description:
Yummy chicken boxed salad - even though they were out of shredded chicken, the grilled chicken, bacon, apple, greens, and apple champagne vinaigrette was hearty, filling, and still really light. I enjoyed the small grapefruit slice instead.

I really loved the vibe and conscientiousness of the company (everything is compostable yay!) and the food tasted really fresh. 

Great lunchtime spot.
author: Andrea B.

description: Busy slightly before noon. Healthy, quality options and proper perorations at a fair price. Good vegetarian selection.
author: Sara P.

description: 4 stars for the cookie, 1 star for the coffee.  Lukewarm and watered down.  I guess the strawberry blonde who made the coffee today is still learning how to make coffee.  Too bad I'm the one who had to be the guinea pig.
author: Charlie B.

description:
Had lunch with a friend at BFC last week. Absolutely delicious sandwiches! Go for the honey lime chicken but make sure you add bacon. It's worth the extra $2. There are tables, but I recommend taking your sandwich to go and walking over to Crocker Galleria or somewhere outside to eat. 

My only gripe with this place, aside from the fact that their sandwiches are a little on the pricey side, is that they run out of things frequently. Get there before 1pm and you're fine, otherwise, you might be out of one or two of your fav ingredients.
author: Nina W.

description:
This is why i shouldn't write a review when i am extremely hungry and mad..

I don't know what to say.. so disappointed!

I went to this place few times before and always ordered honey lime chicken sandwich, it was good at least everything what i expected from the reviews.

Today i was craving the honey lime chicken sandwich and for $10.00, at least it should be edible. I was so angry, disappointed and vowed i would not go back to this place again. What went wrong? so many things..

- The bread they gave me was cold, hard, and inedible (it shouldn't be served to customers like that you know very old bread, i feel like eating cardboard, just one bite i threw all away) 

- ok i thought maybe the rest would be at least edible.. . again.. few slices of dry hard very cold (again cold) bland chicken and one huge lettuce.

no need to say, i threw all away.. so angry & mad.. never ever go back here again..  

At least if you know the bread is not fresh and good anymore and you don't have enough chicken on the sandwich just tell me so ,. then i could come back tomorrow.. rather than selling it and lost a customer..
author: sofie W.

description: We walked around union square. Got hungry but couldn't go to a fancy restaurant. We have a 3 year old. So we went to the mall food court. It looked promising. Clean, fresh and friendly faces.  The food is not bad. But not good either. We like the fresh lemonade strawberry juice.  The flavor I chose for my box was vinaigrette. Maybe it was the wrong choice. There are others. I got shrimp and chose chicken for my 3 year old. Shrimp pieces were good. But that was it.  My daughters chicken was overcooked. I was very disappointed with flavor.  I may return and try another flavor or a sandwich.
author: senora T.

description:
No clue what I wanted to eat today. I saw this place on Yelp. Walked by it a couple of times. I got very lucky today because no one was really inside at 12pm, but also the FiDi was pretty quiet due to the Good Friday observance from some. 

I walked in and the place is very quaint and clean. They have a huge chalkboard that is their menu. I had so many choices and I had just looked at their menu on-line; but in the end I ordered their Grilled Flank Steak Sandwich. It is flank steak, tomato, lettuce and a horseradish aioli served on an Acme sourdough bread. With it is a small side salad with a yummy, but unknown house dressing.

The food is quite good here, however, the flank steak could of been marinated a little bit longer as I felt that there was more flavor in the tomato than there was in the meat. The bread was grilled to near-perfection; crunchy but not hard. At first, when I opened up the box, I thought that this was too much food, I am actualy quite pleased at the portion that I had. 

Definitely be back in the future. Maybe sneak in a dessert if I really want to get "crazy" with it.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I called and asked the girl who answered the phone if they had walnuts in all their pesto's, because it is NOT listed that way on the menu. One item says "pesto" another says "Walnut pesto"? She was rude and short and just said yes then hung up.

my throat is closing, lips are numb and it feels like I just took a razor blade to the roof of my mouth. 

Thanks.
author: Nancy B.

description: A decent place for hearty, healthy sized salads with a Fi-Di price to match. I ordered the boxed chicken salad for $9. Salad was a really large portion, definitely shareable for 2 people. While I enjoyed the freshness of the salad, the protein topping (pulled chicken) was what killed it for me. It was tough, almost as if it was day-old chicken that had been re-served as an afterthought. I may come back to try new salads,but for now the food's pretty non-descript by my lunch standards.
author: Monelle A.

description:
Great lunch spot that I stumbled upon with a good selection of sandwiches and salads. The restaurant looks like a coffee shop that serves food. This place gets pretty packed for lunch so I recommend coming before 12 to beat the rush and not have to wait outside. 

I recommend coming here if you are looking for a lunch spot.
author: Elliot T.

description:
Organic and sustainable is gospel that too many follow on blind faith without question.  I think it's a great thing, but restaurants should not get a free Yelp rating pass based on that alone.  "A-OK" is how I feel about this place, but it's definitely no "Yay! I'm a fan."  Boxed Foods Company is like so many other higher end sandwich places in the FiDi: limited menu innovation and modest execution.

BLT: The bacon was not freshly prepared, which takes away from a BLT because you don't get excess bacon juice dripping on your bread, the bacon texture tends to harden as time passes and the fatty part doesn't taste as nice when cold.  The bacon, which is the star of the sandwich, was plentiful though and I found nice bacon surprises falling into the side "salad" several times.   The roll was more substantial than thinner toast versions, but thankfully the tasty garlic mayo was heaped on to moisten the bread.  The tomato and lettuce were fresh and worked well despite the fact that lowly iceberg lettuce was used.

Side Salad: What a misnomer!  Since when did "salad" become a bunch of mesclun with some vinaigrette dressing?  It's a nice gesture to throw in a little extra with your sandwich, but fails on execution.  So many appetizing vegetables, cheeses, nuts and fruits are available on the salad menu that it seems miserly not even to put a sprinkling of something on the side "salad".
author: Adam B.

description:
Good spot for a Sandwich if you are downtown. 

The Honey-lime Chicken and Avocado Sandwich with garlic-citrus aioli is great. Very good, but somewhat messy and difficult to eat. 

I will say, another reason for my A-OK review, is they say each sandwich comes with a side salad and fresh fruit. When they say fresh fruit, they literally mean one strawberry or an orange slice. I honestly don't even care about the fruit, but it is just so lame to even list it. 

If you come around noon, you may be in line for a bit.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Oh mah gah!  The lime-honey-chicken-avocado yumness (sandwich) that I put in my mouth this afternoon was so tasty that I was compelled to write a review

I had been to this lunch spot once before and that time ordered the chicken salad sandwich.  While the quality of the ingredients was very high, the flavor just wasn't there.

This time I got the same quality but a way more flavorful menu item. They make sandwiches here the way I would make a sandwich at home - all the basics with something a little extra/unexpected thrown in.  

Though at home, the something unexpected is usually whatever is left in my fridge.

Oh their business cards are kinda great too. Only downside is the inevitable line.
author: Cliff C.

description:
Love love love this place. The salads are DELICIOUS - great ingredients, great quality, and all around $8 (unlike a certain other salad place other fidi folks love). Great go-to lunch spot. 

Also, you can grab your food and head out to the back and eat at some tables on Claude Lane on nice day.
author: Gillian M.

description: This is one of my favorite lunch spots in the FiDi.  The food here is fresh and clean, and very delicious.  My favorite sandwich is the Honey-Lime Chicken and Avocado Sandwich.  In the past, I have had some great salads, but rarely, do I find it filling.  When I get the Boxed Chicken Salad (grilled chicken, lime, olive oil, cherry tomatoes, green apples, bacon, etc.) here, I feel like it is clean and filling...even the bacon tastes non-greasy.  FORGET COLONICS...get lunch here and you will feel clean and refreshed without doing any of that costly gross stuff!
author: Ally W.

description:
This was my first time here, and I ordered the grilled chicken salad based on the great reviews on it. 

They ran out of bacon, so they offered to replace it with avocado or prosciutto. I chose avocado in an attempt to be healthier. When I got back to work with my salad, I realized they didn't put the avocado they offered me. Nor were there any cherry tomatoes or onions that the salad was supposed to have, according to their menu. Without those three items, my salad seemed pretty small, but the shredded chicken did make it a little bit better.

I'll still return to this place; I'll just make sure my salad is "complete' before I take it back to work next time.
author: Cheryl L.

description: I actually really like this place - the food is good and fairly priced relative to all of the other salad places - but the cashier there today (the scowling woman with the enormous nose ring) was so incredibly nasty - it sort of ruins the experience.  Usually the staff is super friendly - not sure where they found her.  UGH.
author: Diana M.

description: Great place for salads! We tried the Tofu and Noodle salad, and the Boxed Chicken Salad. Both were tasty and healthy, very fresh. Would definitely return :)
author: Eliza D.

description:
The problem with steak salads is that someone got the ridiculous idea that the only type of cheese that pairs well with steak is stinky and bleu. I am no fan of cheese with added Penicillium cultures so I usually steer clear of steak salads, or order them sans cheese.

Oh, but someone at Boxed Foods must've sensed my bacterium apprehension and instead paired their grilled steak salad with feta! Huzzah! Couple that with the generous, rare slices of steak and you have one happy MiRIAM w.!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Boxed Foods Company is a pretty nice lunch spot in the FiDi for a sandwich. It's mostly a to go kind of place since the seating on the inside is very limited. Maybe about 4 or 5 tables and 10 seats? I would also advise to head here before noon to beat the lunch rush. The lines literally go out the door here around noon.

The boxed chicken sandwich salad's made up with a mixed greens salad on one side and the chicken presto bacon sandwich on the other side. The sandwich was tasty, but the chicken was somewhat dry. There was the right amount of presto on the sandwich. Not too much and not too little. Overall, the sandwich tasted like chicken presto more than any other ingredients that was inside. I was kind of surprised to not be able to taste the bacon flavor. The salad greens were fresh and wasn't drenched with dressing.
author: Steven B.

description: I ordered the turkey panini. It was a good sandwich but a little on the dry side. I felt good eating it since this place uses good quality ingredients but it definitely wasn't anything spectacular. I have had better turkey panini sandwiches in the Fidi that also uses great ingredients.
author: Zannie S.

description: Just aight, the bread was too hard for my taste and there are too many other sandwich joints around this area.
author: Jess C.

description:
Decent little cafe located on a bustling block of Kearny Street. My tofu noodle salad was chock-full of sesame goodness, but was slightly lacking in the peanut department. It was still exactly what I was looking for, in terms of a healthy lunch. They use sustainable ingredients like a true SF establishment should.

On a TMI kind of note, I really lived up to the nickname I've earned among my friends (Ahem, "Creeper") because there were loads of good-looking male baristas to ogle. Gary Wright's "Dream Weaver" played on loop in my head, big time. What can I say? I like me a handsome man makin' my salad. Okay, that came out wrong...
author: Christina S.

description: Ordered the Box chicken salad based on seeing a photo from a user. It was delicious! Very good taste and filling!! Will def give it another try!
author: Kyle W.

description: I've been here later in the lunch hour a few times lately and have had weird experiences. Things kind of thrown together, no salad... Today I ordered a tempeh wrap and it came swaddled in iceberg lettuce. I said "but I thought this was a wrap" and the person said "yeah, a lettuce wrap." I said, well the menu should make that clear. And she said "well we've been doing it for like 9 years." Huh?? This place no haz been open for 9 years!!
author: Roxmarie M.

description: Came back today and was pretty disappointed with my salad.  It looks like there was a new person working, but my salad came out pretty sad.  I ordered the steak salad and all it had were greens, red onions, a small bit of feta, and 4 slices of steak.  WHat happen to the tomatoes and cucumbers.  For 9 bucks that's pretty unacceptable.
author: Steven H.

description:
I used to come to this place on a regular basis for their fancy sandwiches and salads. You place your order at the front counter and wait for your to go box, or ask to eat inside and they'll bring the plate to your table (they have 'outdoor tables' in the back alley way, just walk thru the hallway). I believe that I've tried everything on their menu including a few specials. The tofu and noodle salad is disappointing, but I'm not a vegetarian, so maybe someone else would like it. I liked the Boxed PLT (crispy Prosciutto) better, before it became the Boxed BLT (Bacon). But the menu still includes a prosciutto asparagus panini. I was a fan of the red and golden beet salad when that was on the menu a while back. I even let them make me whatever they wanted with their "chicken trust-me" option. That novelty wore off after a while of getting similarly tossed chicken salads.

My favorites are:
- Honey-lime chicken and avocado sandwich
- Boxed chicken salad sandwich (it's a non-mayo version, chicken tossed with olive oil, Granny Smith apples, bacon and spices)
- Pear and brie grilled sandwich
- Boxed BLT

Prices are high (+$9 per item, without drinks), but I'll pay if I can get good quality food.

My rating is only 3 stars, because compared to the past (4 stars), now the food preparation often has inconsistent quality, is sloppy, and SKIMPY (ie. stingy portions of some ingredients in salads or sandwiches, often a thin sliver of bread crust in my salad instead of the 2 pieces of bread I used to get), so now I seldom come here. 

Gregoire in Berkeley, has a similar upscale boxed food-to-go operation, but serves MUCH better food for LESS (~$7, and they're NOT stingy). If you find yourself in Berkeley's "Gourmet Ghetto" area give them a try.
author: Luis C.

description:
Well... after roughly 30 months and 600 sandwiches in the SOMA/FiDi area since I first visited and reviewed Boxed Foods, I can confirm that the Turkey Artichoke Panini remains my favorite sandwich in San Francisco.

They've played around with the bread in that time and are currently working with sliced sourdough - the panini's best match yet.

Insider tip: the back patio is terrific on a sunny day and is rarely crowded.
author: Geoff D.

description:
Boxed foods is just down the street from my office, and I always see a line spilling out the front door, so I came into this place with really high expectations. 

I ordered the grilled chicken panino; it came with "fruit and salad" which turned out to be a tiny sliver of orange with more peel than fruit and a small serving of greens. Which would have been fine, if the sandwiches had been as amazing as the long line indicate. 

Unfortunately, the chicken was really chewy and difficult to eat. I ended up taking the chicken out of the sandwich and eating it separately with a fork. 

I would say it's overrated and overpriced, but I'm willing to give it another chance. 

My favorite part of this "meh" meal was the pink salad dressing.
author: Carolyn K.

description: Lines weren't that bad, so I jumped right in like a superhero to place an order. I didn't get time to Yelp, so I quickly decided on the turkey panini. I like the cheese they used, as it had a nutty flavor to it. Steep price though. Feels like a 3.75-star flavor sandwich experience...rounding up to a 4.0.
author: Derek N.

description:
Meticulously working my way through the menu here.  Definitely hits and misses, but overall very solid.  Boxed chicken salad or sandwich are up there, and the mozzarella and prosciutto sandwich gets a nod as well.  You are gonna spend $10, but hey its Fidi and that's what you do here for lunch.  Unfortunately, if you order one of the more meager sandwiches you are in for a heavy afternoon of snacking.

Compostable boxes, friendly staff, quick lunch.  Take it over to the park on Grant for a lovely lunch.
author: William B.

description:
They're not the only place in this neighborhood that will charge you $8 for a BLT, but they are the only place that actually gives you something you don't mind paying $8 for. The bread's not the best in the world, but it's good, and the homemade mayo bears no resemblance to that crap in the jars. 

Seating is sparse, but the employees are no more "ghetto" than you'll find in any kitchen anywhere in the world.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
Tried the boxed chicken salad and honey lime sandwich and both were quite tasty. All their menu are pretty simple in taste but I think the whole concept and presentation is what gives it an extra edge. Okay maybe the great dressing too- champagne viniegarette? why thank you for making me feel like such a fancy pants! 

Anywho its a pretty small place with limited seating inside. However theres much more seats in the back (walk towards bathroom and go up some stairs where you exit outside to an ally way). Lol alley way sounds iffy prob, but I actually liked it a lot! There's awesome art on the wall (posted a pic if your curious) and other surrounding restaurants with outside seating too. Reminds me of cute streets in Europe :)

Boxed Foods Co is worth checkin out- you won't mind thinking inside the box with your food here!
author: Cindy L.

description: I have been searching long and hard to find a quality sandwich in FiDi. The chicken salad sandwich at Boxed L. is a real contender. A variety of ingredients beginning with tasty chicken and ending with bacon. Sesame bun with some kind of mild but flavorful pesto is a real nice twist. It was ready in 10 seconds flat at 12 noon, but didn't taste like it had been hanging around in a cold case. I will be coming back to sample other items for sure.
author: A V.

description: Went here for lunch yesterday and it was pretty good! The line was long, but they managed it well. I had the chicken panini and it was great. The tapinade and goat cheese were really flavorful. The chicken was thinnlh sliced so it was much easier to eat than some places where they put a whole slab of chicken. I wish they had whole wheat bread and put more salad in the boxes. Next time I will try the turkey panini.
author: Anna M.

description:
Stopped in there quickly today after a fabulous facial. The prices were on the higher side, but I thought I try them out. $10 for a lime-chicken sandwich with avocado and a water. The sandwich tasted soooo good. Upon request, they pressed it a little bit, so it was a bit warm and crisp on the outside.
The salad came with it's dressing on the side (just the way I like it). 
The sandwich was flavorful but not to greasy or salty..you can tell the ingredients are fresh. The service was fast and very pleasant.
author: Mimi T.

description:
This is a great place for lunch! Well, for take out lunch since there aren't a lot of seating. Maybe 3 or 4 tables? I am came with one friend so we were able to find seating for two in the back of the store. 

The sandwich I had was really good. I got the Boxed Chicken Sandwich ($8.50?) which had a lot of flavor because of the pesto, but the chopped cucumbers gave it a more fresh and clean taste. I also loved the salad that came with it because it goes really well with the sandwich. 

Overall, it was a great meal and the portions were a good size, especially with the salad. I was full after the first half of the sandwich, but my friend was able to finish his with a satisfied stomach. I would definitely go back to try the others.
author: Julia K.

description:
Small beet sandwich, $10.
Ingredients seemed fresh or lightly prepared.
At 1pm, wait about 15 minutes.
Few tables, for two only.
author: Ethan K.

description:
Just came back from Boxed; for the first time not pleased with my experience.  

To be positive, the service is just as good.  The staff are friendly and professional.  Much appreciated!  

On to the negatives.  I ordered a prosciutto and mozzarella panini.  I had barely walked away from the counter after ordering and paying, that they (out of character) called out my order (instead of my number, which they usually do).  I took my order happily and walked back to my office, only to discover that the paniniwas cold.  Not just luke warm, COLD.  No heat at all.  

Obviously, this panini had been sitting around for a while behind their counter.  Obviously, Boxed wanted to unload the panini instead of taking a loss on a 9.00 sandwich.  Obviously I won't be coming back.  

It's one thing if the orders are close together to pawn off a mistake / no-show sandwich.  It's another thing when you are giving a formerly regular customer soggy, cold mozzarella, soggy, cold and FATTY prosciutto, soggy and cold BREAD, and even soggy, greasy, cold and wilty lettuce.  Not very delicious.  

Still giving it a 3 because there non-panini sandwiches have never failed me, and like I said, their staff are always polite.  And obviously, if the panini had been made fresh, I would have enjoyed it (I've had it before).  I am just turned off from this experience.  When they're busy, I am sure this isn't a problem.
author: Alison K.

description:
BLAND.

I've given Boxed Foods a couple of chances now and my taste buds have yet to be tickled. I always try for the most flavorful sounding things on the menu (Pulled Pork and Honey-Lime Chicken) and... nope.

Two stars for the nice boxes. That's about it.
author: Jason T.

description:
I really loved Boxed Foods Company, and it's one of my favorite places to get lunch in the Financial District.  California/San Francisco cuisine is so fresh and wonderful, and I often say that I'm so happy that the Financial District has great lunch fare that reflects this NorCal culture.

...But that really hinges on the fact that Boxed Foods Company is there to provide it!  Boxed Foods Company has delicious salads and sandwiches that are fresh and made from high quality, local ingredients.  Today, I just had the *turkey artichoke panino*, which was awesome.  It has turkey, asiago cheese, spinach-artichoke spread, and tomato, and all the sanwiches come with a nice side salad and a slice of orange to cleanse your palate.

I've had a number of their salads and sandwiches, and they never disappoint.  Make sure to keep on dropping in to try the seasonal offerings, too!

Lastly, it's great that they have Blue Bottle Coffee. :)
author: David W.

description: I ordered the Chicken Panini.   Waited about ten minutes,  get back to the office and it's  cold.    Think it would have been much better if it was warm.   A $9.00 sandwich should be done right.
author: Dennis N.

description: Honey lime chicken avocado sandwich was phenomenal. great quality of food and you get a small side salad with the paninis. would love to have this in NYC delivered
author: jaclyn g.

description:
This place has so many incredible sandwich and salad possibilities... 

I'm excited to come back and get some more.

There's a line extending outside during lunch but that won't stop me.  It's worth the wait.
author: Stephanie F.

description: I ordered their pear-brie sandwich and it was really tasty. Their sandwiches also come with a salad, and the box itself is compostable.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
This place is fantastic. Always fresh, never disappoints.Try the tempeh sandwich with roasted red peppers and olive spread- soo delicious. Sandwiches come with a sweet lil salad on the side and the entree salads are all amazing.
They have a smallish seating area, so keep in mind. And the line can get killer during lunch time but it is worth it- trust me.
author: Winni D.

description:
Not quite bought into the four star hype. The turkey artichoke panini immediately caught my attention on the menu, and I was hoping for some mind-blowing combination of the two ingredients. Instead, the artichoke was part of a spread (good, but would have loved the real thing), and the turkey was bland. The final build was good, but could have used more veggies. Side salad was some greens and not much else.

To be fair, the panini didn't last long, likely due to late lunch hunger. Far from a bad sandwich, but it's not cheap. There are better values around.
author: Jason B.

description:
Let me start off this review saying that I was very skeptical of a place that charges $9 for a sandwich in an area where the market is well saturated.  This place has a real modern hippie vibe to it and I really thought that I was going to be getting a regular old sandwich with some organic salad on the side and not come back.  Boy was I wrong.  I had the lime-honey-chicken-avocado and it was fantastic!  I think they must use a sugar based marinade on the chicken because there was the perfect combo of sweet and savory.  The avocado was like icing on the cake too.  Really a fantastic sandwich.

I can't speak to the whole menu, but the one thing I had was amazing.  I'll definitely be back.  My wallet might not thank me at $9 a sandwich, but I think it was worth it!
author: Brian G.

description:
Best lunch spot in the Financial District, hands down. 

The menu only contains salads and sandwiches but they're delicious, fresh, and made with local, organic ingredients. Available beverages include iced teas, sodas, kombucha, and espresso.

The line during lunch is always out the door but it goes rather quickly and the food is well worth the wait. Grab a sunny table out back and take a break from the hustle and noise on Kearny.
author: Sharman O.

description: Cool concept, but they were a very little heavy handed with the sun dried tomato sauce on their sandwich. Bread is okay and the salad dressing was too acidic.
author: Lanny N.

description: Our company used their services last week for a luncheon we were holding. The delivery showed up right on time. The manager who was delivering the order was friendly and accommodating. The day before we called in a little late to make the order by the deadline and they still accepted it! In addition, the building we needed delivering to was slightly out of their zone, but they allowed it anyways. We really (and I mean really) appreciated their willingness to work with us. They went above and beyond the call of good service! Great company.
author: Reppify L.

description:
I love you boxed chicken salad! I don't know why it took me so long to find you - but I guess it's true what they say - "save the best for last"! After trying every damn salad shop in the financial district, being ripped off every time with crappy ingredients and high costs (mixed greens needs to get a clue and get off their pedestal), I finally found my one true (salad) love! You are amazing, I always want you in my life (at lunch time)! Don't ever change.

xoxo
Jesse
author: Jesse V.

description:
After having tried a variety of places near work up and down Kearny, I found this place which is my go to for the one or two days a week I decide to eat out rather than eat a packed lunch. My favourite:

Boxed chicken salad: Mixed salad, great piece of fresh bread, an orange slice for contrast, actual pieces of bacon, a chicken breast that was cooked whole and afterwards cut up (rather than a mix of processed chicken thrown on top). And of course, they tuck the napkin/cutlery in making it a good to go box. 

While you are waiting for your food after the first order you make, check out towards the back of the cafe where they have garbage bins to see what can be recycled, composted or thrown out. I preferred how they presented the boxed chicken salad to go rather than eating there on a plate (however to each their own).

The other food items such as the flank steak. I found that the actual steak to be under seasoned - this of course coming from a guy who loves Montreal steak seasoning (no bias given that I'm from there). I tried the panini as well and was not impressed (don't recall why). Try afew items, see what you like and run with it is my advice.

Other tips of note: 
I always went after 1300 to avoid the rush/line-up that sometimes went outside on the street, however you can call ahead to make your order (whether you jump the line to pay and pick it up is a decision for you to make, though you may want to consider how it would look to the rest of the line). 

They used to have half off pastries after 2PM (they close at 3 as I recall) which could work out for a small snack. 

No tax on cold food items like the boxed chicken salad, but anything that is heated like panini's, it will be added on.

Lastly, they are pretty good about receipts - if you pay by credit card, it's not a problem to get a second copy should it be some sort of work expense.
author: Kevin M.

description: I am new to SF, and on the lookout for decent salad places close to work (Union Square).  Boxed Foods is perfect!  I am eating a delicious Boxed Chicken Salad, with pulled chicken, apples, bacon, aioli, and champagne-apple vinaigrette.  Even at noon, it took under 10 minutes to order and receive my meal.
author: Rachel A.

description: there's always a line of people out the door, to whom i'd like to exclaim, "what are you, stupid?!"  very overpriced, under portioned, and underwhelming food.  among the culinary disappointments i've been subjected to over the years during company sponsored work lunches, are a tofu salad, honey chicken lime sandwich, and beet salad with steak.  the tofu tasted like the proverbial cardboard.  the chicken sandwich has come alternately on burnt sourdough or tasteless ciabatta and the so-called avocado was more like one of those watery quasi guacamole spreads.  the beet salad came with minimal beets and a ball of goat cheese that was impossible to distribute evenly throughout the salad.  blah.
author: Ash T.

description:
Boxed chicken salad sandwich all the way. My company likes to get boxed food to cater office lunches, and boy does that make me happy. Good food, friendly staff, average prices for financial district.

The coffee is pretty solid as well. They used to brew Blue Bottle but now source their own beans directly. If you get 10 punches on your loyalty card you can get a free cup of joe OR a 1/4 lb bag of beans, which is pretty cool.

PS - I love their branding!
author: Dan W.

description:
Favorite splurging lunch for sure. I usually bring lunch from home during the week but how can I say no my Friday Baken Tofu Salad with an extra side of dressing? 

That being said, this place is hit or miss. I have also had their Tempeh Salad/Sandwich - definite miss. Find what you like and stick with it!
author: Raina B.

description:
OK, this place is emblematic of everything I hate and love about SF. I love that they use local ingredients, have fresh baked breads, artsy/bohemian feel, etc. Yeah, I got it you're evolved, and that's a good thing. But loose the holier than now, snobbish attitude... your just a salad/sandwich place in downtown. SFr's have this ability to do the right thing, but want to make sure everyone knows about how great they are... have some humility. I thought you were all tortured souls because your baseball team was frak'n awful for so long... please, come back down to earth.

Must agree with other critical reviews... tofu salad; bland and tasteless, brie/pear sandwich is marginal. Again, great ingredients, but the delivery is off. Bread is not outstanding... tough and tasteless. The greens and diet coke were good though.

I also left wondering how we'd spent $25 for my wife and I to eat a sandwich and a salad... hmmm.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Boxed Foods' generic name belies its unique and delicious food, though I suspect the owners were trying to be ironic. 

Everything on the menu is worth getting.

The place has horrific lines during weekday lunches and there's not a lot of space to sit even in less busy times.

Tip: Legend has it that Boxed Foods is okay if you cut in front of everyone at line while talking on your cell phone. Be sure to pay by check or pennies. This injustice and added wait helps people soul search, build patience, and lets gastric juices strengthen.
author: Nik D.

description:
Best blueberry danishes ever! 

I've always loved danishes, but I only bought them sporadically because finding a good danish was always rare. When I went to Box, I decided to try their blueberry danish, and it was love at first bite. I'm not sure if they make their own pastries or buy them from someone else, but I've only tried this particular danish at Box. For some reason, I've been on a hunt to find a blueberry danish that is just as good at the one at Box, but it was to no avail.  It was even a waste of money to try. 

I haven't tried much aside from the blueberry danish and Americano's at Box, but if I ever do come across a danish even better than the one's at Box, I think I'd go weak in the knees.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Awesome spot for lunch. The friendly staff, quickly prepares your meal. The steak panini was great. The salad dressing for the small green salad was delicious! Nice to go around back and eat your lunch in their back patio seating area.
author: James L.

description: It's organic, fresh, simple and tasty. Staff is easy going - service is fast. Can't find much like it in SF financial district. Good portions for price. Something for everyone and they are very willing to customize your order. Salad and dressing changes weekly due to what is in season - what a concept! Today they had an heirloom tomato salad on arugula - with a soft mozzarella. It was really good. My only complaint is that they don't always have salt and pepper available - you have to ask for it.
author: Megan G.

description:
I get the same thing everytime at Boxed Foods: chicken salad sandwich. It's delicious, with little strips of green apples in it.

The salad on the side comes with a great lemon vinaigrette (or something) dressing.
author: Ben B.

description:
I used to love Boxed Foods.  They had healthy and tasty salads. 

I went in a couple months ago and was dissapointed to find all new staff, and poorly shaped food. I had ordered a veggie salad which had hardly any salad mix, or beets. Since I had been going to this place for years, I went to talk to the manager (at duty) a blonde women and asked her for a refund. 

She looked at me, and asked me what the problem was, I explained to her that the salad was poorly made, with hardly any salad mix, or beets. She looked at the salad again and said that she didn't see any problem with it, gave me a huge attitude and then refunded me. She didn't apologize, or ask to make another one, she was clearly extremely rude and unkind. 

Another customer saw the interaction and immediately told me to yelp this incident. He noted that it was astonishing for this manager to give me such a fit, when clearly 
I have the right to protest my order. He was also shocked at her rudeness, and in not believing me that this salad was not at par with any standards. He was also shocked to see how she responded to me.

I will not be going back to Boxed Foods. I used to lunch here every day since they opened, but was shocked to see how i was treated for returning something that I wasn't happy with. I have not returned since, and I hope people are mindful of the types of businesses they support. 

I've also seen an large rotation of their employees, and a couple of them have told me that they are underpaid. So i will continue to look for places that support organic agriculture, excellent food, fair employment practices and kind customer treatment. 

thanks.
author: patty s.

description:
The chicken sandwiches and steak sandwiches have never let me down. But, I tried the pear & brie sandwich today and ended up throwing the other half out. The bread was hard, too much pesto sauce, and I just was not a fan of the pear and brie combo.

The only reason I don't anticipate returning here is because I am now a vegetarian, so meaty sandwiches are not an option for me anymore. I would return otherwise.

Also, there tends to be a line during lunch, so I would say you can get in and out within approx. 15 minutes. Not the best place if you're in a rush.
author: Falyn J.

description:
Excellent coffee, salads and sandwiches.  However, especially excellent coffee.  Best in Fidi - hands down, no doubt.

So why only 4 stars?  The wait.  Don't come here if you're in a rush.  But run here if you want some of the best coffee / fare in the area.
author: Alex C.

description:
I was a little disappointed by Boxed Foods Company. My co-worker recommended it to me and I was pretty excited after reading the reviews.

It's pricey but you're paying for high quality ingredients and I like how they use Acme bread on their sandwiches. My big issues with Boxed Foods Company was that the food lacked flavor.

I got the chicken salad sandwich and it came with bacon and sliced apples in pesto. I was kind of expecting a more mayonnaise based chicken salad sandwich but it wasn't like that at all. It was a decent portion of chicken but I don't know why... I felt like it needed salt or additional flavoring. I ended up adding some jalopeno chips (kettle chips sold separately) to give it some crunch and flavor. I mean the sandwich has bacon in it... shouldn't that be enough flavor? I found it bland. The bun was kind of thick and made it difficult to eat.

My friend got the BLT and it was served on the Acme slab bread. He also thought the sandwich was lacking in flavor.

The portions aren't that big. I found myself still hungry afterward. For $8 you can go next door to working girls cafe and get a bigger sandwich for around the same price.
author: Jackie T.

description:
Okay so I came here thinking it would be an amazing salad but to be honest, it was kinda ehhh, a bit bland. Perhaps this is because it was super healthy - they only use organic greens and fresh, healthy ingredients like sliced granny smith apples and cypress grove chevre w/ champagne apple vinaigrette (huh?!). Granted I haven't tried the sandwiches so maybe those are more flavorful...but yeah, the Grilled Chicken Salad that I got was disappointing.

People rave about the Boxed Chicken Salad, but I don't know...sounds about the same as the Grilled Chicken one. Also salads and sandwiches range from $8-$9. For that amount, I'd rather hop over to Specialty's and grab a tasty Cobb Salad for less then $7...

So yeah, not worth the wait IMO. But try it for yourself...I don't think it's for everyone.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Boxed Food Company makes good sandwiches--sort of.  They come in a cute little box on good bread with good sounding trimmings.  Ingredients are fresh, organic and......THEY RUINED MY SANDWICH by putting a gross 1/2 green, 1/2 core tomato on it.  Come on already--everyone who looks at a tomato slice like that knows its place is the garbage not on a sandwich.  Unacceptable--especially at a place that charges almost $10 for a sandwich.  

I got the honey lime chicken sandwich.  It didn't taste like honey or lime and although the end product was decent, it was just a step above mediocre.   It is, however, one of the best sandwiches (with the exception of the DISGUSTING tomato) I've had in the FiDi.  But if you work here and eat out for lunch every day that rating doesn't say much.
author: Katharine A.

description: A go to spot for lunch.  Always call in your order during rush hour unless it's a nice day and you plan on sitting in the back.  Solid drip coffee.  I always get the Chicken Panini sandwich (minus the tomatoes obviously) with Pesto added in (goes well with the goat cheese).  I know 5 stars is a lot but the folks that work here really make this place go.
author: Abhay M.

description:
Hmmmm... I don't know how I should feel..

- Turkey Artichoke Panino $8 + tax
- Oi Ocha Tea (LOVE how they carry it) $2.35 + tax
Total was was $11.01 

I was REALLLY hungry, and wanted a filling lunch so that I could have a late dinner... yea.. I'm probably gonna have to get a 2nd mini lunch to make that late dinner..

Don't get me wrong, the sando was good.  I mean it's a panini...with a fattening spread on some deli turkey... hotly compressed together... no room for much error here.. according to my taste buds.

But my half filled stomach was still yearning for more food! Even after chugging down the bottle of Oi Ocha Green tea, to at least make me feel fuller... Maybe I'm just SUPER hungry today? 

My second qualm is the price.. I'm a ratio girl.  $ vs Taste Rating.  Less $ means I can be a lil more forgiving on the food. More $$$ means I expect this $h!t to be good!  For a $9 sando, I expected something like Naked Lunch or even Chez Carla (spicy chicken FTW!).. But instead I got a panini that I could have gotten at Fountain Cafe for like cheaper and more filling. 

Quality of food is good, price tag needs to adjusted, and portions enlarged, and I would totally frequent this place... but until then.. I'll give it a pass unless I really was craving for a sandwich and was restricted to 1 block from my work.
author: Deanna T.

description: Not somewhere I'd go to often because it's way overpriced, but its healthy and delicious, especially the honey-lime chicken and avocado sandwich. Get that!
author: Jonas T.

description:
From their salads to their sandwiches, everything here is SOLID. 

If you just want a regular drink, I'd go across the street to Walgreens to save a few cents, but that's me.  =)
author: Bootylicious J.

description:
After several years of working in this hood, I've finally tried out this joint.

Creative mixtures of fresh, sustainable/organic sandwiches and salads.  Very impressed by the tempeh salad- the tempeh was less fermented tasting than it usual and tasted more like a nice dense veggie burger patty.

Also, they have Blue Bottle!  I think prices are the same as Blue Bottle down in the Ferry Building.  That Gibraltar is the perfect quick and dirty caffeine boost.
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
I would say Boxed Foods Company is the best place to grab the morning joe in the FiDi. The "it's Ecco and not Blue Bottle" coffee is very, very good and the cappuccino is amazing. It's sooo creamy and velvety.

For lunch, the organic sandwiches, for me, I find a little boring, small and overpriced. It's not like a gag reflex bad. It's just that it doesn't invoke any strong taste stimulation when I take a bite. 

But definitely come for the cap!
author: Peter T.

description:
Quality of the Tempeh sandwich is good, and vegetarian options are available -- so why dump them into the two stars bucket?

Price and quantity.  14 dollars for a small sandwich is "crazytime".

Pros
Tempeh sandwich
kombucha available 
Cool boxes (Of course with a name like this, they better be cool)

Cons
Kombucha for $5+? ----- yikes!!!  I like the bioflora, but not at this price.
Another overprice sandwich.
author: Lost S.

description: Had their turkey artichoke panini the second time around and liked it a lot! It was the kind of hot pressed sandwich I had been craving for. It felt like a light sandwich, not drenched with sauce or loaded with bread - meaning you won't feel clogged arteries and there would be room for an after-meal snack.
author: Grace C.

description:
Grilled Chicken Salad- made with organic greens with apples tossed with light dressing.

It was healthy and tasty. The box was small but the salad was compressed inside. Surprisingly it was filling for lunch and I would definitely check out more of their items!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
What a let down. 

I wanted something different for lunch so I hit up yelp to search for a new eatery. Boxed Foods Company came with high ratings so I decided to check it out. Everything on the menu sounded fresh with organic ingredients. I was debating on the honey lime chicken or the flank steak. Ultimately I went with the flank steak because of the horseradish aioli and sour dough bread. Man I could not have been more disappointed when I sank my teeth in for the first bite. The sandwich had zero flavor. Was the steak not marinated? Did they not put in any horseradish in the mayo? The only saving grace was the steak was tender and the bread was fresh. 

I might come back here for the honey lime chicken.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I love the coffee very much, love it more then blue butte. 
although the coffee is amazing but the lunch it was ok, the all Ingredients  were really fresh just the bread was a little be hard for me to bit.
author: Helen L.

description:
The shop looks great from the outside, but food was ugh...!

We've passed by this joint many times and I'd always had it on my list as a must try - especially with the fresh organic ingredients.  Today's visit was a major disappointment.

I ordered the BLT - described on the menu as bacon, mixed greens, tomato, garlic aioli, served on Acme rosemary slab bread.  What I received was a sandwich with bacon that was cold and so dark it was almost black, this sandwich was dry as a freaking bone, even with aioli!  How do you screw up a bacon sandwich??!

S.B. ordered the Boxed Chicken Salad Sandwich, which again sounded great on the menu - chicken salad with walnuts, green apple, bacon, greens and pesto on a bun.  This sandwich was drier than the BLT!  No mayo in sight to give the thing even a bit of moisture.  We had to basically choke the thing down.

Both sandwiches, a San Pellegrino Aranciata, + tax came out to a little over $20.  C'est horrible!
author: Burrito M.

description:
Bing Cherry Salad.  Nuff said.

Especially good during the summer months when cherries are in season.

Wild arugula, caramelized shallots, humboldt fog chevre (mild goat cheese), toasted almonds, halved green cherries, bacon bits (real bacon!), and drizzled with strawberry balsamico.

Tangy, sweet, fruity, with salty cheese.  Can't lose.  

Peek the photos.

$8.00, however....
author: Isaac L.

description: Awesome!  Great sandwiches and salads.  They have Blue Bottle!
author: Jordan S.

description: I love food like this: Healthy, well thought out, freshly prepared, good ingredients simply prepared in an unpretentious environment. I also really like that they have a sort of waiting are where you can sit while you're waiting to take out your food. A+
author: Daniel B.

description:
Loveeeeeeee their salads. Salads are typically pretty creative. My favorite is their seasonal heirloom tomato and mozzarella salad which they don't have right now =/.  So instead, I'll typically get their chicken salad. The flank steak salad is interesting. It's a good interesting - definitely different. People working there are super nice, AND they have a coffee card =]. Sandwiches are good and filling.

My only suggestion for improvement: Bring back a mozzarella based salad even if it lacks heirloom tomatoes.
author: Sami A.

description: I've only been there once, but I really enjoyed the Honey Lime Avocado Chicken Sandwich. Super tasty.
author: Diana G.

description:
Boxed Foods is alright. I've never found their sandwiches or salads to taste that good - maybe I'm not an organic girl - I love me my pesticides -- they taste better than foods without.

I was walking by BFC yesterday and I saw that they were serving Blue Bottle Coffee. I decided to stop in -- not for the food -- but for the coffee. I've never had Blue Bottle coffee. I needed to check out what the hype was.

$3.50 for a latte? I had JUST complained about charging too much for a latte in my previous review. People, we're in a recession..
However, it is very important to note that the latte contained 2 shots. So that was like paying $3.50 for two lattes that would've cost $7. (I know, I'm great at math).

That latte was sooo incredibly creamy and delicious. Now, I know what the hype is about - I've come to see the light. Starbucks, you can get over yourself. 

The baristas here are also super sweet. My barista made me my first coffee art - it was a heart. A thin-ass heart, but a heart nonetheless. How sweet is that.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Quality of food is fine, but not worth $9 IMHO.  I'd rather go to Urban Picnic which is within walking distance, you get much more (in terms of quantity and variety) for the same price.

They do serve Blue Bottle coffee, but I'm a bigger fan of Four Barrel (served at Otis Cafe which is also nearby).
author: Aalok P.

description:
I am currently in the midst of a salad revelation.

I didn't think it was possible to have salad revelations: to have one's life so completely changed by subtle textures and flavor combination, but my perception of the world is being changed at this very instant.

I am eating the Braised Organic Vegetable Salad from Boxed Foods and discovering the miracle of golden beets.

The line was long when I picked up my lunch, but it moved quickly. They were prompt in preparing my order and my amazing salad came with red and golden beats, braised carrots/parsnips, walnuts, goat cheese and spring mix. I was not a fan of the dressing (a bit too oily) but it comes on the side and the goat cheese is so flavorful that you don't even need the dressing. I have this alongside a Blue Bottle drip coffee with a touch of half a half.

As I said, a salad revelation.

In the past, I loved the baked tofu salad with apples, peanuts and a citrus cilantro soy dressing. That dressing is amazing. 

Sure the salads are a bit pricey, but when someone like me can have a revelation during lunch (and discover I actually do like beets when prepared properly) then I find it completely worth it.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
A bit pricey but quite delicious!  This place is about midway between my boyfriend's office and mine, so we'll meet here for a lunchtime rendezvous before returning to the old grind.  Best thing to do is get two sandwiches and do a lil' swaperoo so you can try all the different flavors.

Will be back!
author: Allison B.

description:
Boxed Food?!?!  Not quite sure what that means but they do have excellent coffee (Blue Bottle) and sandwiches.  

They've got a couple tables to sit down at but since they take a little while to get orders out (good things come to those who wait) you'll probably scarf down your food too fast to make sitting down a long affair.

Make sure you get a "frequent flyer" coffee drinker card since the 1 free coffee for every 6 you buy makes the cost more affordable.  ADDITION: They no longer offer the card...
author: David A.

description:
I love this place... well, I should say I love their boxed chicken salad sandwich, which is the only thing I really ever get here. 

I have tried their pear and brie, but that is a hit or miss. I once got like two small slices of brie and on the next order, my friend got a boat load of brie on hers. 

You have to try their boxed chicken salad sandwich... it is delicious!
author: Suzy Q.

description:
I LOVE that they serve Blue Bottle Coffee.  This saves me a trip to the Ferry Building...and I work in the Financial District.

Tried the mini donuts for the first time too....I'm hooked!
author: Michelle N.

description:
Very cute little spot. I like the simplicity of the place. It's very, "I'm out on my lunch break from my big-city-job catching something quick to eat." With hours of operation closing at 3pm, that's who they're targeting. 

The line was long, so I guess that could be a testament to the convenience and taste of the food. My turkey and avocado Panini was delicious. However, a 15-minute wait in line for 5 customers is way too long. One cashier with such a high demand, not good. The girl told me, you can order by phone and cut all the people to just pay. However, I can imagine being in line and seeing one of those cutters come in, I'd be pissed. Not a good solution either. After ordering, I had to wait another 10ish minutes for my sandwich. 

For a place that is catering for the quick-lunch-city-workers, their set up isn't ideal. I'd only come back for a good sandwich at a time where I intentionally was trying to take a mini-hookie-lunch.
author: Jon C.

description:
Two words for you: Blue Bottle.

Yes. This place serves Blue Bottle Coffee and when we just moved our offices just down the street, it makes the enjoyment of the best coffee on earth much closer!

Their salads and pastries are delicious, too. But seriously, BLUE BOTTLE!

It's like art.
author: Lauren F.

description: Love this place! The sandwiches are pretty bomb! They also deliver- I think this is the number one place to deliver lunch for your office. They make it so easy and it's well priced. Chips, sandwich and a salad for around $8/person. Also vegetarian options are available.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I try to hit these guys up at least once a week, either for the Blue Bottle in the morning or for the outstanding sandwiches at lunch. The grilled tempeh sandwich, as well as the pressed brie with asian pear, feel like a real treat even among the myriad sandwich places downtown. I always get particularly nostalgic at the bottled soda available here - Cricket Cola and Boylan's used to be mainstays of mine in high school.

Be prepared to wait during the lunch hour though. Almost worth it to bring some work with you ;)
author: Alex B.

description:
I eat here pretty frequently.  It's really tasty and pretty quick if you avoid the noon lunch rush. 

Pros:
- Boxed chicken salad - love the herbs in the chicken and the bacon is really flavorful.
- Steak salad - really tasty.

Cons:
- Sometimes takes longer than I might expect, especially for salads. The dressing is on the side in 2oz cups, so really it's just a simple assembly process.
- Atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired - I only get takeaway.  The place could use a fresh coat of paint and a deep cleaning.
author: W J.

description:
Delicious food and a cool concept

I had a flank steak sandwich. They package your lunch in a box and include a salad. This is great to take to the office or out to some steps downtown to enjoy the sun. The steak was good but could have been a little better in my opinion. I completely enjoyed the bread and condiments. The salad was simple and included some nice creamy dressing. 

They had a tempting selection of cookies and drinks. I ended up getting a coconut milk to go with my meal. 

This place is crowded with a long line. It looked like there were places to sit thought I would recommend getting it to go. The price was good too.
author: Eric G.

description: These guys are great -- there's often a line during the lunch rush, but it's worth the wait!  The sandwiches are hearty -- my favorite is the boxed chicken salad sandwich -- and they don't skip on meat, toppings, or the side salad.  They're also friendly and committed to getting your order right (have had just one minor slip-up there in the hectic lunch rush over many trips) -- really all you could want in a sandwich shop.  One of my favorites!
author: Brit B.

description: Well I've just about had it with Boxed foods.  I was a big fan for a long time, but lately the food and service has simply gone down.  One time the food is good, the next it's not - it's not consistent anymore.  I also went at 1:30 today and had to wait 15 min to get my sandwich once ordered - which then is on the wrong bread and has no pesto (boxed chicken sand).  So now I get to eat a dry sandwich on dry bread at my desk.  Time to find another good sandwich place I think...
author: Dan B.

description: I went after the lunch crowd rush and walked right in got the boxed chicken salad really fresh and tasty will be back again to try more things !
author: lyn m.

description:
This is one of my go-to lunch places during the week. 

I pretty much rotate between 3 items:
* BLT (most frequently chosen item)
* Boxed Chicken Salad (or Sandwich, depending on how healthy I am feeling)
* Prosciutto & mozzarella panini   

All sandwiches come with a salad and semi-addicting dressing. They also serve Blue Bottle coffee on the days you are feeling sluggish by lunch. 

My only warning is that the line can get long and it doesn't move super fast. Get there before or right at 12 or go a little later to avoid the crowds.
author: Katie W.

description: My salad was great! I had the roasted vegetable salad with avocado. Everything was fresh, service was quick and I thoroughly enjoyed all of the vegetables and greens in my salad.  I'll be back.
author: Shalana M.

description:
This is definitely my favorite place to come for lunch while I'm working.  The prosciutto and burrata panini just rocks my world.  Love the boxed chicken sandwich as well.  

Also, love love love the steak salad. I really don't like getting salads, consider them strictly rabbit food.  But this has so much meat it feels more like a main course with a side salad - yum.

They usually have a line out the door around lunch, but they're surprisingly efficient, you'll usually have to wait a couple of minutes if you go during lunch rush.  Though I got there at noon on the dot one day and I was the only one there, so I recommend going early or late if you're in a hurry.
author: Kate E.

description: Great, healthy choices! You get a decent amount of food for the price in the financial district as well.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
The line is amazingly long and moves very slowly.  I've read the reviews below and was expecting some really good food.  Sadly I was disappointed.

My friend and I ordered 2 salads - she the Butter Lettuce and I the special of the day Chicken, Avocado.  They were both alright, nothing to write home about.  I think I'll order a sandwich next time...they looked good...or maybe try a salad with more substance.

I did like the Blue Bottle coffee though and come here just to grab a cup o joe.
author: Christine C.

description: What delicious salads they have! I am always looking for a new healthy place so I'm not tempted with all the unhealthy restaurants around work, and this place was great! I had a delicious and fresh steak salad and enjoyed every bite!
author: Ani N.

description:
A new addition to the weekday lunch circuit.  I tried to introduce a co-worker to Boxed Foods. We arrived at 1pm and they had already sold out of several sandwiches and ALL salads.  Not a good first impression for my colleague.

I had a hankering for the BLT, but it was sold out as well.  The one positive note is that I was forced to order a different sandwich, this time the flank steak.  I'm glad I did.

I've now had three different sandwiches from Boxed Foods (BLT, turkey artichoke, and flank steak) and all three are excellent. Some advice: Don't be tempted to grab a bag of chips as an accompaniment. All the sandwiches come with a fairly substantial side salad of yuppie greens.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: I used to love this place and would walk from EC4 just for one of their flank steak sandwiches.  So disappointed today- my steak was overcooked, way too much mayo slapped on (so much for the dijon mayo promised) and the salad was wilted.  Quality has gone way, way down.
author: M D.

description:
Baked tofu salad was delish, with a very cool combo of ingredients/flavors. Jalapeno citrus dressing, peanuts, apples, glass noodles, sesame seeds, and tofu? I'm very interested. 
The pear and brie panini sounded great as well, but upon inspection of my friend's order, the innards revealed the promised brie was pretty much m.i.a. The pesto addition was a nice idea, but who moved our cheese?
author: Purnima M.

description: The ingredients of the salad were fresh, but they don't toss in the dressing, which makes it really hard to get the dressing mixed in evenly throughout your salad. I got the salad that has chicken, goat cheese, and red pepper -- I forgot the name. It was pretty good, just not that exciting. I might go back to see if there are other menu options I like more.
author: Olivia P.

description:
I think this is the first hearty salad I've found since I started workin downtown. Got the boxed chicken salad and it came loaded with a ton of marinated chicken, healthy amount of bacon (which is saying a lot coming from me!) n lots of refreshing extras (apples, nice lite dressing). 

Tried a latte which was pretty good (still can't find one like kaffa's down south...) I'll head back here for sure.  A variety of yummy-sounding options at reasonable price!
author: Jen C.

description:
Went here for the first time this past week (and since I've been in the FiDi for about 2 years that's a big deal!). In any event, I was lured in by their brie, pesto and pear sandwich. It was definitely yummy, a little too much pesto for my liking, but the combination of pears and brie was to die for. & it came with an arugula side salad & I LOVE arugula. 

The inside vibe & decor is pretty cool too, def not something you see all the time in the FiDi a little more hippie/independent which i like.
author: Jenna K.

description: One of the best chicken salad sandwiches I have ever had.  Also appreciate that it comes with a very good side salad to boot.  The rest of the menu also sounds fresh and delicious, but it is hard to stray from the usual chicken salad.  Maybe next time!
author: Michael D.

description: Salads here are tasty and organic (as it seems)... but it doesn't fill you up, unfortunately. I dont come here very often because I know that in two hours after lunch, i will be hungry again. :( And, the food is not cheap at all.
author: Yuliya K.

description:
Dear God, thank you for putting Boxed Foods across the street from my office.  I had been killing myself trying to find something to eat around these parts that didn't cost one of my parts (body that is..) or that wasn't the total calorie count for my entire day.  Sooo, I bumped in here today and got the grilled tempeh salad with roasted corn, roasted red bell peppers, grilled onions and a citrus vinegrette. The tempeh was EXCELLENT I'm sure Mr. Burns would agree, and the portion size just right.  At $8 a pop I feel like I'm not being too badly burned by the produce prices. 

As per the usual I see lots of people ripping on the sandwiches, so I guess I'll have to try one of those and come back and complain later, but for now my salad was right on and I felt a fair price.
author: Claire C.

description: I think their food is good.  I don't quite get the crazy line out the door.  However, this is a great place to have deliver/cater an office lunch.  The food was still warm, fresh and delicious and they arrived on-time.
author: Cork C.

description:
Enjoyed a nice company meal here today (read: free) to welcome a new guy to the team.  We ordered 5 sandwiches, a couple drinks and 5 of those cute little donuts they have and the total came to around $50, which strikes me as very reasonable.

My colleague and I split the BLT and the Honey Lime Chicken sandwiches, both of which I thought were excellent.  The HLC had avocado spread and lots of flavor; tangy, sweet, good stuff.  The BLT was surprisingly less flavorful but was a good compliment.  Salad dressing for the included salads was decent.
author: Oliver N.

description: Went at 12:30 and there was no line to order and about a 8 minute wait for food. I love B restaurant so I was glad Boxed Foods did not disappoint (they are sisters). I adored the Boxed Chicken Salad with champagne vinaigrette. Will for sure be back. It's harder than you think to get fresh lettuce and chicken with flavor around here!
author: Nikki M.

description: This place is super delicious.  I've had the Tempeh lettuce wrap and Tofu and Noodle salad.  I love getting the lunch here and going over to union square to eat.
author: Nancy M.

description:
Do not go here during peak hours.  It took longer for me to have a sandwich made for lunch today than it took for me to try on three pairs of jeans and have them fit to be hemmed.  From start to finish, from the end of the line to the moment i walked out of the door with sandwich in hand, 30 minutes.  Its good that i had already run my errands and was planning on just eating at my desk anyway, cuz a sit down at this point would have been out of the question.

With that being said, the sandwich i had was delicious, and it took me about 25 minutes of that 30 just to decide what i wanted.  The menu looked scrumptious.  Artichoke turkey panini, mozzarella and prosciutto sandwich, chicken salad...i went with the pear and brie sandwich.  Is that surprising?  EVERYTHING TASTES BETTER WITH BRIE!!!  All of their sandwiches also come with a side salad.

I will go back.  Maybe when my lunch relief gives me 1-2 instead of 12-1.  I figure the line has to die past 1:30, and it would be worth a small line to try some of the other menu items, at least once.
Its also pricier than many sandwich shops in the financial district, prices averaging $8-$10.  The quality of the product though...that's what will bring me back.

This is a 3.5 star review.  Food good.  Wait bad.
author: Lauren F.

description:
There are two things i don't joke about


1)  bacon
2)  not joking about bacon


I ordered the boxed chicken salad sandwich.  It is described as this:

Our version of chicken salad (chicken, olive oil, citrus, basil, thyme and rosemary, a hint of mayo and red onion) with apples, crispy bacon, and walnut pesto.
_________________________________________________


Mmmmmm sounds delicious right? 

Here's how much lunch went down:

Yum, yum, chew, chew, chomp, chomp. . . not bad, but where's the crunch. . . chew, chew, no crispiness yet, maybe the next bite. . .chew chew, that's just an apple, chew, chew, chew, chomp, chomp, WHERE'S THE BACON CRUNCH? CHEW CHEW CHOMP CHOMP WHERE IS IT  (BITES GETTING LARGER AND MORE FRANTIC, PANICKED)!!!!!!!!!!!!   

 WHERE'S MY BACON? THEY PROMISED ME BACON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!




(curtain close, end scene)



Scene 2:



Jerkstore in bathtub, blood everywhere, dead



Scene 3:

Boss:    We have a bathtub in our office?!
author: JERK STORE ..

description:
The ingredients are good and fresh (where else can you get a tempeh sandwich around here?) but for $8, I expect to leave with a full stomach.  If you can, go after 1 to avoid a line.  (Bonus:  Pastries are reduced to $1 after 1 p.m..)  

There's a small seating area, as the counter and kitchen area takes up most of the space.  Magazines are available for your perusal while you wait for your to-go order or are eating in and need something to read while you stuff yourself with a mouthful of leafy greens.  

Boxed Foods isn't a bad place for lunch once in a blue moon, especially if you want to feel particularly healthy.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
I know, I've been lackluster recently, and it being a milestone and all, I wish to present you with AN EPIC REVIEW

IN WHICH DIFFICULT CHOICES ARE MADE
OUR HEROS PATIENCE IS TESTED
A JOURNEY IS UNDERTAKEN
A TASTY SANDWICH IS CONSUMED

I found myself today without time for lunch outside or a dining companion so I stopped in where I'd been meaning to go for a while due to the reputation and proximity to the office. As soon as you walk in you'll confront the board, with around twenty sandwiches and salads written up in chalk. Whoever has this job ought to write ad copy on the side; Everything sounds great and it may take you a few minutes to decide.
