It will take other people a few minutes to decide too, so once you've made a selection you'll push your way through a crowd of people taking a few minutes to decide and get in line. I'm not sure why there's a line to order; it really doesn't take all that long. It does, however take a while for your order to come up since they're slammed long after the lunch rush has ended at most other spots. This isn't really their fault, but it's something to note. 

It's close to the office (for me. This may or may not hold true for you.) and they'll pack it in a cardboard box with a fork and napkin tucked in like the fork is tucked into bed. Precious! And the fork won't fall out while you're carrying it!

I opted for the grilled flank steak sandwich; What I received wasn't quite what I imagined, but was tasty nonetheless. I would characterize it as a roast beef-like sandwich on toasted wheat bread with a hint of horseradish in the mayonnaise and a few salad greens on the side. Whatever. It tasted good.

The portions are a bit smaller than most other places, but I think it's about right in that it will fill you up but it won't stuff you. It hits a happy medium for post lunch time fullness, if you think about these things the way I do.

The thing is that I paid 9.75 for that relatively small sandwich and small pile of greens, which seems 2 or 3 dollars more than what in my mind would be a fair price. This and the wait cause the Boxed Foods Company to fall a little short of its reputation.

I was trying for epic, lord knows I was. I disappoint even myself sometimes.
author: matthew r.

description:
Without consulting the archives, I'm pretty sure I'm awarding this place my first five star rating for a Financial District eat spot.  

I've actually grown jaded in the Financial District, and with low expectations I can honestly say there have been several occasions where fast food sounded just as good as any of the local eateries in the area.  

Matthew R. convinced me to join him here for lunch, and I can honestly say that this was the best lunch I've had in the Financial District (perhaps aside from Yank Sing - but the staggering cost at Yank Sing disqualifies it from serious consideration).

The honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich is fan-fucking-tastic.  Organic ingredients?  I guess that is cool - I don't go out of my way for organic ingredients, but I suppose it makes me feel a little better to know that this goes organic anyways.  

I'm looking forward to going back to this place soon.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Whenever I'm in the Union Square area I make it a point to do two things. The first is to visit Teuscher chocolates and indulge in some champagne truffles. The friendly folks there revealed their favorite lunchtime spot, which takes me to number two, visit Boxed Foods Company.

BFC is a small galley-style restaurant where creative sandwiches and bustling financial district folks meet to eat. My favorite sammy is the turkey with artichoke pesto spread on crispy panini with parmesan cheese. I tried the pulled pork sammy today, which was delicious in a different way, a little lighter, with a light and tangy dressing and pickled ginger on a sweet soft bun.

For some reason this place makes lunch feel special - the mini salad included, the nice presentation in the box. Not super pricey either.

4.5 * stars
author: Brady K.

description: Until yesterday used to go there once or twice a week.  Food is usually good, service can be slow, and sometimes they mess up the order, like a wedge salad with no bacon or tomatoes, or they forget to give you salad dressing.  Sandwiches other than chicken are pretty light on the meat.  The reason I won't go back is I waited 14 minutes for a BLT, they were busy, but come on.  I estimated that they served 10 people who ordered after me before I got my lunch.
author: D C.

description:
I loved the chicken-avocado sandwich that all the other Yelpers had been raving about. Though the line was long, it was truly worth the wait. The staff is friendly and attentive and the food is to die for...can't think of much more to say...oh, well don't go here to have a sit-down lunch or with a huge group since it's a tiny shop.

great downtown lunch spot for the grab-n-go
author: Jane K.

description: Found this place thanks to Map-tastic and of course the Yelpers were right. This is a gem of a sandwich and salad shop. The ingredients are so fresh and high quality, this place puts "that other" nearby organic salad place to shame. The guys are serious about their food and order taking and food making processes are smooth and fast. For the budget minded, be warned prices are on the high side ($10 for a chicken and avocado sandwich and a drink), but I think the premium food makes the deal pretty fair. I'll be back fo sho.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Charging $5 for a Kombucha is criminal. 

But, the food here is very good. 

These guys use fresh, high-quality ingredients and know how to mix flavors well. Their grilled chicken salad for example mixes shredded apples, with goat cheese and heirloom cherry tomatoes and creates this perfect balance of sweetness, tangyness, and crunchy texture. I would definitely order lunch here again, but will be more careful when ordering a beverage in the future.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Finally got a chance to try this place out today and ended up getting the chicken panini sandwich. After reading so many great reviews I was expecting a lot more than what I ended up getting. It's not that it was bad, it's just that it was.....average. The panini itself was really small and after eating it outside the BofA building on Kearny I came back to the office and immediately grabbed some munchies.

I'll probably give this place another shot but it's definitely not going to jump to the top of my lunch destinations list.

The line can be really slow moving too so I'd recommend getting there on the earlier side of lunch time.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Only reason for 4 stars is their limited hours. 

Other than that, food is great, just make sure you get there around lunch time, as the amount and quality goes down the closer they get to closing. 
Best sandwich DT!
author: Clay T.

description:
You ever go to a place that is so damn obvious that it's simply genius! This is that place. It's boxed food as in yum food in white boxes so it's a quick stop in to order and a fun little box you can take to say, an awesome rooftop of a Financial District Building. (I swear, LA needs rad places like this. Totally unknown rooftops where peole can chill out and eat lunch on benches surrounded by beautiful landscapes and people...JEANYOUS!)

But I digress...

I got the turkey and artichoke panini and while it wasn't the most impactful punch to the flavor rater, it was definitely a perfectly portioned lunch that hit the spot! They also have some pretty great looking salads there, along with a bunch of off the wall drinks, teas and bottles that regardless of how the drink actually tastes, you'd be an idiot not to at least get one for the awesome shaped bottle.

Good times and definitely worth a stop on a lunch hour!
author: Stephy S.

description:
Salads = good. 
Sandwiches = good.
Drinks = eclectic/good selection (they have my Pom tea here!  collectible glass!  yay!)

The one thing I go here for (nay, TREK FOR) is their awesome hazelnut muffin.  ::drool::  I lurve hazelnuts (nutella, anyone?) and I can usually find this muffin sitting (waiting!!) in the window along with other tasty-looking pastries and muffins.  I usually ignore the others and immediately reach for the coveted ::insert angels singing here:: HAZELNUT MUFFIN.  My co-worker bought their blueberry muffin which she says was good, too -- fresh blueberries never hurt nobody, kay?

Screw Starbuck's pastries.  Peet's pastries are okay.  Specialty's pastries are too sweet.  But Boxed Foods?  You bet your sweet ass, Goldilocks... it's just right.
author: Dianne d.

description:
Ok, so I noticed there are a whole bunch of reviews for this place, but I had to add my 2 cents worth. Boxed Foods Company broke me, yes, broke me. I was content to go to the same place for the same thing over, and over and over again. For serious, I was a-ok with it. Then my friend Lena took me here and I looked at the menu. My eyes fell to the floor while the part of my brain that loves consistency freaked out and ran away screaming. In normal terms this means I loved the entire menu. 

I can say I have tried EVERY sandwich on the menu. Yes, all of them. Even the ones with out meat (I am from WI so it is very hard to beat the "meat and potatoes" out of me). Love them all. I've also tried a few of their salads. AWESOMENESS. Sometimes I feel like I'm cheating on Mixt Greens because I come here so often...and a tad embarrassed because I really do go there about 4 times a week.

I do cook! I do! Just not in the current place that I live...

Fresh veggies? Check. Awesome varying salad dressings? Check. Creative sandwiches? Check. Wonderful array of drinks to wash my food down? Double check.

PLUS they even have some magazines to read while you wait for your food. Why hasn't anyone though of this before?  All in all I suggest three cheers of "HURRAY" for the Boxed Foods Company!

Speaking of.... I know where I'm going for lunch...
author: Heather H.

description: Amazing. I just finished a turkey artichoke panino from Boxed Foods and it was so delicious!! One of my coworkers has repeatedly told me to try this place and I finally listened, and I'm so glad I did. There is nothing I would change about the sandwich, it was pretty light for a panino and not greasy at all. The side salad came with really yummy dressing on the side and a strawberry. The staff was very friendly and nice. It looks like they do run out of some of the popular items so I would probably stop by before 1 if you have your heart set on a particular menu item. I'm definitely going to go back!
author: Gina C.

description: Boxed Lunch Salad was good but it seemed to be missing something to balance out the tartness of the lemon, like goat cheese.
author: Chris B.

description:
This place is hit or miss... when it's good it's good but it is inconsistent. The first time I picked up lunch from boxed foods, my salad was amazing; fresh and sundried tomatoes, fresh mozzarella... so the next two times I went to Boxed Foods, I was craving this yummy salad only to get a big box of lettuce with a few random bites of tomatoes and and two wimpy pieces of cheese, all for over $10 a pop, pretty dissapointing. 

Also, my third and final visit to Boxed Foods, my friend who accompanied me asked for a piece of foccacia to go with her salad and the manager told her that he was saving the bread for people who order sandwiches (WTF?)... The very same week, my manager ordered a cappucino along with a salad and the manager looked at her, shook his head and said, 'we are way too busy for that right now, why don't you come back around 3:00pm and I'll give you a free cappucino then"... uh, yeah.
author: Donna V.

description:
Make sure you order before 11:30 or 12:00, other wise all the goo stuff is gone.  This place closes at 3:00pm.  Not only because they only do lunch but because all their ingredients are fresh and they run out of things by then.
Be ready to spend at least $10.  the steak salad is a favorite around my work place.   I'd go for a salad here.  the boxed chicken is my fav. The sandwiches are over priced for what you get and not that great.

The staff here is real laid back and nice, so they make it hard to get mad at them when they mess up or run out of your favorite thing.

Plus this is the only place downtown to get a Kombucha!  (that I know of)
author: amanda v.

description:
Quick healthy lunch!   Focused on high quality ingredients.   This is a place I'll return for a great salad - local chicken, lettuce, bacon, apples etc.    About 8 bucks and you can taste what you're paying for :)

They also great looking sandwiches and wraps that I'll be back for.
author: Dave P.

description:
Wow. Best Quick Lunch I've had in the Financial District.  

To Neil, below: Now, I too love their honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich.

Update: Really nice staff!
author: Matthew R.

description:
I try to treat myself to some Boxed Foods once a week. It is a serious treat. Really, really good stuff here... well worth the price. The chicken trust-me is always a pleasant surprise -- and the honey-lime can't be beat. Oh, and don't miss the nice lemon & cucumber water while you wait and look through all the cooking mags and start to feel like, just maybe, you could make that featured-recipe crusted snapper. That's what Boxed Foods does: inspire.

But then they call your number and you forget about all your own cooking aspirations -- because who needs to do it themselves when you've got a hefty box of goodness right there?

Also -- I don't get some of the comments about small portions. A big, fat sandwich with tons of yummy shit on it, along with some greens and such... what more do you people want? You finish totally sated but not weighed down. "Full" isn't the same as "bloated" and/or "catatonic". OH SNAP.
author: Chris L.

description: I usually prepare myself for the 15 min wait at boxed because somehow I always get there when the line is far out the door. I like the honey lime chicken but with less honey because otherwise it is overload. Once tried the beet panini and while I love beets, this had far too much going on. Pear and brie press is heavy on the brie but not so bad if you add chicken. Salads are good, chicken and boxed salads are popular. Ingredients are fresh, food comes back pretty quickly after you order and not too pricey. Solid lunch spot, once you go you'll randomly later get lunch cravings for boxed.
author: sasha h.

description:
I used to work around the corner from this organic gem, which kept me going in there about 3x's a week.  Really sweet people, cucumber/lemon infused water, and seats in the alley out back.  

Sometimes they will let you make up your own salad -- since the menu is a little limiting.  I don't think they like special orders too much, though.

If you want to order off the menu try the Boxed Chicken Salad.  Fresh Spring Mix, Green Apples, Pancetta, Grilled Onions, Chicken and Goat Cheese with a really light house dressing.  It really is as good as it sounds.

The open faced smoked salmon sandwich is also a great choice.  Pricey but great.

It's expensive, but at least you know it's healthy and fresh.  Your body is a temple, remember?  Treat it accordingly.
author: Rachel G.

description: I started going here occasionally for lunch about four months ago.  Since then, the quality has appeared to slipped.  The bread is less fresh.  The tempeh in my sandwich yesterday was terrible and the bread was hard.  The "side" of salad and fruit is often an exaggeration.  There have not been hot sandwiches for awhile now.  I will do my best to avoid going back.
author: Amber B.

description: When I worked downtown when food was brought in and it was from Boxed Foods Company, it was always a special occasion... like Christmas. Seriously, if it wasn't Noah's or Extreme Pizza that meant it was the staff Christmas party. It may not sound like a big deal, but it was a big deal to us. Good sandwiches, salads, and cookies.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
The best sandwich shop. EVER! This place rules.

I love their honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich.

I love their honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich.

I love their honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich.

And its all ORGANIC. Seriously -- delis and sandwich shops of the greater SF area, this is the future for sandwiches. Follow their lead. Please.

PS: I love their honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich.
author: Neil K.

description:
I ordered the grilled panini sandwich, and after being spoiled by the greatest paninis ever from Corner Bakery down in LA, combined with the great reviews for this place, my expectations were quite high as I walked back to my office with sandwich in hand...however disappointment set in as soon as I opened the box.

The sandwich was a lot smaller than what I was hoping for, particularly for $8.  At $4-$5 it would've been a good deal..however size does matter, as does moistness, which the sandwich didn't quite acheive either.

Still, the ingredients within the sandwich were very fresh and tasty, and the mini side salad was rather good at well.  However I probably won't go back here any time soon--unless someone else is paying.
author: Tien N.

description: Had the Boxed Chicken Salad Sandwich. Very, very good! Freshly prepared, tasty and quick. One of the more healthy options on Kearny. Definitely putting this into my lunch rotation.
author: Lee D.

description:
Despite limited hours and high prices, Boxed Foods Company reinvents the lunch break with some of the best sandwiches in San Francisco.

The food is creative, organic, and addictively delicious.  I regularly make pigrimages from the Sunset district just to order their boxed chicken salad sandwich which, along with the pear and brie press, are guranteed to make any sandwich lover's "best of" list.  Incredible.
author: Karin H.

description: I love this place. Great coffee, amazing salads, and organic ingredients. YUM
author: Jennifer M.

description:
After reading about the wait here, I thought I'd get a jump on the competition (ie other customers) and head over at 11:45am.  This turned out to be a great idea, as I was only 4th in line when I got there.  

Once I ordered, the food came out before I even got back from the bathroom and was all bagged up and ready to go.  

I got the Green Goddess Salad plus tofu.  The  tofu was baked but not in a totally dried out way, it was moist on the inside still and creamy.  My friend got the grilled chicken salad and she couldn't stop raving about it.  Super fresh with fabulous dressing.  

And all of this was $8 with my Green Zebra coupon.  Buy the book, it's worth it!  

Minus one point for the cashier who just stares at you until you order, but one of these positive stars is for the helpful expediter who takes your order before you reach the cashier.  He was great.
author: Jessica B.

description:
This place should be called Boxed Restaurant cause it sure is tiny. Calustrophobiacs (?) beware.

What are these employees on? Seriously. They had the biggest smiles on their faces that I have ever seen... hah, kinda mischievous. 

We ate in and they checked on us like three times to make sure that our food was ok... Cool, but if they checked on us one more time I would have thought something fishy was goin' on.

Anyway, the food was good! My Chicken Panini thing was wonderful, bread was kinda hard, i hate hard bread, but the insides of the sandwich made up for it, came with a nice salad.

Their free water is mmm mmm good. They put a lot of cucumber and lemon in it to make it taste lovely. And the cups for water are big and portable which is nice.

Pricey but not expensive, Go try it. Go.
author: Richard T.

description:
The name says it all...foods in a box.

Well, maybe not all. It should be called: "Delicious Boxed Foods Company."

My favorite is the Chicken salad sandwich. If you're eating in, be sure to explore the back, there is more indoor and outdoor seating in a pleasant sunny little alleyway. And be sure to try the Blue Sky sodas, a homegrown New Mexican organic soda company.
author: Joseph B.

description: Boxed Foods has by far the best sandwiches I've had so far in FiDi.  Specialties is pretty good but still standard.  Whereas Boxed Foods approaches gourmet.  I had the chicken panini with sun dried tomatoes and chevre.  Although a little pricier than normal at around $8 I think it is well worth it given the quality and tastiness of the sandwiches.  Each sandwich also comes with a nice rocket salad and citrus dressing.
author: Jean K.

description:
I think I ordered wrong. 
I also think the normal knowledgeable staff was on vacation today.

my vegetarian sandwich special was bready, dry and tasteless.  maybe because they used 1 tsp of avocado on the whole thing...   the free side salad was great though w/ a zesty lemon vinaigrette.  

next time I think I will get a meat sando or salad.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Less salad variety than Mixt Greens, but more sandwich options. The roast chicken salad is made with good quality ingredients -- white meat chicken, mixed baby salad greens, goat cheese, roasted red peppers & onions -- but the salad greens were too easily overwhelmed by the cheese, peppers and onions, and I'd suggest arugula to provide better contrast.  But nothing's more important than ingredient quality, in my book, and I certainly couldn't fault that here.  
I'll be back to try the sandwiches -- the prosciuto, asparagus and parmesan one looked interesting (even if I am a bit doubtful of its inclusion of melon) -- so I'll update then.  
The salad was $8, BTW, so cheaper than Mixt Greens, but my impression so far is that Mixt Greens offers better salad compositions...
author: Sue Z.

description:
I walked past here a million times without noticing it, which for me, gets point for not bein' all in yo face. 

simple but varying menu of fresh ingredients all chalkboard style. there was a line but it went quick and food came out fast, we even got a seat (one of three tables i think). 

i had a really tough time deciding but got the turkey artichoke panini, very yummy. my companion got the brie apple panini, which she really liked except they are a little stingy on the brie.

a little too expensive for an everyday meal but a nice treat when you want something fresh and delicious for lunch in the FiDi
author: Sarah G.

description:
Shame on you, Boxed Foods Company.  I've been a frequent customer for 2 years and your sandwiches + salads were always wonderful.  About 6 months ago, though, something happened.

First, the sweet, smiling cashier disappeared and was replaced by a nasty woman who literally gives you an 'eat shit' look when you step up to the plate.

But most importantly, the food has gone way downhill.  I used to get the pear + brie press on a very consistent basis, but the last 3 times I ordered it, the sandwich was literally 1/4 the size it normally was.  Barely any brie, one slice of pear and just a little curl of carmelized onion.  It was pathetic.

I've given you many, many chances to step back up to your previous glory, but on multiple occasions over the last 6 months, you've just disappointed.  I will not be going back.

To all you Financial District lunchers, take an extra 5 minutes to head on over to Mixt Greens.  Much, much better food and without the 'tude.
author: Rufus X.

description:
The sandwich was tasty, but it wasn't what I wanted.  I wanted the Chicken breast panini.  They'd run out of chicken breast before 1 pm on a Monday.  How does a succesful sandwich shop - half of whose menu seems to involve chicken breast in one form or another - manage to run out of chicken breast before lunch is half over?

Also the line was really long, and it didn't go as fast as other Yelp reviews had me believe.  

However, the sandwich I did get was tasty.  Although I've had a sour stomach most of the afternoon, I'll still give it 4 stars because -- um, peer pressure?
author: Irish L.

description: I don't know many other places where I can get a delicious tempeh sandwich so I say Boxed Foods is pretty cool.
author: Wakako U.

description: It breaks my heart to give this place a bad review. I've been coming here for years and have always appreciated the quality of food and service.  Recently, the management has changed although according to the current manager the place is still under the same ownership.  If so I urge with the strongest recommendation to bring back the prior management and get rid of the current one. Given that the current volume of business is less than half what it used to be, I think the owner would agree.
author: C-C Y.

description:
The menu looks good, if not a bit pricy, but I decided to go with the prosciutto panino. It has aoli on it and I can't stand anything mayo based, so I asked to have it made without and get pesto on it instead. She explained that they were pre-made, but they could make me a fresh one, but it just had to be on foccaia and not a baguette like it normally was as they were out. This was fine with me.

The sandwich itself is in this huge box with a small side salad and when i saw it, i thought, I paid $9+ for this?? but i think the box just makes it look small as the sandwich was actually delicious and had a thick serving of prosciutto which I feel like places normally skimp on. While it took at least 10 minutes for the sandwich to be ready, it was perfectly toasted, cheese was melted, overall very good. I like that it comes with a side salad too.

I did splurge on a smores cookie and it was okay but I definitely wouldn't get it again, just wasn't something I would crave - not like the smores cupcake i came across recently.

Overall, I definitely won't be going here to often, it's a bit pricy, but it was a good sandwich and I think I'd be up for trying some of their salads too.
author: Lauren M.

description:
The food here is great.  I've had two sandwiches and today, a Strawberry Salad.  Everything is fresh, delicious, with a variety of tastiness.  Staff are friendly.  Sandwiches always come with some salad, and the emphasis on green and vegetables and fresh just makes you feel like you're having a healthy lunch.

The prices are decent, if you figure lunch is around $10.  They have a neat variety of juices and bottled drinks.  Can't go wrong with Boxed Foods!

It would be neat if you could get fresh ground black pepper on the salads, and it can be a little confusing for newbies dining in that you can grab a seat in back and hey'll bring you your food.
author: Danny H.

description:
I visited this place twice during my week-long trip to SF, it was THAT good! The turkey-atrichoke panino was totally delish, and everything else on the menu looked good and they have an eclectic selection of beverages. The first day I did have to wait in line outside, probably no more than 10 minutes before I ordered. I beat the lunch rush the second time.

Its small, and waiting for food you may feel like you are cramping the diners, but its pretty cool that they have magazines to peruse at the counter while you wait! This place has and organic/locavore appeal to it, and yummy flavors and combinations. I recommend!

Their website, however, was totally blah!
author: Corinna L.

description:
10/3/07 Update:  I had a very sad little prosciutto and mozzarella panini here yesterday.  I tried to order the flank steak salad, which was up on the menu, but the said they were out.  For my sandwich, nothing had been done to the bread so not really sure why they called it a panini.  And it was bland, not good.  I'm bringing it down to three stars.  This will still be one of my go to places because they have great ingredients but I wish there was a bit more care going into their food prep.  

Ok, the flank steak salad that I'm eating right now is so good that I wanted to cry but instead decided to write this review.  Feta, mint, flank steak, cherry tomatoes, greens, red onions, preserved lemon vinaigrette, the combo is a beautiful thing.  Like summer in a box (now summer in my tummy).  
I'm also a fan of the boxed chicken salad.  They're all $10 salads but it's organic, fresh, and did i mention yummy?  This place and Sellers Market are my two reliable lunch places.
author: Kiki R.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat in the financial district. I'm sure I've eaten 80% of their menu and enjoyed everything that has gone into my mouth. Sadly, they no longer have a breakfast menu, which I LOVED. They do sell coffee and pastries in the morning and I've met many people who agree that they sell the best croissant in the neighborhood.

They don't start serving sandwiches until 10:30am. That's probably not a problem for y'all but I got a 5am shift and a lunchtime of 9am. Their tempeh is really good, but I often get the prosciutto/asparagus sandwich with cantaloupe slices. The cantaloupe is IN the sandwich and don't knock it till you try it. I love the walnut bread! Everything is organic and all the food is delivered fresh daily, so they sometimes close early because they run out of food.
author: Elsie M.

description: One of my favorite places in the financial district. I always get their grilled chicken salad. It's no ordinary chicken, but nicely seasoned with chives and whatever it is that makes it moist and tasty. Ingredients are always fresh, and the goat cheese is addicting. Having a Boxed Lunch salad for lunch is a treat. Come early, the lines can get long!
author: Nattie X.

description:
the tofu noodle salad for $8 is awesome! it comes with tofu, white noodles, apple, peanuts, bean sprouts, green onion & sesame seeds with a really good citrus-soy dressing. i usually get it without the peanuts and sometimes i add avocado. the salad comes with an orange slice (sometimes two) and a slice of bread (sometimes 2 slices).

the people that work there are super friendly and there are magazines to read while you wait.

great place for a delicious fresh lunch!
author: Elaine S.

description: Came here around noon today in my quest for the perfect salad. LuckiIy it wasn't too busy and I had my salad in 5 minutes. I ordered the boxed chicken salad. YUM. Love the crisp bacon, the crunch of the apples & the dressing. I would definitely get this again. Its the perfect amount of food for lunch & came with 2 pieces of bread. I'll be back to try some of their other items, like the beet sandwich (I have an unnatural obsession with beets). I love that the menu is seasonal and fresh. I'm adding this to my list of FD go-to lunch places.
author: Sara P.

description:
First time here, everyone liked their food, but . . .

What's up with the stingy portions?  My friend ordered a pear brie sandwich, and the slice of brie on one side was about the size of a quarter.  My lime chicken sandwich was the size of 1.5 White Castle hamburgers.  Sadness.

What's up with the deceptive descriptions?  The sign says each sandwich comes with salad and fruit.  Fruit = half a thin orange slice.  The description of my sandwich lists avocado as the second ingredient.  Avocado = mayonnaise spread with avocado essence.  Come to think of it, one of the extras listed was avocado "love".  I was wondering what that meant, now I know.

Like I said, the food tastes good, but so does the food at Working Girls up the street, and you won't be puzzled by the food you pull out of the bag/box.
author: David C.

description:
Expensive and not very satisfying. I eat here when Im punishing myself for eating to many ____________.
Sometimes they are a little toooo organic. I dont like bugs and twigs in my salad.
I alerted them to the walking leaf in my lunch- and they were completely nonchalant. So that must just be how they make them.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Boxed Foods Co. is an excellent idea.  And a noble goal.  What they are trying to do is good and right.  And hopefully, someone (perhaps even them) will someday do a really good job of it.  But, that hasn't happened yet.

I've tried a number of their sandwiches (probably all their meat-based sandwiches), and I find that I agree with the comments from a number of other posts: the sandwiches aren't that filling, are often dry, and are often almost flavorless.  Plus, they're really expensive.

Nuff said.
author: Ben P.

description:
Now THIS is how you do a salad...  Combine a number of interesting yet complimentary very-fresh ingredients, package them up nicely, and deliver them with a friendly attitude.  Yes!

The line moved verrrry slowly and by 1pm they were out of a few items, but there was still a good variety of compelling veggie sammiches and salads (I went for the tofu/noodle salad).  Seems like most people take their lunches to go.

BUT....  worth a stunning 10 STARS is the brownie I had from Boxed Foods.  Hands-down The Best Brownie I've had in years.  Years, I tell you.  (And I've had a fair share of brownies.)  It's dangerous that they are so close to my new job.  Oh my.
author: Andi T.

description: I was really disappointed about the quality of the food. To me, it is not worth the price. If you are looking for healthy salads or sandwiches, try somewhere else.
author: Justin S.

description:
You will definitely find something you like here. It's a good consistant lunch spot if you can wait out the line or be smart and go early.  I've had both chicken salads (cravings go back and forth between the two) but I skip the salad dressing and go for some cholula sauce instead. I've also had the turkey panini, and the seasonal peach salad. All of my choices have been a hit so far with fresh clean flavors. I would deeefinitely recommend any of the four I mentioned. Or maybe I shouldn't - so the line doesn't get longer.   Also 3 coworkers love the tofu salad and eat it regularly. I've never tried it, I'm always craving my usuals!

As far as coffee, I ordered and espresso once. It didn't do much for me as far as taste goes so I've never ordered one again. The mini doughnuts and cookies are good, nothing to write home about, but definitely calms the sweet tooth cravings. 

In short - great lunch spot, though it's not going to blow any minds. The lines are long from 12-1:30 ish but it's worth the wait if I can't sneak by at 11:30.
author: Erica L.

description:
* Blue Bottle coffee & coffee punch card
* fresh, local, mostly organic produce, meats, cheeses
* nice salad/sandwich combinations for lunch
* generally don't have too long of a wait
* compostable forks/knives
- like the little side of fruit w/your lunch

* not always a big enough portion if I'm super hungry (say post-workout or if I've had a light breakfast)
* a little pricey for what you get
* no outdoor seating (based on location really) - but there are a decent number of seats inside (I think mostly 2-top tables though) and they have plenty of water available, help yourself and usually decent music playing
author: Abby W.

description:
A lunchtime fave of mine. I can't get enough of healthy take-out options. I love the seasonal variety of sandwiches and salads.  Others are right its pricey but I feel that I get a true value. Try the chicken salad sandwich or salad.

The staff and owners are friendly. Always a plus at any establishment. Also try their restaurant in Oakland - B.
author: Gray S.

description:
I am changing my previous review where I expressed disappointment at the quality of the tempeh sandwich and lack of vegan options. I've added one star because they sliced the tempeh sandwich and made it a little better. 

Boxed Foods Company is a great place for fresh sandwiches and salads. Portions are generous enough and the quality is very good. Going there and buying beautifully crafted foods is a happy experience.

My only gripe is the selection of vegetarian options. The Tofu Salad is a bit too meager, and it's one of the only vegan options. The Tempeh Sandwich has gotten worse since they started using patties, and the sundried tomato tapenade is too greasy. I haven't tried the brie press, but the sound of it is so unsubstantial that I haven't even wanted to.

Lettus in the Marina makes a bunch of incredible sandwiches with lots of vegetarian and strict vegetarian options. Down the street, Sellers Markets is now offering an "ALT" - avocado instead of bacon with hummus to add a bit of substance. Even the roasted veggie sandwich at Briazz is decent - not strict veg, but okay and without the wait. 

NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: what's the problem with satisfying those who want to be a little greener and healthier by abstaining from meat, dairy, and eggs? Will you try out the sandwiches at Lettus to see what's possible? Even better, how about giving us some great new options that we haven't seen before in San Francisco? Here are some ideas:

VLT: Veggie bacon, veganaise, lettuce, tomato
Seitan sandwich
Jive Turkey Salad
Portobello/caramelized onion sandwich
Baked thai tofu sandwich

Let's see it!!
author: Christian B.

description:
I shouldn't have gone in this place.  It was a very very bad idea.  HOW can I try to save for the trip to Portugal I want when I know there is Kombucha (2 brands!!), tempeh salad and Dagoba mocha choco coffee drink a block from my work??  AND I think I have a crush on the guy working there (just kidding Cowboy).  THANKS A LOT jerks.  I should have just stayed at the gym for another 10 minutes, I'd be hungry and rich!
As one person said already, more vegan (well he said vegetarian, i say quit being a pussy and go vegan) options would be nice.  But, honestly I'm happy they have any at all.  God, just don't let them ever have vegan cookies.
author: Katherine K.

description:
I just got back from Boxed Foods and purposely waited to write this review because I have eaten there before, but it's been a few months.  The food should receive a solid 5 stars and the only reason I give it a 4 is because it is generally really packed at lunch time and there really isn't anywhere to sit (a few 2 person tables amongst the traffic).  If you took all the food there and served it on a sunny patio they would be G2G.  It's the financial district though, so they do what they can.

So, the tempeh lettuce wrap is my all time favorite item on the menu, but their salads and sandos are great too (all very organic and fresh).  They even go the extra mile and put orange slices and mint leaves in the water - classy.   Also, the staff there is super friendly.  The guy who made my food and handed it to me was ALL smiles.  I felt like giving him a hug.
author: Carlyna R.

description:
Today's sandwich was one of the best I have had in a while...

I ordered the Honey-Lime Chicken Sandwich with grilled chicken breast, red onions, haas avocados, tomatoes and a garlic-citrus aioli. It had the perfect combination of honey and lime. It was a perfect balance of sweet and tart. 

The other sandwiches on the menu look just as awesome, so I will be back here very soon until I try them all! Then I'll be back again!
author: Jason B.

description: I love the Tempeh sandwich and salad here. The best vegetarian/vegan sandwich you can have for lunch in this area. When its sunny out, its really nice to sit out in the back on Claude Lane.
author: t s.

description:
Boxed Foods is a solid lunch option for under $10.  No, not the cheapest, but if you want fresh delicious ingredients, this is the place.  

I've had several sandwiches and salads from here, all above standard... but right now what has me hooked is their Marinated Tofu and Glass Noodle Salad.   YUM!  

Even with prices being on the higher side of lunch options, it's worth putting in the rotation.  Quality dammit, quality!
author: Kelly K.

description:
Great sandwiches and salads. If you want a processed meat sandwich for $4 bucks meet Jared at Subway, if you want a great fresh organic sandwich or salad go to Boxed. Chicken salad sandwich or the Chicken Lime is great! I love going here! Great side salad comes with your sandwich and they have a great variety of drinks. 
Great coffee too if you find yourself walking by in the morning!
My only complaint is this is the only location in the city.
author: Matt L.

description:
I had a bit of an embarrassing experience here today. I went to fill up my water bottle with the free water provided but I ended up spilling water from the water jug all over the floor. I could not make it stop! One of the staff had to take it to the sink and let it drain out. I was really embarrassed! 

The food was pretty good, the service was nice. You get a salad with your sandwich which is sweet. The prices are a bit high for a lunch joint, but the food is good so it is worth it.
author: Charissa W.

description:
I used to come here all the time 2 years ago, than I started going to Mixt Greens.  I got the Chicken Lime sandwich on whole wheat bread and it was AWESOME!  
Good because...
1.  Cost me under $10.
2.  The whole wheat bread tasty and I could tell that it was costing me a lot of calories.  It's hard to find a low cal sandwich b/c the contents are usually but on a ciabatta (s/p) or Panini slab.... I was actually full for once!
3.  Came w/ a side salad that had a yummy vinegrette dressing (on the side, but I dumpted it all on b/c it was so good)

Paying $15 for a salad is getting old when they have the same menu, Boxed is my new lunch place!
author: Valerie D.

description:
This place is GOOD!!! the boxed chicken sandwich is Bom dot .com!!  yes, i said bomb dot com

I come here in between breaks at work often. I would give them 5 stars but i had to take one off because they close at 3.30. I work till 8 most nights so its a major bummer when i am craving some of their good food. 

Every-time i am here they are busy. The guy at the register is hot too so major plus!!!
author: Wes P.

description:
When this place opened, I worked right around the corner and had to make a concerted effort not to eat there every damn day!  The fresh ingredients and creative combinations really make this place stand out.  Everything is good, the Pear and Brie press, are you kidding?!?  My current favorite is the Proscuitto Asparagus and Parmesan Panini (w/ cantaloupe), which I had today and WOW, there aren't words... 

*The sandwiches could use a little less mayo... too much is just too much, but just right, now that's the ticket.
author: Kyla B.

description:
Granted, it's pretty awesome that you serve Blue Bottle drip coffee for $2, and you guys play some great music in there, but I don't get why there's a line out the door in the first place.

I've had the BLT and the Flank Steak Sandwich here, and they were both served absolutely cold, which left me cold. What's the point of using organic, family farm, super local ingredients when you can't taste them over the amazing aioli anyway, because they're served ice-cold? I'm guessing the answer is -- there's a line out the door already, so who gives a shit? 

(BTW, the finance Alpha-type guy in line in front of me simply got in line and simultaneously ordered his food on his phone, while yours, beta, truly was like "Duh, that's a good idea." and stood there waiting in line to order and then also waited to get it. Lesson learned, the hard way.)
author: Adam Z.

description:
Finally got around to trying this place, and it was less than satisfying. 
Our food took at least 15 min and then when it came our side salads were made w/ frozen greens! 

We figure they must not know , so we feel it's the right thing to do to inform them and we do so nicely.  Their response?  To our inedible ice age side salads?  We're sorry and are having refrigeration problems.  

First time and last time customer. I'll be at Mixt Greens when I want to spend $10 on salad that is FRESH and where customer service is a priority.
author: Sarah B.

description:
The honey-lime avocado chicken sandwich is absolutely delicious. They have lots of creative takes on sandwiches, with fresh flavorful ingredients. 

One star off because if you ever try to get something not exactly the way it is (e.g. no X, or substitute A for B) then they will always, and I mean always, screw it up. But if you just order straight off the menu & aren't at all picky, then it's a really good bet for a healthy & yummy lunch.
author: S. M.

description:
$8 minimum for a sandwich. I had the turkey and artichoke, but WHERE is the artichoke? It was like a pesto. Anyway, I've had better sandwiches. I thought I try it for lunch only because I've seen long lines that went out the door when buying a sandwich at Working Girls Cafe BUT the long lines were due to their limited number of cash registers, only ONE. While waiting for your food you can stand around near the wall (tight space) and browse through their large variety of magazines.

Boxed Foods is unique for their unique ingredients like artichoke, organic apples, strawberry dressing, feta cheese...
author: Oanh N.

description:
I love going to this place for lunch. I've only had the pleasure of ordering their tantalizingly smokey chicken salad sandwich and salad but after that first try, I was hooked and very impressed. Everything is so fresh and so tasty. I love how they tend to mix fruit, like apples and strawberries, into their salads. It is a bit on the pricier side but it's very well worth it. I wish I could go every day and order something different from their floor-to-ceiling chalkboard menu. It might take me a while to get through it though since there are plenty of yummy things to choose from.

But hey, if you want fresh and tasty, and you want to give those $2.99 Subway specials a break, and please do, you're in for a treat here. Come on, live a little. Your taste buds will thank you.
author: Michelle G.

description: It's nice to have reasonably priced food that gives you both a salad and a full sandwich!  (Well, as reasonably priced as financial district can be.)  I've had both the tempeh sandwich and the chicken panini and have been happy with both.  The salad just tops it off!
author: Ken L.

description: this review is primarily for the honey lime avocado chicken sandwich, which is absolutely amazing. This place actually puts honey as a dressing and makes it work. The lines to this place are usually long so come early.
author: Olga B.

description:
*UPDATE 8/29/07* Downgraded to 2 stars. Pathetic inconsistencies in quality. Disappointing. This time the grilled chicken breast had the texture of dried wattle jerky and difficult to chew. The greens in the sandwich was ICEBERG LETTUCE.  Depressing. In just over a year, this place has gone from stellar to suck. Way to go.

*UPDATE 7/13/06* Downgraded to 3 stars. Been back there several times recently and notice an inconsistency in how certain sandwiches/salads are made. Sometimes the Boxed Chicken Salad Sandwich has chicken chunks that are way too gigantic. Boxed Chick Salad came without the crispy pancetta. Honey Lime Chicken is no longer a piece of grilled chicken breast but sliced. Salad dressing was very lumpy and had coagulated mystery chunks. Yummy side greens are just greens now with shaved cheese, but no longer any fruit bits included. What's up with that?!

**Original rating: 4 stars**
Freakin' delicious...and the kind of quality food that makes you feel terrific afterwards--not bloated, farty, msg-aftertaste-lingering or food coma-ish. You're left in a state of bliss. 

Service is usually good, but they OFTEN run out of bread (and even greens, and other ingredients such as tempeh) because business is so good. A few mistakes--giving me the wrong order, which I only find out once I got back to my office. Or accidentally dropping my order, prolonging the wait time. Grrr. Pricey, yes. But sigh...the food is really good, staff is friendly, place is clean and I have yet to find a hair in my salad.
author: Trixie J.

description:
Dear Boxed Foods Company,

Despite your prices, I've been a fan of your Boxed Chicken Salad, Boxed Chicken Sandwich and Pear and Brie Press Sandwich for a while now. Used to be, you stood for quality and oh-so delicious food.

Today I had a Pear & Brie Sandwich which left me embarrassed for you. 

Really? One sad strip of Brie on each half? Sheesh, I never even got the usual orange wedge garnish.

::Sigh::

I hope you can turn things around before I dedicate my life to Best O' Burger.

A concerned fan,
Tanya
author: Tanya S.

description: This place is amazing! Service is friendly, food is fresh and delicious. Can't really ask for anything more. Everything I have tried on the menu is great, but the Steak Salad is my favorite. Enjoy!
author: Megan O.

description:
UPDATE 11/20/07:  My beloved Boxed Foods- what has become of you?  You were the only place in town that had good tempeh- but now you carelessly degrade it by putting it on a kaiser roll (instead of Acme bread) and top the whole thing with oily sundried tomatoes.  And you used to care about us vegan minorities.  Since when did vegan mean no cheese on the sandwich but cheese on the salad?  Now where will I go to get good tempeh?  How very sad...

My original rating: 4 stars
This is the best lunch place I've been to yet- for great sandwiches and salads.  Their tempeh is amazing- which is usually not the case at other places.  They are creative with their salads and dressings and they are the only other place where I've found vegetarian lettuce wraps, besides P.F. Chang's.   

This place is definitely worth the extra dollar or so you'll spend on lunch!
author: Sima S.

description:
I like Mario here. He always takes my order correctly and knows me by what I order, but not by name. 

The foods good, especially for the FiDi and don't go to late, the line is out the door if you do.
author: Dustin H.

description: Innovative, fresh, healthy, Eco friendly, fast, reasonable ish prices, and helpful staff. Devine lunch spot with delicious food and perfect portions. They have clever sandwich and food options, plus drip coffee. It's a sophisticated urban picnic:)
author: Bae L.

description:
3.5

Really fresh avocado and really tasty avocado dressing on the chicken & avocado salad.  The super sweet orange slice that comes w/ the salads are a nice touch.
--
Pretty good.  Had the grilled chicken salad.  Can't help but compare this place w/ all of the other salad places in the FiDi.  Still.. The Champion... is... Mixt Greens!  The greens & veggies at BF are not quite as fresh as MG.  BUT, BF gives you huge slices of chicken breast and goat cheese.  The chicken, tho, was not as well cooked nor as flavorful as at MG.  And the julienned apple was not to my liking; you can't taste it really if you cut them that small, esp. if they lack flavor to begin with.  Plus, there's more of a wait and less variety here.  

Stuff I did like:  the caramelized onions, tho too few, in my salad; the magazines while you wait (I mean really, who can ever get enough of 7x7 (that's a joke, btw); beverages -- kombucha, Vita Coco!!!, Japanese teas.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Thank you Yelpers! I would have NEVER found this place if it weren't for your reviews. The Prosciutto, asparagus, melon & shaved Parmesan panini was amazing. It actually came on a nut bread rather than a panini but that made it even more delicious. 
Also they have a little outside area in the back which is perfect for days like today.
author: Doro P.

description:
Yes, the food is amazing. I particularly love the signature Box Chicken Salad--so light, with goodies like pancetta and green apple slices.

The service, however, is terrible.

I have waited for 10+ minutes at 11am, when I was the only customer inside.  And don't even think about asking nicely if they might have forgotten about your order (which has, incidentally, happened to me).  The manager will most likely respond passive agressively, in a tone that suggests that she doubts your ability to understand English, and then make you wait for a while longer.

If you're in a hurry, go to Working Girls.
author: Emily L.

description:
I called in my order as I left work, ran a couple errands, and then my sandwich was ready. Nice and convenient. The sandwich, salad, slice of orange and box it came in all seemed very fresh and nicely presented, so +1 for all of that. 

I think the sandwich itself though would have been much better if it was warm and not cold. Boo. I wonder if they would have done that if I had asked. I don't know if I'll be going back though since there are so many other places to try out. If you're looking for a place with really fresh food (oh and they have little tables and seats so that you can eat there if you want) this is your spot. If you're looking for a sandwich that you'll still be thinking about the next day, don't go and order the box chicken salad sandwich.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Based on another Yelper's Review, I ordered the Honey-Lime Chicken... DEE-LISH!!!! I am totally blown away by this Sando! I've heard mixed reviews, but that review totally helped my lunch happiness today!! :)
author: Karen G.

description:
I'm a fan because they have Blue Bottle, not because their food wows me.

The salads aren't mixed and the dressing is always served on the side. What about this seems a bit...overpriced? I mean...I could create that damn salad at a salad bar and save myself a few bucks. 

The croissant I had there was...horrible. It failed to impress me in any way.

The Blue Bottle by-the-cup, though? Genius. Absolutely genius. I can avoid long-lines and pretentiousness and get my fix during the work week a mere two blocks away from my office.

And for that, they earn the two stars I gave them.
author: Danyell K.

description: Boxed Foods cranks out really great sandwiches from a small space... highly recommend the Chicken Salad (has Granny Smith Apples) and the Grilled Flank Steak Sandwich... my girlfriend and I walked out the back and sat in the alley behind the restaurant, we had the whole place to ourselves.  At first, I wasn't even sure which restaurant owned the tables and umbrellas out there... I know, I said "alley" but it was clean and quiet.  As we ate, we talked and listened to the background noise of civilization.  A cool break from Union Square's pandemonium.
author: Scott P.

description:
The food is always fresh and flavorful.  There is always a line at lunchtime, because the food is so good.  The kitchen has gotten a bit slow lately and the wait can be up to 15 or 20 minutes for a sandwich or salad.
The have 2 fresh water pitchers, one with orange slices and one with mint that you can enjoy while you wait. They have a decent magazine selection.
author: PictureGirl F.

description:
I'm done with you, BFC. Food is goodish, not fantastic, and today I waited 15 minutes just to place my order. I got my food quickly because I complained about the wait, but the other customers were just as hangry as me, and had to wait at least another 10 minutes for their lunch.

I couldn't resist and had to complain to the cashier (ok, it was her first day, but maybe let her do every 2nd order to get people through faster) and I also complained to the manager. The manager clearly has a bit to learn about customer service (he basically said 'not my fault, not my problem, I don't care') and OPERATIONS!!  Hello! You have a great thing going there! People are willing to line up out the door! Can you imagine how many more sandwiches you'd sell if you didn't turn people off by making them wait 25 minutes for a quick lunch??? Please....

I'm done. No more BFC for me.
author: anna l.

description:
When I feel like spending 10 dollars on a really yummy sandwich (which is rare for this pb&j gal), I go to Boxed Foods.  The walnut bread is delish!  I always tend to order the pressed pear and brie sandwich, the brie is just melty enough to make the pears stay in the sandwich.  The side salad is a perfect complement to any of the sandwiches.  I also really like the free cucumber water, although my visit today only included regular water; no cuke spear to liven it up.

I like to eat in the back alley.  It is a nice calm alternative to trying to grab a table inside.  Also, all of the tables are only for two people, but if you go before/after the lunch rush, you can grab a few chairs to seat more friends.

Nice selection of bottled juices and teas!
author: Sarah L.

description:
Like others have said, lunchtime gets a bit hectic, so if you can, come early. 

I've only had one sandwich here, which is their lime chicken. It was delicious and filling. Worth the $8. 

My tip to you is to BYOD as the beverages tend to run on the expensive side. $1.50 for a can of soda...what is this a hot dog stand? I will give them kudos for having a varied and niche selection of beverages, including Kombucha Wonder Drink, which is sure to either add years to your life, or give you the strength of 11 lemurs.  

The service and speed were great though. Recommended.
author: Josh L.

description:
I went there for lunch today and ordered the boxed chicken sandwich. I came after 1 so there wasn't much of a line and the food came promptly. The sandwich was pretty good as was the salad that came with it. The flavoring had a nice subtlety to it and everything tasted really healthy/fresh. I like how they use apples in the sandwich. Very nice touch. It was pretty satisfying but not OMG GREAT like everyone else make it seem. I didn't feel satisfied after eating it for some weird reason.

Overall, this place was average. Maybe a little above average. Not excellent, not bad..so three stars (er.... boxes?) for you!
author: Kien N.

description:
I went here on Monday with high hopes considering the 4-star rating here on Yelp. Unfortunately, I ended up sorely disappointed.

The place itself seemed nice enough. Though the service was pretty slow, the inside was very clean. I ordered the BLT expecting delicious and scrumptious applewood bacon, yet when I took my first bite after returning to my office, I noticed something terribly terribly wrong.

I don't mind my bacon slightly crispy or slightly chewy. The bacon in this BLT was both and in the worst way. After dissecting the BLT, I found that the top layer of bacon was completely incinerated and black while the bacon underneath it was floppy and looked undercooked. I'm still in awe as to how they managed to put both undercooked and extremely overcooked bacon in the same sandwich. It was almost as if undercooked bacon was placed on the bread and the top layer was subsequently blasted at super high heat in a toaster oven. I found the sandwich inedible and had to throw it away after only a few bites.

I honestly can't comment on the quality of the rest of the food as this was my first time here. If the BLT I had is any indication of how the rest of the food is, then count me out!
author: Alexander C.

description:
I'm a regular here, which is a well-mannered way of saying addicted junkie.

Whether salads or sandwiches are your pleasure, you'll definitely find something to enjoy here.  For sandwiches, I alternate between the Honey Lime Chicken and the Boxwich Chicken Salad.  For salads, it is hard to beat (groan) the beet salad, which comes with a generous slab of Humboldt Fog chevre artistically laid across the top.  Mmm...  I shouldn't be hungry already.

Top off the great food with a really fantastic and sweet staff and I find this to be one of the best places to grab lunch in the FD.
author: Zack L.

description: Good, solid sandwiches with lots of interesting choices.  I had the turkey and avocado sandwich which was good, but I was disappointed that they only have two types of bread.  Service was great.
author: Wendy L.

description: The food here is excellent (I recently went and had the flank steak sandwich) but the ambiance and service leaves something to be desired.  I had my lunch to go though so it didn't really matter but the drink selection was pretty weak.  Otherwise they would have gotten 5 stars but I will be back.
author: Blake B.

description: Everything is pretty solid here, from the honey lime chicken to the steak flank salad. There's usually a daunting line, but after ordering you're usually good to go within 5 minutes. While all the exotic beverage options look tempting, I've found they're not with the extra price. And since they serve Blue Bottle coffee, why would you want to drink anything else?
author: Adam D.

description: Decent food for the most part but I really enjoy their honey chicken sandwich. A bit pricey but it is down town San Francisco.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Pretty durn good.  Yummy salad and interested flavors, BUT undercooked chicken has to bring down a place's star rating.  I had what appeared to be a lovely chicken salad -- lovely except for the one large piece of nearly raw chicken in  the middle... i like many of my meats rare, but chicken is not one of them. 

Also, why not plump up the salads with more greens?  they are probably the least expensive ingredient in the salad and adding a little more would make a big difference (would help me feel better about buying a $9 salad)

the staff is very smiley and helpful though
author: Jess O.

description:
This place is great for a good, well priced lunch.  Everything is healthy and flavorful and the people are very nice.  I love the flank steak salad as well as the boxed chicken salad.  The portions are rather generous and I usually feel satisfied afterward which is great, because often a salad does not make you full.  A lot of other salad places fill your plate with lettuce and scrimp on the goods.  Not this place.  They are quite generous with the meat.  They also have creative additions like mint in some of the salads.

If you are a fan of Blue Bottle coffee you can get it here before two pm.  I have it occasionally, although I am not the biggest follower.  If you work near Boxed Foods, it is definitely the best salad place around, so trek on in.
author: apple r.

description:
My roommate told me to stop by here if I was ever in the area, as she raved about it.  Because she knows of (and routinely teases me about) my critical Yelp reviews and how seriously I take my internal value construction when dining out, I thought she'd be sending me to a place that was so over-the-top good that I was bound to love it.  WRONG!

First off, the space is adorable.  I wish it was bigger and had a cozier cafe-feel, but they do a lot with the real estate they have.  They provide artsy magazines for perusal while waiting for your order, and the eat-in is served on compost-able plates - nice touch.

We ordered the tofu salad and the boxed chicken sandwich, and after a very short wait (we were able to dodge the lunch rush), our meals appeared.

My salad was extremely bland.  The tofu was cold and flavorless, and could have benefited from some strong marinade or a bit of grilling.  The dressing was applied liberally, so be sure to ask for it on the side to control the drippy/soggy-factor.  Salad mix-ins were boring and uninventive, and I would not order this again.

My date's sandwich was on some sort of bland, run of the mill roll, but the actual chicken inside was very tasty and well-seasoned.  Also, his accompanying side-salad was well-dressed and had shaved cheese for that added salt-factor.  His side salad was actually more satisfying than my entrée salad.  

I walked out, disappointed, feeling like I just spent far too much on a sub-par sandwich (but I suppose that's what you get in any financial district).  I proceeded to go home and tell my roommate that I didn't love her suggestion...and that's when she reminded me that she only suggested it because the bread used for some of the sandwiches is "to die for".  Oh. Right. She said to try the bread.  Well, perhaps I would have liked it a bit more had I tried the "delicious" bread.  Perhaps you'll want to heed my warning and listen to my roommate...go for the bread-y things, skip the tofu salad.
author: Heather G.

description:
You gotta give it to the chicken lime avocado sandwich.  It's really good!! And after you're finished, u get that satisfying meal feeling.  That's the extra star.  And the feeling that you'll likely do it again and again.  That's the kind of food that will enslave you....
I work a block away. I will def. be back!!!
author: AhLin C.

description:
Had the grilled chicken panini today, all the while thinking, "ok how good can this really be? An $8 sandwich? Come on."

But, it was good. Really. 

The mixed greens (and house vinaigrette) that come with the sandwich were taaasty-- with fresh grated cheese, no less. 

The greens and the sandwich really went well together- although I didn't expect the focaccia bread for the panini. Still good.
I'd drop another $8 any time.
author: Lily L.

description:
I usually don't Yelp places that have 100+ reviews but I am sitting at my desk (should be working) and eating a BF Tempeh Sandwich. I am sooooo throughly disappointed right now. I spent $9.25 on a dry sandwich with little flavor. If I ate meat maybe I would be giving this place more stars (bacon lovers seem to really dig BF). 

Perhaps the most disappointing thing is the avocado "love." For more than a buck extra I was expecting real love, not "like." I can barely see it on the bun. That's not love.

Burger Bistro (down a block on Bush) must have stolen all the love from BF. When Burger Bistro adds extra avo, they mean it. Be still my heart!
author: Regina S.

description:
One of the attorneys I work for took me to Boxed foods today with a little help from Green Zebra. 
We both got the same thing - Boxed Chicken Sandwich - despite hating to order the same thing as others in our party. Neither of us could resist the sounds of pulled chicken, lemon, bacon and apples with pesto. The greens that came with it were a bit under dressed. I almost wanted to squeeze my orange wedge over them for some flavor. 
I also had the delight of ordering my first cup of Blue Bottle coffee. Tasty - too bad it can't be hotter! He got a soda. 
Total bill $11.85.  Not bad. 

We both agreed it's a once in a while place due to the price but that with the coupon it was worth it!
author: Elsa E.

description: Fantastic sandwich, and the super fast, friendly service by Ivan was fantastic. Can't recommend it enough. The honey chicken with avacado was great.
author: Andrew L.

description: I have been dissapointed by this place twice now!! it is pretty expensive for what you get, and i am sorry to say but it might be a little too healthy for me! (and this is saying a lot since i am a vegetarian and love to eat healthy)  i have ordered the tempeh lettuce wrap and a rather unmemorable salad. i truly appreciate the restaurant using fresh, organic ingredients, but my meals made me feel like i was eating dirt and twigs! they have a restaurant in oakland....maybe the food is better on a white tablecloth?
author: Kaylan S.

description: YUMMMM!!! I loveeeeeee the flank steak sandwich!!!! It was delicious! It is a little pricey, but it was completely worth it for me. I didn't care too much for the plates, they were flimsy and seemed like a waste to me even though I recycled the plate.
author: Jen P.

description:
Truly one of the most delicious sandwiches I have ever had came from Boxed Foods last Friday.

I happened to be on Kearny, so thought I would give this little place a try. Little is the key word there...not many tables and if there is a line, you are kind of scrunched in the corner.

Also, beware...the menu is only written on the wall, so if anyone is in line, they are standing in front of it and you are kind of SOL. I would have rather had something right in front of me, or at least on the door so I could decide before going into the little shop. 

I had the chicken and avo sandwich without the avo. While waiting, I had the chance to watch one of the chefs make a salad. This thing was a work of art. The way he piled on the lettuce, then oh-so-carefully put the pieces of bread on the side, and trickled a few cherry tomatoes on the side in a perfect manner. All this for a salad? It was awesome.

I got my little white box of food and went on my merry way, not quite knowing what to expect once I opened it. I sat at my desk and got to check it out. The sandwich was delicious. Just the right amount of lemon mayo and tender chicken. The salad was fine, a little too much shredded cheese for my taste but the dressing was delicious. It was enough to fill me up, so I was pretty happy. 

I wish they had offered a little discount, me having taken the avo off the sandwich, but oh well. Prices are high all over the FiDi and this was no exception, but I knew I was getting a high-quality meal.
author: Annie F.

description:
My ever-evolving review of BFC...

WHY ARE YOU SO INCONSISTENT?? Today, I'm sure that my sandwich was made two hours before I purchased it. The bread was soggy and the lettuce was wilty. I'm back on a BF hiatus.

ON another occasion: 
Thanks for the improvements! I'm back for your Boxed Chicken Sandwich (new improved bread). Today I tried the grilled chicken salad... so far so good. The new steak sandwich is pretty good, but not out of this world.
author: Sahra H.

description:
I love this place for lunch because everything is just like I make when I make my lunch to bring.  

Their chicken breasts are moist and tasty, not dried and hacked.  They don't put too much dressing on their salads.  The fruit and vegetables look and taste great - they aren't limp or wilty or spotty.

An excellent stop on the Kearny Street Food Court.
author: Robyn C.

description:
I really enjoy their chicken and "chicken salad" sandwiches.  I put chicken salad in quotes because its more of their interpretation of a chicken salad sandwich.

There is usually a line so don't let that scare ya off.  Though they have seating, it is limited, so its usually easier to get it to-go.
author: Brad T.

description:
Holy Bovine, Batman! 

The Flank Steak Sandwich at the Boxed Foods Company incites my mouth to salivate just at the mention of it. The steak is so tender and moist, it just melts in your mouth.

I'm hooked. And yes, the price is a little more than I usually like to dish out for a lunch time meal, but it's a treat.
author: M O.

description: Yikes. Ate here for the first and last time today. I got the Tofu and Noodle Salad, which sounds as though it should be wonderful, except it had no flavor. Zero. They seem to have missed the memo that tofu needs to be pressed in order to absorb flavor from a marinade. I don't need a second date with this place in order to determine that I'm not interested when I can walk another block to Urban Picnic and get a salad or sandwich that knocks my socks off.
author: Ell B.

description:
Finally made it to Boxed Foods after hearing lots of noise about it from our creative department... There's generally a line, but it moves pretty quickly, and while I don't think the sandwiches are worth the wait, the salads definitely are: super fresh, tasty, with great dressing. Try the tempeh salad if they have it, probably one of the best iterations of tempeh I've ever had - seriously.

They have a good number of two-tops tucked in the back + generally there's space; they all feel a bit like they're in the kitchen, so I'd get it to eat outside instead.
author: Allie H.

description:
The tempeh sandwich is really, really good. I had it 5 days in a row once. And I don't even like tempeh. The bread it comes on, though, is unpredictable. Order everything sans cheese and you've got a hella good vegan lunch. 

The staff is nice. Quick and friendly but in an unremarkable, they-get-the-job-done kind of way.

It's a bit on the spendy side for lunch though. $8 for a sandwich without a drink can seem a bit ridiculous some days.
author: Chelsea G.

description:
Fives words for their four stars.

Honey Lime Avocado Chicken Sandwich. 

Quite possibly the best sandwich I ever had.   Generous portions of chicken, subtle honey lime flavors, smooth avocados on a soft foccacia bread.....reason why it isn't 5 stars.  The price.   If it was a bit cheaper I will go there everyday.....sigh......
author: Chris C.

description:
The food and presentation here is excellent.  My only issue with the place is that it can be a little expensive for the portion size.  I love walking in on a beautiful day, ordering the sandwich with artichoke spread, taking my beautiful boxed sandwich and salad (with lots of great cheese in it), and walking down to one of the parks around the financial district and eating outside.  

This restaurant makes the perfect meal-to-go.  It's a high-end brown-bag lunch.
author: Eric N.

description:
Isn't it better to take lunch a little early or a little late anyways, so you don't have to be one of the lemmings packed onto the streets of downtown huffing and puffing your way into some joint to grab forgettable food and run back to your desk. Really, we need more "me" time here, people. Or I guess that would be "you" time.

Chicken avocado salad--enough for lunch and a late afternoon snack, with some divine avocado vinaigrette. Prosciutto BLT a little greasy.  Morning croissants and coffee from the lovely Mario--starting your day off right. And was I going to spend my money on "Details" magazine? No, so I can just read it here while I wait.
author: mahi m.

description:
I haven't been to Boxed for some time but do remember that they have great sandwiches.

Recently I went back after a long hiatus for lunch.  As I was waiting in line to order, one of the guys posted a sign on the menu board - "No more sandwiches - out of bread -  sorry."

OUT OF BREAD?  Guys I have to knock off at least one star for that.

Who the f runs out of bread???
author: Dpb T.

description:
This is the exact color scheme I want my room to be-mint green & turquoise blues..luckily the food at Boxed Foods company was just as soothing as the decor.

A relief from the sandwich shops which I frequent in SOMA/South park..the BLT was just what I needed! Crispy bacon, toasted bread, tomato, mayo and a side salad with tangy funky dressing...ahhhh!
author: Amruta G.

description:
This place is good.  Saw this while walking around for lunch and a filling lunch sandwich + salad is worth it.  I got my lunch to go so it was in a box, but I couldn't keep my eye off the plate that they were preparing for the next table.  They served it in a way that it was still relatively elegant :-p 

Lunch for under 10 bucks.  Salads and sandwiches that are worth and friendly service, although heavy accent was hard to tell what they were saying sometimes.

Parking: You should so walk here, unless you want to park on the street.
author: Omar L.

description:
I'm going to give Boxed the nod for providing quality ingredients and an intriguing menu.  Definitely a step up over your vanilla salad/sandwich fare.  You'll see pears, asiago and the like up on yonder menu board.

But, oh great Boxed overlords, can you not grant me more than a pittance of meat and toppings on my meager sandwich?  You make me hungry an hour later -- not a successful lunch for $10.
author: Rob W.

description:
Well of the handful of panini+salad places I've been to, this is by far my favorite. I left the place a bit hungry (but that could just be my giant belly) but my panini was perfectly grilled. They make their panini on SLICED bread instead of rolls, so I thought that was a great change.

Also, if you care, they serve Blue Bottle Coffee!

Seating: For a downtown destination, they had plenty of seating. About 20 ppl can sit (on small tables) inside and another 15 or so outside on the pretty alley (Claud Lane). They bring the food to you, how civilized is that.

Another plus for compostable forks.
author: Ayse B.

description: The line was out the door when I came for lunch.  I ordered the Boxed Chicken Salad and it was tasty with high quality ingredients.  Great for a take-away order, but the restaurant itself leaves something to be desired.  Only a couple of sad looking tables and an uninviting atmosphere.  Fine for take-away, but not a place to sit and eat.
author: Courtney J.

description: Cute place, great lunch spot. I had the chicken artichoke panini it was so good!
author: Mariange R.

description: My favorite salad in all of San Francisco is the boxed chicken salad (minus the onions). It's always fresh and filling. Good thing I don't work any closer to this place or I would be here all the time!
author: CC M.

description:
I'm a fan of this place. Really. I work right around the corner 3 days out of the week, and I have a really short lunch break. My trick is to call in an order to go about 10 minutes before my lunch break starts... then I run out the door and around the corner, pay for my salad, and then I have enough time to eat. Thanks boxed foods for being so quick and clean with my phone orders!
I love the taste of the salads I've eaten here, fresh veggies, organic meat, I love when I find tiny pieces parsnips in my salad and I'm like "oh, it's a parsnip!"
My only problem, and it is a problem because I find myself going there less and less, is that whenever I eat here I find myself famished an hour later. So as much as I love their salads --- i prefer other places at lunch break, which is unfortunate because I love their food, but for the price I'm paying to get food there, I need stamina to last me til 7 pm!
author: Allegra W.

description: Had the Honey Lime Chicken sandwich.  Nice subtle honey flavor, plus avocado is key!, with a bit of salad makes a nice lunch.
author: Emma L.

description:
I love this lil joint. They got great and friendly staff that just knows how to make a killer sandwich and salad.

I love their drink selections.  The lavender soda is my FAV!!!
author: linda h.

description:
I love this place for lunch (and I've been dying to try out their restaurant at YBC!). It just feels good to know that I'm putting quality ingredients into my body- even for the price, the taste and freshness makes up for it.  I've only tried the salads so far, but here goes:

Best of:
Chicken and Avo Salad- fat slices of chickeny goodness, a couple slices of avocado, tomatoes, and this amazing avocado vinagrette.  delicious!
Boxed Chicken Salad- like chicken salad, but better.  little bacon crumbs and lots of veggie goodies, with that shredded chicken marinated in herbs and spices on the side.
Heirloom Tomato Salad- self explanatory.  and yumm.

Worst:
Tempeh salad- gross!! Chunky meatlike substance that tastes like wet cardboard chips.  If they took the tempeh out, it would probably be better.
author: Kayla B.

description:
Great sandwiches, great salads, great food.

A liiiiitle pricey, but worth your dollar.

Now serving Blue Bottle coffee...my life just got a little better.
author: Morgen N.

description:
This review is mostly for the coffee.  I've upped the frequency of the visits in recent weeks.  I used to love the spicy mocha, it worked well with the Blue Bottle coffee.  They've recently switched coffee to a yummy, and slightly mild Brazilian bean.  This coffee is better suited for a sparer preparation.  Stick with a cappuccino or a latte, and avoid the mocha that would overwhelm the delicate flavor.

Anyway, the staff here is really friendly.  They use yummy organic valley milk.  The coffee cake is really great: both crumbly and moist.  

I was mostly happy with my chicken salad.  After adding a bit of salt it was tasty, and the portion of chicken was generous.  I'll be back to try a few more dishes.  And enjoy the stellar coffee.
author: Jame E.

description:
ah, another overpriced fidi sandwich joint. 

it is pricey, definitely. but the food is very delicious. got the boxed chicken salad sandwich today - just the bun itself had me impressed! bite in and you dive nose first into the great smell of roasted sesame. sliced green apple was a nice touch with roasted chicken (well marinated!) and generous bacon pieces. 

even though it was another $8 sandwich, and not as big as sentinel's (still very full 2 hour later though!), i quite like the good, clean flavor. sandies mommy would make you if mommy opens a gourmet sando shop!
author: Fiona S.

description:
It is really nummy.  I love the acme herb slab bread they put the sandwiches on and the steak sandwich is killer (a little pink though:)

I will note, the seating sucks-it was like eating a $10 sandwhich in the bathroom.
author: S M.

description:
