Seriously... This place is not very good. I'm eating the Chicken and Avocado Salad as we speak. I can't believe I paid $8.25 for a crap load of mixed greens, 1/4 of an avocado and 1/2 a chicken breasts. Oh wait, its got a 1/3 of slice of some artisan bread on it... Oh and an orange slice! Gimme a break.

This place is a total gimmick. Its my second time there and I can honestly say that their food definitely tastes "boxed"... nothing outside the box here. And way overpriced!

Also, why do they INSIST on having you wait for your order and have you read magazines? Its like a cheesy nightclub with fake lines out the door.

Lame, lame, lame.
author: Simon S.

description:
I really wanted to give this place as 2.5 star rating, but as i can't give half star ratings and they do serve blue bottle coffee  I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt.  but then halfway through i writing this i remembered that they did not have coffee today.  way to go Boxed Foods!! you lose that star.

Ok, so first things first, they (supposedly)  serve blue bottle coffee.  YES! (obviously i like BBC a lot)  I was totally amped on getting some BBC in me today but when we went to get lunch, they were not serving any coffee at all, total drag.  My next experience involved meeting the hostess/order placer. wow, could you smile, or is your job to give nothing but total attitude to people coming to buy food from your store, thus keeping you employed.  Her "energy" was so negative that it may have tainted my sandwich.  I went with the the boxed chicken sandwich.  a shredded chicken sando with bacon, apples, and a garlic basil pesto spread.  sounds delicious, no? well no is indeed correct, it really did not wow me at all.  had all the materials to make a great sandwich, even came on focaccia, but it was nothing special .

I don't think I'd go back besides to get blue bottle coffee (is there anywhere closer to my office that serves it).  The service and food quality were just not great at all.  this area is a very up-and-coming spot as far as food is concerned.  I'd rather go try something new and hope for a win then settle for boring, generic food with no smile.
author: Andrew r.

description:
Boxed lunch is in my regular rotation of lunch restaruants. I work nearby so it's convenient. I like the panini sandwiches, I usually just get the grilled chicken, but the honey lime is nice when I want something different. Their sandwiches come with a little salad and piece of fruit which I like.

Their baked goods aren't great. I've gotten cookies and brownies but have never been wowed by them.

The biggest problem here is the line, and the waiting area. I don't like standing around in cramped quarters while waiting.
author: Nathan M.

description:
Boxed Foods Co.

There will be a wait, but that's OK because they are just really popular, thus really busy.

Their food is great.

Sadly, though, their food is not clean.  I was biting into my yummy veggie sammich (which they sweetly made up for me on the fly) when my eyes looked at the piece of lettuce I was about to eat - it was dirty lettuce.  Not brown or spotted, but actual dirt or black fabric particles (?) on the stem in my food.  Yes, I just picked that piece out and threw it away, but it did gross me out.

BFC, PLEASE wash your produce before you use it.  
And PLEASE use gloves-- watching hands finger the food I'm about to put in my mouth is not appetizing, nor would the health department consider it sanitary.

I still love your food.
author: Charis S.

description:
I've never had a salad as good as any on the menu at Boxed Foods. The salads are unique and the flavors are so well balanced. The greens are organic (I subtracted one star because once mine were a little wilted and old/smelly) and they don't overwhelm the salad like some restaurant's small amount of toppings, way too many greens, salads.

I also love that they have several salad options for vegetarians that aren't just the "same salad minus the meat" options you get at other places. They have a TEMPEH (love!) salad and baked tofu salad! Both are really great!

I wish it was a dollar or two cheaper because then I would eat lunch here more often (I work in the FiDi) but right now it's a lunch splurge.
author: Emily W.

description: Four stars, considering the location.  Every place you go downtown for lunch is going to be over priced, but at least at Box Foods, you're going to get something fairly healthful and made to order with fresh, high-quality ingredients.  They also serve BLUE BOTTLE coffee (try the spicy mocha).  Be aware that whether you get espresso or a drip, you're going to have to wait a few minutes.   But it's worth it.
author: Sven E.

description:
Stopped by this place for a quick bite yesterday.

I ordered the Boxed Chicken Salad, which was great!  Very tasty, good portion size.  It's not cheap, but relative to other FiDi prices it seemed fairly priced.

The line was pretty long, but they were working hard, so I think it's a reflection of their good food, even if it is annoying to wait when you're in a rush.

As the name implies, they serve all of their food in a box even if you eat in.  This is tolerable since the box is compostable and the place is too small for a dishwasher, but -1 star because no metal or compostable utensils were available.  I'll gladly return the star if they address this.
author: Mike F.

description: Tried the veggie sandwich....horrible. The sourdough was hard and the pesto almost tasteless. I think Naked Lunch does better sandwiches.
author: reva r.

description: Pretty much I give this place an A for a quick lunch stop. The salads and sandwiches will please anyone without a doubt. I particularly enjoy that the salads which are very creative with the likes of marinated tempeh, baked tofu and grilled veggies. Drinks range from bottled teas to diet coke and your meal is packed up in a box complete with plastic utensils and a napkin. Grab and go to the max. Healthy and tasty, that's all I'm saying!
author: Theresa T.

description: Boxed Foods you are delicious! We frequently get lunches here for our office meetings and so far I've never been disappointed with what I order. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, we asked for 2 dozen black and white cookies (on our last order) and unfortunately they only had 23 BUT the very apologetic and nice girl on the phone offered a variety of ways they could make up for not having enough black and white cookies.  We ended getting the 23 cookies and one other cookie that she said was their most popular cookie (I forget the name.)  They are always on-time with their deliveries and really know how to make delicious, healthy-tasting food! I will continue to keep them in my rotation for lunches in the FiDi : )
author: Tracy N.

description:
Yummmmy! 
Expensive for a sandwich but it is really good stuff & great service.

But why close so early??
author: Raoul R.

description: Great to-go lunch spot. I tried the turkey sandwich with artichoke spread and the chicken and goat cheese sandwich. Both were tasty, but the former was especially good. The salad on the side is a nice touch. The line was pretty long but it moved fast, and we got our food very quickly after ordering.
author: Adam B.

description: This review is only for the salads. Sorry fellow yelpers, I just don't get it. Been to Boxed Food Company twice and it's been a miss every time. This time I got the steak salad, the dressing was way to citrusy and the meat was tough.. The other day I ordered a chicken salad and again I didn't like.. I'll go back and try their panini next time. If I like it I'll update my review..
author: Monica S.

description:
You know the food is good when after you've eaten a salad with live bugs crawling around in the bottom of the container, you still go back again and again, cuz you think, whatever man, that organic produce is so farm-fresh it comes with its own live inhabitants.

Honestly, the sandwiches are amazing (if pricey) and the insect discovery was a one-time thing.  Just protein.

UPDATE: second insect sighting in the greens!
author: sunny d.

description:
I've been here a couple of times since it has been open and the level of service as well as the food remains very high in my book. However, I had some time to kill while waiting for my order and what's up with the IKEA decor. 

Namely the cookie jars that make me nauseous as they are the wanna-be tight seal ones that look plain cheap. Not only that but because they lack the cool aesthetics which this place almost achieves. Plus the cheap picture frames hanging along the wall. We all know these are the type you buy by the pack. 

Prices are high for food along Kearny and they should be a little more open to a slightly larger portion size. Nonetheless, a great place for a sandwich or salad as they have outdoor seating in the alleyway.
author: S L.

description: Two visits for lunch so far. Not sure I'll be back. Good, but not great. Over-priced for sure, so if you're on a budget, I'd look elsewhere. Chicken Panini was served practically cold, falling apart, chicken too dry. An $8 sandwich should be better (and this is one of the cheaper items on the menu).
author: Andrew J.

description: My girlfriend raved about the honey lime avocado sandwich.  I had the baked tofu salad.  We were both well satisfied.  I reccomend this place.
author: Jaime O.

description: Turkey sandwich was good.  $10 is not that cheap and the wait can be long.
author: Rong H.

description: I've only tried the boxed chicken salad because I'm obesessed with it. Oh yeah, they also have delicious croissants for only $1 after 1PM.
author: sunny c.

description: As good as anything you will find downtown.  The honey lime chicken sandwich is solid.  It's not going to change your life, but it's worth checking out.  Not to be a sketchy dude, but this seems to be a place where cute girls get their lunch... just throwing that out there!
author: Scott L.

description: Everyone in my office is in agreement that Boxed Foods has gone WAY downhill. It was a popular option at work since we are steps away from the place. If you're just going there for the first time, you have nothing to compare to, but the quality of the food used to be so much better. I loved the boxed chicken salad but it's changed for the worse and even when work is picking up the tab, it's a total disappointment (the last 3 times I've ordered it). Walk another couple of blocks to Mixt Greens where the quality of the food is still solid. Not horrible... but also not worth it.
author: margot b.

description:
I've got 7 more days to have lunch here before my office moves out of the neighborhood. WHY, OH WHY, HAVEN'T I BEEN HERE SOONER?!

I was able to have lunch here with lovely Miriam today. We were eager to compare it to Mixt Greens after hearing all the good things about this place. Like Mixt Greens, there was a long line out the door, but it went surprisingly quick. There were lots of people taking their boxes to go, but we were able to score a table in their tiny shop. I'd have to come back to try their salads in order to give it a fair comparison, but I got their $8 grilled chicken panini sandwich with goat cheese and sun dried tomatoes and a side of mixed greens. Very delicious and I even felt like I was getting healthier with each bite. The chicken sandwich at Mixt Greens does not compare! I loved my panini sandwich and there were a good 6 or 7 other sandwiches on their menu that all looked really good. I had a glass of POM peach passion white tea along with it. I was quite excited about taking the cute glass with me - they're really nice!

I'll be back tomorrow... and the following 6 days before we move.
author: Connie C.

description:
oh shnap.

(you know a good review starts that way)

Came here eons ago for lunch, so I can't remember what I had. But I came here a month or two ago for breakfast and for this little thing called Blue Bottle Coffee. Boxed Foods is not the source of this amazing drip. BB has their own shop downtown. But Boxed Foods sold me my first cup and I shall be forever grateful.

Blue Bottle Coffee filtered into a small glass is a treat in a mug. Imagine the rich, smoothness of a cup of hot chocolate made with hot, steamy milk. And the satisfaction that typically only a fine liquor (like an expensive scotch or tequila can bring). That's what this is. Normal coffee might have a bitter kick or aftertaste to it. This has NONE of it. You can drink it black, or be like me and add a touch of milk and sugar.

Top it off with an organic doughnut, which is a bit overpriced but tasty and you've got yourself off to a good start. Take my word for it.
author: Aaron F.

description: This is my favorite place for lunch in the neighborhood. Always a kind staff. Great food. Healthy. Excellent coffee.
author: Zack O.

description: Sandwiches like mom used to make, if you were raised in a loft in SoMa and your mom was a high-end Italian furniture designer. That being said, the ingredients are extremely fresh and delicious. The people who work their don't bat an eye at any kind of yupp-tastic request (aoli on the side etc...) They have Blue Bottle coffee though I've never partook and they have enough kambucha to choke a yoga practicing donkey. I recommend the steak salad or the chicken lime avocado sandwich as their top choices. if you feel like going a little fancier Boxed Foods should be your new jam.
author: Gabe b.

description:
i had a boss who told me that organic food was a scam and i that i was a moron for believing in it. (but when his DNA is all *@&#$ ed up who will the moron be then?!)  he claimed distributors just picked all the runts and slapped different stickers on them.  this must be because he has never eaten a proper organic meal or reads nat'l enquirer too seriously.

if i cared enough i would send him to BF and the difference would be undeniable. i think fondly of boxed foods. each bite is nourishing, nutritious and wonderfully seasoned. they appeal to the subtly of your tastebuds as well as being just plain good and wholesome (pairing artichoke and smoked turkey with grilled sweet onions). the drink selection is impressive as well, very unique and interesting. 

the drawbacks: a bit on the expensive side ($10 with drink), but its worth the extra couple of bucks. oh, and the seating isnt too fantastic either.
author: Ligaya T.

description: Damn you, Ligaya!  You invite me to go with you to Boxed Foods Company for lunch, totally innocently.  You tell me to order the honey lime chicken sandwich.  It's good, you say.  You fail to mention that I'm going to sit around thinking about this freakin' sandwich day and night.  You fail to mention that the food here is so damn good that I'm going to have to walk all the way down to Boxed Foods every day for lunch, and when I don't, I'm only going to be disappointed with whatever it is I happen to be eating instead because it will never be as good as Boxed Foods.  Is it lunchtime yet?
author: Erica G.

description: Decent lunch options made of super fresh ingredients. I had the "Boxed" Chicken Salad which was pulled roasted chicken, mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, red onions, feta (special add by me), cucumber, thinly sliced granny apples with an apple vinegar and champagne vinaigrette. YUM YUM!!! Waiting in line is not fun though... The line at lunch time is pretty long.
author: Jen D.

description:
went exploring on my own for a good SF sandwich/panini; a little self-indulgence. 

had, according to the recommendations already posted, the honey-lime chicken and avocado, and couldn't have been more satisfied.  the honey was great with the bread, and complimented the chicken well.  

great attitude inside too - progressive, hip, young, fun. 

smart branding, energetic aura, and light and rewarding food.  great lunch!

****

so I came back with the bros for a Friday lunch in the FiDi.  This time I got the petaluma chicken panini, and accordingly, bumped up my four star rating to the 5 max.
author: Mason S.

description:
radical drink selection (kombucha, coconut water, coca cola), a rippingly lip-smacking steak sandwich, and swanky decor.  Good clean food. Oh, and if you don't eat meat you can definitely get your tofu on.

Here's a story:
http://stretchyhead.com/?p=437
author: Ian T.

description: Smallish tasty sandwiches get 3 stars.  Nothing wrong with the place, but i'll probably not go back for lunch.  Coffee gets 5 stars.  Averaging out to a grand total of...
author: Andy G.

description: I love good healthy food alternatives as much as the next guy, but do we really have to accept $10 bucks for a friggin' sandwich as the norm in the financial district?  Really?  Look, I understand that you get what you pay for, but in the end the price is what we really care about.  Plus, if the food really was that much better than your average lunch spot, I wouldn't mind paying extra.  The fact is, the food just isn't THAT great.  Good?  Yes, but not $10 bucks good.
author: Casey R.

description: So, this place is a little more than I like to spend for lunch, but I do think it's pretty good. I really like the panini sandwich. They also have some different salads. The one with bing cherries is tasty. I have never had to wait more than ten minutes for my food and the service has always been friendly. The only bummer is that they have VERY limited seating.
author: Lisa A.

description: This reveiw is more for the staff than the food.  They are really nice and willing to do anything to make sure you have a good lunch.
author: Ruby G.

description: I grabbed lunch there today with my best friend and what a lunch spot! They have a secret outdoor seating area -- maybe it's not-so-secret, but we had no clue it existed until we explored the place. Delicious honey-lime chicken sandwich accompanied by mixed greens and fresh parm on top. They have a wide selection of organic teas and I tried the peach POM tea for the first time, which I loved. It's a solid lunch spot in FiDi, definitely give it a go.
author: Defne A.

description:
This place will make your lunch!

Boxed Foods Company serves incredible delicious sandwhiches and salads. Located downtown this place is pretty small for a place that pumps out great food and has tons of customers. 

I walked by it twice before I finally found it. Look for the long line of people and the great smelling food ;).

Menu is written on a wall in chalk on the side and order anything, throw caution to the wind because it is all bomb. Recommend the pesto chicken pannini or the apple salad. Ingredients are fresh and people will harass you on where you got your lunch.

Bring cash because it speeds up the order and line so you get the food quicker.  There is limited seating. So grab it to go and find a rooftop garden or a public space. 

Four stars for Boxed Foods Company because I was tempted to eat it right there on the sidewalk!
author: David B.

description: Great tempeh sandwich with grilled bell peppers.
author: Sierra M.

description: All right people, give Boxed Foods Company a chance! If you go early, before the 12pm lunch rush, there's hardly a line. I've been there at 10:45am and had the place to myself. They just came out with the Grilled Flank Steak Sandwich with Horseradish Aoli. It is incredibly good! It was hands down the best sandwich I have ever had. My other favorites are the Honey Lime Chicken with Avocado, Pear and Brie Press, and Boxed Chicken Salad sandwiches. If you want to be full, choose the sandwiches with meat! The glass noodle salad and pear and brie press sandwich are lighter fare.
author: Fanny S.

description: REALLY????  This was only my 3rd time eating from this joint and each time I've had the Boxed Chicken Salad Sandwich.  The last 2 times it came on this yummy foccacia bread that I fell in love with.  Now I open my box...there's some fricken small ass roll it's on.  A little heads up would have been appreciated from the cashier that hey...you are out of your normal sandwich bread and that my sandwich is going to be much smaller then normal, yet still a whopping $8.25.  At least they don't tax you on food like everywhere else in SF.  The insides are still tasty, but it is just not the same.  :(  Sad lunch for me today!
author: Ayrn H.

description: All you need to do is step up to the counter and say "boxwich oldschool" and you'll be hooked up with the most delicious sandwich in the neighborhood. Its the 'boxed chicken salad sandwich' but on the 'herb slab' bread. They used to sell it like this when they first opened, but changed the bread to some sort of soft roll, which really doesn't work for me. In the absence of herb slab you can try the walnut bread, not as good as the herb slab, but better than the default. Make sure to ask for extra high fives and tip those kids at the counter cause they are awesome.
author: Pete S.

description: I usually get the tempeh lettuce sandwich/wrap and it's very good. A little bit pricey for the sandwich but there aren't many places in the FiDi which serve a tempeh sandwich.
author: saurabh S.

description: Prices are a little on the expensive side... but the portions are generous and the sandwiches come with a salad. The food is tasty and the ingredients are fresh. Grab your food and go, as there isn't much space inside. Lines can get long during the lunch rush, but it is a great lunch option!
author: Ossama A.

description: Incredible Moz, Pesto, Heirloom Tomato and greens sandwich.  Good stuff. Who the heck needs Starbucks and Peets when you can grab Blue Bottle here?
author: Amelia C.

description:
Yum. Yum. Yum. Yum.

Definitely the best place for fresh, organic and delicious salads and sandwiches in the Financial District. I normally get a salad but I ordered the new proscuitto and barata panini today and it was great. Plus, it came with a  pretty well-sized side salad that was just fresh greens, same parmesan cheese and a lemon-y vinaigrette.

Two downsides: long wait at lunchtime (approx. 10-15 min) and definitely on the expensive side. But so worth it!
author: Emily B.

description: Some of their menu items are amazing!  Others are meh.  Some of their sandwiches are really tiny and others are normal.  Make sure you order appropriately or you'll be sad, because $9 for a sandwich should always be plentiful, in addition to tasty.  Friendly servers though!
author: Annie R.

description: Thanks Erica G. You left a compliment to check out Boxed foods company and so I did. Guess what? I absolutely love the honey-lime chicken with avocado. I'm munching on the sandwich, so to speak. I love the ambience and settings of the restaurant. This place might be a bit pricey, but they are using high quality acme breads and fresh ingredients. The sandwiches are really mouthwatering. It comes with side salad if you order a sandwich. But, I think they need to do some kind of promotion or advertiments. I eat my lunch around that area but never noticed it until Erica recommended.
author: Michael K.

description:
proscuitto, melon, and asparagus all on one sandwich.  believe it my friends, and head over the boxed foods to get it.  and they also have black and white cookies!  not the black and white cookies you find at specialities (which are some sort of chocolate chip cookie and basically false advertising.  seriously wrong.  i told them they had my order wrong when i ordered a black and white cookie and they gave me some sort of chocolate chip cookie.  they thought i was idiot, but come on, don't call it a black and white cookie).  the black and white cookie that jewish deli's have, and just about every sandwich place  and cafe in nyc has!  it is a dense cake like cookie with icing on top - half chocolate and half vanilla.  perfection!

you'll spend $10 for a sandwich and cookie, but it is worth it.
author: scott w.

description: I am addicted to Blue Bottle Coffee. They serve it one cup at a time in the morning, there's never a line, and the guy behind the counter is super friendly. Salads are a little overpriced, but come on, they're all made from produce that comes from Happy Boy Farms. Happy Boy. How can you say no to that?
author: Sara B.

description: I was in serious need of brain food when I stumbled upon this tiny little god-send in the Financial District.  Wow.  Yum.  Tasty organic fare... it's a little on the pricey side, but definitely not unreasonable and the perfect stop for a lunch-sized bite to eat.  And the counterstaff is seriously the nicest in town.  What are they feeding these guys?  Seriously?  Anyway, if you're lucky (like I was), the day you stop in will be a nice one--you can carry your lunch a few blocks to Union Square and enjoy your sammich and salad in the warm sun.
author: vicarious c.

description: Healthy.  Fresh.  Perfection.  The prices are a little high, but you're worth it.
author: sarah k.

description: Great for lunch to-go in the FiDi.  Fresh, excellent, and organicy.  Just wish I didn't have to hit the office snack machine an hour later to feel full.
author: Ryan L.

description:
i've become somewhat of a regular here (despite their prices being a little high), but all their sandwiches come with a nice side of salad!  their sandwiches must have crack in it.  the only sandwich (that i have tried) that i didn't quite like was the chicken panini; it tasted too dry.
okay, i am also not a fan of salads, but these people know how to make a salad.  i love the grilled chicken salad!  their beef flank salad is good too, and their beef is cooked medium rare!  awesome!
author: H. L.

description: So after reading all the Yelp reviews, I decided I had to try a honey lime chicken sandwich.  It was really good, don't get me wrong, but not quite as flavorful as it sounds.  I will say that the tomatoes were probably the best I've ever had on a sandwich - and I don't normally like tomatoes.  I dunno... something was missing, though.  Maybe next time I'll ask them to drop the sando in the deep fryer for me.
author: Alex P.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  i just figured out I should go to this place.  It is kinda deceiving that this is a lunch place since the window has scones and muffins so it appears to be a coffee/pastry kinda joint.  I am now obsessed with it since I found out about it.  The food is fresh and relatively healthy.  Ive had 2 items from the menu thus far, chicken paninni and the chicken salad sandwich and loved them both. Definitely no complaints, I'm so hooked!
author: Jaime C.

description: I end up here for lunch as many as five times on a week. Good for my tummy, though bad for my wallet. The folks that work here are ridiculously friendly, and know me by name (unsurprisingly, I guess, given how often I'm here.) Winners = Boxed chicken sandwich, Boxed chicken salad, Asian tofu salad, and tempeh salad.
author: Odin F.

description: These are some mighty fine lunch boxes.  They sure ain't like my elementary school with tater tots and Salisbury steak.  Someone done made boxed foods all gourmet and fancy dancy.  I prefer the pesto chicken, pears and baked brie on foccacia and a nice side salad with their yummy yet minimal vinagrette.  Hmmm mmmm good.
author: Chard M.

description:
Man, I couldn't wait for this place to open.  I would wander by and look in the windows and hope for the day.  

Fast forward a couple years.  I barely ever go there.  The wait is just way too long for a takeout lunch, and the seating is minimal and kind of squished into a hallway.  Also, although generally pretty fresh and healthy, the food is not that special.  The salad dressing is a bit too oily and not particularly flavorful.  And there is just something a bit dry and unfinished about the sandwiches.

But the people are nice and the beverage selection is outstanding.
author: Rachel J.

description: A solid lunch spot for just under $10.  Sandwiches and salad - the usual lunch fair - done right.  I had the usual grilled chicken salad and it was very good.  You can go out the back door and sit outside in the back alley.  Friendly staff and food is ready quick.  Add it to the list for lunch time spots within walking distance.
author: Corey V.

description:
Like many, I've never actually purchased my own lunch at Boxed Foods Company: my (second-hand, meeting-leftover) salads and sandwiches come compliments of my place of work.

But whatever.  I'm totally OK with passed-over brie and pear presses and marinated tofu and glass noodle salads when they come from Boxed Foods.  Hell, I'd probably dumpster dive for the things, they're so good.  I can only imagine what they taste like fresh.

(Also: I've done a lot of the actual ordering from Boxed Foods, and have heard flak from their end of the phone line regarding how much prep time they need to complete my order--as in, they've tried to push back my pick-up time, when I absolutely needed the order by a certain hour.  Once in the store, though, they were able to get my lunches to me in the nick of time.)
author: Hannah J.

description: Only had the chicken sandwiches but they're oh so tasty. Too expensive to be a frequent option however.
author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.

description: I NEEDED something healthy after being seduced by a double-double animal style w/ animal style fries at an impromptu run to In-N-Out yesterday, and Boxed Foods Company did the trick. Not only was it all organic and all health-food-tasting, it actually was just really freaking tasty. I went ahead with the honey lime chicken sandwich that was recommended so much on these forums - excellent choice! Little bit on the pricey side, but for what it's worth it was very filling and you do get a little side salad w/ dark leafy greens and an orange slice.
author: Reman C.

description: Basic, yummy lunch food served with class and syle just the way I like it.  Nothing incredibly innovative here, but the feel of the place is chic and friendly, and the food leaves you feeling happy and healthy.  Also love the way the kitchen is open and visible - gives the place more of a homey feel, even despite the cool surroundings.  Thumbs up for lunch in the financial district.
author: Sam P.

description:
my coworkers rave about how good this place was. so i took a chance today and went in. it was raining and wanted to take it back to the office..so i ordered the honey lime chicken sandwich (which everyone was talking how good it tastes) and i have to agree. i've been sick this past week and have lost my appetite but i think i gained it back today, i swear! =) no shit.

i have yet to try the turkey and artichoke panini and the portabello mushroom salad..

i know most of the sandwiches costs from $7-8 but it's totally worth it. 

this is a must go in the FiDi.
author: Mika D.

description: I can't believe I hadn't written a review of this spot.  While it's not the cheapest they definitely don't skimp on portion sizes here for their salads and the ingredients taste really fresh.  It's super cramped inside but I'm usually eating by myself when I do eat here and it's nice to zone out reading while enjoying one of my favorite salads in the city!
author: Gene X.

description: One of the best lunch places. Service is fast and prompt. The ingredients are fresh and really tasty. The sandwiches and salads are light yet filling. The coffee served is Blue Bottle Coffee and thus really good. Lots of choices for drinks. They only very few tables for sitting. Mostly a place to order and go. Flank Steak Sandwich and the Chicken Salad are amazing.
author: Rohit D.

description: I've gone here a few times since its around the corner from work but the food isn't really impressive. Why I give 3 stars?  They actually play really cool music and serve Blue Bottle coffee now!
author: Terence D.

description: I have eaten at this place for the third time and every time, they do not disappoint me. Even though the walk is a pretty good walk from where I work the freshness of the food keeps me coming back. The food has so much flavor and the quality of the vegetables are crisp, that spending $10 for lunch does not phase me. It's worth every dime and to top it, majority of the food is organic!!!! I would definitely keep coming back and would definitely spread the word about this place. Psst....try the turkey and avocado panini, the $8 you'll spend will be worth it.
author: Kathy T.

description: The turkey artichoke panini is quite stellar. And I had a fresh-squeezed pink grapefruit juice.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I always noticed that Boxed Foods existed but never was drawn inside the relatively small space on Kearney.  But last week, I finally drifted in and was quite pleasantly surprised with what I found.  The sandwich menu is vast and changes with the season.  That is why I was sad to see the Mozzarella and tomato sandwich was not available.  The breads are delicious and the service quick.  When I visited, it was just after the lunch rush, but the kitchen manager knew customers by their orders which were quickly prepared.  The girl behind the counter was so cute and amazingly friendly.  Her smile and ability to answer questions about different menu options gave me a great desire to want to come back, something I value highly in a lunch spot.
author: Taylor P.

description: Boxed foods has a great menu...it is small and usually always busy. the BEST part of boxed food is BLUE BOTTLE COFFEE!!!!!!
author: Anita C.

description:
I'm really into the "boxed chicken" salad which has this shredded chicken that has a slight curry flavor.  With the shredded apples and thinly sliced onions I don't even need to use the raspberry dressing.

I like to eat at the tables in the back outside, which is right near the back of cafe claude.

The only reason this place doesn't get five stars is because the girl at the counter is so freaking happy it freaks me out.  It's like Prozac gone wrong.
author: Alona E.

description: Really good food, although selection is not that large...oh well they still do good job.  And major YEY for the organic aspect.  It's sad though that organic doesn't even always mean organic because the US sucks so much on regulating this stuff.  And to comment on a reviewer's thoughts below about pesticides.....food sprayed with pesticides and GMO is NOT more yummy.  What you are tasting is lab engineered taste (ever notice that those super red, mutant large strawberries have a subtle fish flavor?).  I will take my chances on the taste, if it is pesticide/herbicide free....after nature never intended on a perfect outcome every single time for anything.  Try their boxed chicken salad....it is awesome and happy lunching in the FiDi
author: Nadia S.

description: Was disappointed both times that I went.  Found my salads bland for the price.  Threw almost all of the 2nd one away without really eating any of it.  Wont be back.  I prefer Urban Picinic.
author: Christin A.

description: The quality of boxed foods is amazing. Beautiful organic produce and Acme bread make all the sandwiches and salads delicious. They have a long menu so there's many options and interesting combos. The eating area is a little tight, but they have a great selection of magazines for you to read while you wait or eat in. They just started table service for those wanting to sit out on claude lane. I think the to-go portions can be a little small especially given the price tag but I go back again and again for the turkey artichoke panini and heirloom toy box salad, yummy.
author: Kristin K.

description: I tried their roasted veggie salad and it was a great mixture of taste and textures. The veggies are super fresh. They give you a lot and I was full till 5PM. Yay. Average price for salad around FiDi (~$10).
author: Judy D.

description: This place served me RAW BACON on my sandwich today.  I am so appalled!  I don't know if they have a disgruntled emplyee who just hates the cutomers, or someone who is just so dumb they got the cooked bagon mixed up with the raw, but either way they've got problems in their kitchen.  I am never eating here again, and you shouldn't either.  I'm going to get my money back right now.
author: Ryan O.

description: The grilled tempeh salad was excellent.  Fresh ingredients and great flavored dressing. Wish I could afford to eat here daily..
author: Rob F.

description: Long line but quick moving and quick service.  I had the honey, lime avocado sandwich.  It was good but I was expecting better for $10.  I'll be back to try some of the other sandwiches but not after trying the other places in the neighborhood.
author: Sancho P.

description:
hung over...so hung over...birthday drinking morning badness....hung over....
enter boxed foods company.... and honest tea
yummy yummy yummy i got boxed foods in my tummy...
so good and light to boot, i liked the fact that they are reasonable and produce quality meals mmmmmmm
want to return NOW!
also the sweet back exit to the little alley way behind cafe claude is a super-dee-duper plus especially on a day like to day...nice and sunny!
author: o. c.

description: My eyes are rolling to the back of my head as I'm scarfing down my grilled portebello mushroom salad. Perfect amount of food and they don't skimp on the toppings....it's a perfect balance between fixin's and lettuce. YUM.
author: Tanger T.

description: Eh... Food was not great. My friend had tasty looking chicken sandwich, but the salad I ordered consisted mainly of wilted greens-- and not in a good way. Gets super busy during lunch hour, and you'll probably have to fight your way through the place to get to their outside seating area on Claude Lane. Staff members are pretty friendly, but the place seems to attract a lot of rude people. If you do go here, get take-out.
author: F H.

description: Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum ... I just recovered from the decadent experience of eating a beet salad: beets, goat cheese, grilled onions, pancetta.  Ooooh it was good. If only I could afford a 9 dollar salad for lunch on a daily basis.
author: Amanda L.

description: Their prosciutto, asparagus, melon sandwich on walnut bread is the. best. sandwich. on. earth.
author: Cathy T.

description: Came here after my haircut since my hairdresser recommended this sandwich place. Had the turkey panini which was pretty tasty though a little on the dry side. Not sure if I was used to the tomato/mozarella panini in Paris which was definitely more moist and tasty. Will try the chicken and lime option on my next visit perhaps....anyway, the sandwich/panini came in a nice box with salad and a slice of orange on the side which was convenient and easy to take around. I noticed that you can phone in your order beforehand and several people came in to pick up their orders, a good stream of ppl came and go, guess it's pretty popular place.
author: Yan M.

description: The prices are a little high, but in line with Mix'd Greens and other "gourmet" sandwich/salad places that use fresh, organic, top-quality ingredients.  The sandwich portion size is pretty decent and all sandwiches come with a mixed greens side salad.  I'm a big fan of the the Proscuitto, Asparagus & Parmesan Panini (with slices of melon) and the Turkey Artichoke Panini.
author: Saw T.

description:
pricey but fancy salads and sandwiches.  i've only tried their sandwiches so far though.  actually, i can only remember ever getting the pear and brie press and it's all-around delightful.

well, delightful except for this one time.  i can't say for sure it was the sandwich, but after i had lunch i had to miss my friend's birthday party that night because it wouldn't have been appropriate to ask her to move the party to my bathroom.
author: spiff e.

description: Just finished the Beet salad, fantastic! There can be a wait at between 12-1:30, but who doesn't have one in the FIDI?
author: Kelly P.

description:
they make real coffee
it tastes beautiful
not burnt
not weak
not like every other coffee shop in san francisco
gold
author: Nathan H.

description: Love this place. I've only had the "boxed" chicken sandwich lunch but I friggen heart it. Apples, bacon, pesto, and FANTASTIC cuts of pulled chicken. I am a total snob about chicken meat, it has to be all white and fat-less or I just get grossed out. This place rocks the good white bird :-)
author: Michael H.

description: Very tasty organic sandwiches with delicious little side salad that comes in, you guessed it, a box. They are true to there name and I really like this little downtown spot. The price is a tad high, but it's for quality food. You won't be let down. It's a bit of a hike from my office, so that deters me from getting down here about half as much as I'd like. It's sad that in this country organic food is this attraction and not the norm. Maybe Boxed Foods will help pave the way.
author: Michael E.

description: Boxed Chicken salad.  I've tried nothing else, but it is AWESOME.  Chicken is moist and herbed, apples are crunchy.  Dressing is fresh squeezed oranges with something else ... ridiculously awesome.  Nice sit-down area in the back (outdoors and indoors.)  This place lost a star because it's a little expensive, (Cost $8.50 + tax) but you will not find a better salad elsewhere.
author: Karen L.

description: So clearly I got the honey lime chicken sandwich, I mean, it wasn't even really a choice... and it was DELICIOUS. Plenty of meat and the bread was super tasty! I'm sure I'll have plenty of opportunities to try out lots of their other delicious sounding items.. Lucky me!
author: katharine s.

description: Best place in FiDi to take your visiting organic-sustainable-vegan-farming-just-over-from-Berkeley friends. But then again, I'm none of the above and I'm always impressed by the quality and taste of the food. If you have a little extra time, sit outside on Claude Lane on a nice day... very enjoyable.
author: Aaron L.

description: Super fresh.  The Fruit is so tasty.  I haven't had blackberries and blueberries like those in ages.  The greens, the bread and even the water (they have cucumbers in it) are excellent.  It is a little expensive, so not an every day thing, but a great treat!
author: Marla L.

description:
UPDATE:  recently had the turkey artichoke panini.  Boxed Foods has redeemed itself.

First visit feedback for January 22, 2008:

Have ALMOST bought lunch here several times since they opened nearly 3 years ago, and I've been in the 'hood for almost 5 years now.  Finally stopped in today.  It's worthy of 4 stars, but I'm "dinging" them - read on:

Stood and studied the menu for quite some time, vascillating between salad and sandwich.  Eventually settled on, ordered and paid for the turkey artichoke panini.  As change was being returned to me by the cashier, one of the "cooks" reminded her, and then told me, that they were out of the spread for this particular panini.  I HATE THAT!  Put me through the TORTURE of making a decision only to kick the stool from under my feet at the 11th hour.  Made a quick choice (there were now others behind me, waiting impatiently to order) and went with the BLT.  It was solid, and I'm not disappointed.

But I wanted that damn turkey artichoke panini.  My mind and heart were set on it.  They're going to have to make it up to me next time (I will be back at some point).
author: Dennis H.

description: Not bad. I'd even say good. The bread is super fresh, and the sandwiches come with a small side salad. However, I just don't feel great about spending $9 on a sandwich for lunch when I can get the same satisfaction for say, $4 on a vietnamese sandwich.
author: Ava C.

description: The wife and I stopped by for lunch on Friday at noon.  Loved the grilled turkey panini sandwich!   The service was good and the food came fast.
author: Dave W.

description:
Ok - so they occasionally run out of food, and you have to wait in line for a while - Oh, and if you try to go after two p.m. you are screwed.....  but the Boxed Chicken Salad is worth the effort.  I normally HATE chicken salad, but here its oh so good and a good portion (not to0 much, not too little!)   

The staff is also super friendly and they learn your face and your favorite things on the menu.  TWO THUMBS WAY WAY up on the customer service!
author: Jaden V.

description:
Update:  This place used to be my favorite sandwich place in the City, but no longer.

I hadn't been here for some time since I no longer work nearby, but since I was in the area recently, I had to drop by my (once) favorite sandwich place.  I'm not sure if it was an off day, or an off day for whoever made my meal, but the sandwich I got sort of well, sucked.  Okay, maybe suck is a bit strong, but compared to before, yeah, it sucked.  A bit skimpy on the ingredients and sloppily put together, it lacked the soul and artistry of their previous sandwiches.  What happened?????  The same cashier/manager guy was there as before, so I'm assuming it's the same management, but quality has just gone down the tubes.  Each of the dozens of previous sandwiches I had from there were near worthy of being on the front cover of [insert fancy food magazine here].  This recent sandwich was totally pedestrian.  Not sure if they're just riding on their laurels now or what, but I hope they get their mojo back.  Going from a 5 star rating to a 3.
author: T C.

description: Blue bottle coffee, delicious walnut-blackberry scones and excellent lunches - don't miss this place. They use ACME bread for their sandwiches and the salads are delicious too. The line can be a bit long around 12:30 but it's worth the wait. The portions are not large but big just enough to be satisfying.
author: Ljuba R.

description: We got there at 1:15, after the lunch rush.  We had a table in a little alley, and the food came quickly.  My friend had the chicken salad sandwich, I had the grilled chicken panini with the goat cheese and sundried tomatoes.  was very pleased-but at $10 a pop with a drink, I'm not going to be there every day (even though I'd happily be).  It also advertised fruit and salad with my sandwich, and there was no fruit to be seen.   On a rainy day, I'd recommend take out only, because the actual restaurant itself was rather cavelike.  I look forward to checking out their sister restaurant, B, in Oakland.
author: Beth V.

description:
With over 35 reviews and such a great rating already, i still feel this lunch spot should be my first yelp review.  The food is amazing, fresh, organic, simple, and full of flavor.  As a long time friends with a chefs who works part time at the boxed food company and full time at there sister restaurant in Oakland "B" and have gotten to know the simple yet passionate philosophy of the owners/chefs.  
Although i am still exploring their ever changing menu, the boxed chicken salad, honey lime (ho lime) sandwich, and yes their free water are outstanding at boxed food.  Personally i like to order my food in and take advantage of there seating in the back and enjoy an extended lunch break.  It does get crowded but it does pay to get there earlier then later because they do run out of produce.  
The only thing i don't like at this place is the walnut bread, i was once unknowingly given this bread when they ran out of acme bread, not cool.  
Overall, an amazing lunch spot that will only get better and better as fruits and vegetables start to come in season this sping/summer.  
P.S. I heard that the owners are opening another restaurant south of market..... check out B's dinner reviews for a heads up on what the new restaurant might have to offer in the near future.
author: Chris L.

description: My only complaint about Boxed Foods is that sometimes it can take awhile to get the sandwich, but when you do get it, it's a work of art. An artisinal masterpiece, these sandwiches are the freshest you can get downtown and feature deluxe ingredients like chevre, avocado, and carmelized onions. This is by far the most upscale sandwich you're going to get in the financial district.
author: Keith R.

description:
I've had many a delicious salad/sandwich/tea/cookie here.
My favorite is during the summer season when they have the heirloom tomato+fresh mozzarella salad.
The Grannysmith Vinaigrette might be my all time favorite dressing!
Lately I've been going here in the mornings too --the coffee is very tasty and the croissants are fresh and flaky!
The owners are super cool--be sure to check out their Oakland venture "B".  Delicious!
author: Amy C.

description:
everything's overpriced in the financial district, so prices here are on par

otherwise their salads and sandwiches are well-sized, lots of fresh ingredients and flavors

but whenever you bite into an $8 sandwich or $9 salad, then spy the otherwise normal ingredients, you begin to wonder how much you could save by making the damned thing yourself

it's a relatively sophisticated place to get your lunch so it won't come cheap, you can get the same exact stuff farther down the street, but from dirtier mom and pop stores
author: Charles C.

description: Ordered a grilled chicken panini and it was good.  It was served with small vinaigrette salad.  Food was good, but I was expecting a little bit more.
author: Eric A.

description: One of my favorite lunch places in the fidi. Its quick, fresh, and their honey-lime chicken sandwich is to DIE for. Sweet yet sour, and it is accompanied by a side of salad which goes great with your pallet with the sandwich.  One thing I do hate about this place is that it's $10 for lunch, which, I guess is reasonable in the fidi.
author: Chieko H.

description: love their chicken salad sandwich.  lines are long at lunch but worth the wait. great, fresh flavors and just feels a bit lighter and healthier than other lunch options.
author: Helen T.

description: Another vote for the tasty, addicting Honey-Lime Chicken Sandwich!  It's my sandwich of choice.
author: M. B.

description: Yummie..love it....only drawback is the line is way too long during the lunch hour and with good food also comes the price...quite pricey but I'd still go there.
author: Syonora A.

description:
w00t!  first review!

organic salads and sandwiches prepped on the fly, in full view (i like to watch...)

prices are higher than some other FiDi lunch places, but not so much considering the quality of the food. 

counter staff are all friendly, and the owners are right in there everyday, which is always a Good Thing.

http://www.boxedfoodscompany.com/
author: alex j.

description: I just had their heirloom tomato salad and it was EXCELLENT.  All the tomatoes were fresh and sweet.  I also really like the selection of organic drinks that they have there.  Overall, this is a more unique and healthy place to eat for lunch.
author: Dana C.

description: Fresh organic goodness!!!! Well worth the bill, for the large portions, helpful and friendly service and the speedy delivery! I personally have only had a few things, but everything has been great and I can't wait to try more!
author: Lisa K.

description: This is my favorite lunch place in the area...it makes me seriously contemplate giving up my 'pescatarian' label just to try out all their menu items.  -Everyone who works there is adorable & genuine.  -I love their muffins in the morning & the vegi or pear/brie pesto pressed sandwich at lunch.  -I also like the back patio area...where I can imagine I'm not really on my lunch break, but actually in a quaint euro city living off the trust fund.
author: Sierra S.

description:
LOVE the blue bottle coffee even though it takes a long time to prepare. I gave this place two stars because of the very rude girl manning the register this morning. How am I supposed to know that there's a five dollar minimum for cards? I didn't see an obvious sign saying so. And, in my world, shaking your head is a) rude to customers and b) doesn't translate as "We don't accept credit cards for purchases under $5, sorry about that. Would you like to buy a cookie as well so you can use your card?" I haven't worked in any sort of customer service for years, but any idiot knows that's NOT how you handle your patrons if you want them to come back. I haven't tried the food, but given the other reviews here, the prices I saw, and rude-girl, I probably won't.

UPDATE: The food is great! Rude girl still works there but everyone else has provided great service!
author: Rekha S.

description: Boxed Foods has some solid lunch options that I truly enjoy, especially the grilled tempeh salad (4 star worthy).  However, since BFC started brewing Blue Bottle (blue balls) coffee, I've been largely disappointed by their lack of consistency.  I've purchased drip coffee on many occasions and half the time it is watery.  My hypothesis --- they are STINGY with the coffee grinds or the water is not hot enough.  Needless to say... I'll be back and take my chances, but I don't like my odds for a satisfying cup of coffee. Sadness.
author: Stanley E.

description: I read about this place on Yelp and went today for lunch.  Just as advertised, the sandwich was fresh, beautifully prepared and delicious.  The salad was nice, too.  4 stars instead of 5 because I chose to eat in and, like Chez Carla used to do, they leave the door open to accommodate the line of people waiting to order.  That makes sense for their business -I get that- but it's therefore too cold to eat comfortably indoors.  I'll go back but only to take the sandwich back to my office.
author: Jeff L.

description: I work two blocks from this place and it's kind of dangerous being so close to the office. Ah, fugit! It's good! Especially the lil' mini donuts and the BLT.
author: Chris G.

description:
fabulous!!!!!
also really great about making custom changes to sandwiches and it's all organic.

Update: 
I've stopped eating here because they're unable to tell me what ingredients are in the food. I have a bad allergy, so I can't risk it.
author: vickie j.

description: The sandwiches and salads are generous, delicious, and super-healthy... And the staff is great.
author: Marc E.

description: What a cute lunch spot!  My chicken breast panini was very flavorful, but what impressed me most was the wide selection of juice and tea brands.
author: Marcus C.

description: Yummy steak salad. Very fresh ingredients. I gave myself a pat on the back for making it past the chinese buffet to try out Boxed Foods Co. There is a bit of a wait, I'd recommend calling in your order. But, they do have stacks of magazines to flip through while you wait. One more thing....BLUE BOTTLE.... :)
author: Valerie D.

description: I hate to do this to Boxed Foods but for their prices they need bigger portions.  Also recently the food arrived cold and yucky.  I think they deliver to our work due to their close proximity, so they are still in rotation for ordering (I'm at Montgomery and Pine).  That confuses me because people say they don't deliver, but they do.  Decent food but not worth the price based on quantity and quality.
author: Ann C.

description:
AVERAGE
========
Boxed Foods Company has average food at medium-high prices (e.g. about $9 pretax). At lunch, the line to order is long. Also, people who phone order go to the front of the line and then still have to pay. (The place should require credit card payment by phone and then to show the credit card at time of pick-up to speed those customers along and not make the wait longer for those standing in line.)  I think there are better places nearby.
author: Flynt I.

description: Once the idea of a Boxed Foods sandwich (especially the Boxed Chicken Sandwich) enters your head at around 10:00, you actually have no choice but to go there for lunch, preferably before it gets mobbed at noon. Sure the sandwiches are $8, but since they bring me happiness and a lot of satisfaction I will gladly spring for them whenever I can. The side salad is generously sized, the bread is fresh and soft, and the chicken is juicy with nary a grisly bit and pesto is incredibly fresh.  They even have a lovely seating area outside. In fact, I'm going to go ahead and say that the place is a bargain.
author: Zoe V.

description:
Healthy doesn't have to mean tasteless or bland. Boxed Foods does great organic sandwiches and salads that are fresh, not too heavy and delicious.

I feel satisfied after a lunch here unlike the many many times I've come back to the office with a total food coma and wanting to pass out around 2:30.

Prices are pretty standard for the Financial District. $8-10 food items. The place is small and can be difficult to sit with more than 2 or 3 people. But they don't call it Boxed Foods for nothing, you can get it to go in a... box!

It does close by 3pm though, so no-go past lunch. But apparently they do happy hour at B Restaurant and Bar in Yerba Buena Gardens every night and there's a B Restaurant in Oakland.

Try the: Turkey~Artichoke Panini
author: Karen J.

description:
5 minutes before noon, that's my M.O.
First time, got the BLT. It was incredible. Always add the extra avocado.
Second time, beets salad. Being a picky eater, I tried to pick out the fennel stuff.
Third time, someone whispered behind my back, try the boxed chicken salad. I was hooked hooked hooked.

A bit pricey, but it sure does make me feel healthy without hitting the gym.
author: Tania R.

description:
Tasty tasty tasty. Be sure to ask about the high-fives. 

Everything that I've tried here I've enjoyed. My favorite is the Boxed Chicken Salad Sandwich. An amazing mix of shredded chicken, pesto, sliced apples and bacon bits. I'm allergic to apples but eat this sandwich anyway! Oh yes, it's that good.

The guy at the register and all the folks making the food are quite friendly and quick. I've often stood in line (as to be expected at noon) but it usually takes no more than 5 mins. Small price to pay for yummy eats.

I took off one star for the occasional stocking gaffe. I've yet to experience one personally but I've heard friends speak of these leafy green shortages. On the upside, there's a good chance that, if you had to choose a sandwich because of the salad shortage, the staff would provide you with a few extra free high-fives to make up for it.
author: V K.

description:
a consistently good, healthy-feeling lunch for those who don't mind paying $8-10. the people are friendly, and while it gets super crowded around lunchtime, your stuff is prepared fairly quickly. plus they have magazines you can browse through while you wait, even if they are from six months ago. 

one thing, which i will forgive since their lunchtime fare is top notch -- i found a hair in my almond croissant this morning. ick. the croissant however, was crispy and perfect. until i found the hair seven-eighths of the way through, it was fantastic. perhaps they get their pastries from an outside vendor.

another cool thing is they carry an assortment of tea's tea, which i haven't found anywhere else in the area.
author: Christine V.

description: Yeah.....I found one of my new favorite lunch spots. I have been here a couple of times with my boyfriend. We each order different sandwiches and then swaped halves in order to experience the different types. YUM!!! I love the turkey and artichoke panini as well as the chicken pesto panini! He is hooked on the chicken salad sandwich. The quality of the food here is great and I am so happy we discovered this little spot close to his workplace.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
this place is pretty good. i got the "boxed chicken sandwich;" it had granny smith apples, pesto, and some oil, and came with a small salad.

might consider it a little pricey at $9 but then again there aren't very many cheap options around the area.

i wish vegetarians would quit bitching that places don't cater to them.
author: R E.

description: Really great lunch place they do deliveries and will deliver to your office as early as 11am for those who work the east coast hours. The salads are all great and really tasty. The customer service is great and most importantly they get your order right!
author: Olga P.

description: The salads here are always very satisfying, completely worth the money.   And the Tempeh lettuce wrap is also quite delicious.
author: Bernadette G.

description: Wow!  Hands down the best salad and latte ever had in my life. Veggie salad with beets, parsnips, purple onion etc etc. ..fresh, creative, organic, beautiful, tasty.  Unbelievable.  After I had a sip of the latte, I turned to the guy who made it and blurted out "this is the best latte I've ever had"!   I think i embarassed him  Then I brought my friend in the next day and she ordered a mocha and chiecen sandwich  After her first sip, she looked up and said the same thing to me!  After a bite of sandwich, she was like in heaven   I am having withdrawals already because it is Saturday and they are closed weekends and I want a latte from Boxed Foods !!!  I've tried two sandwiches and two salads and all were fabulous.   It is a few doors down from Working Girls.  If the line hadn't been so long at WG, I wouldn't have discovered Boxed Foods!!  Then I tried WG the next day and ugh, my spinach salad was terrible.  The spinach tasted like they had just poured it out of one of those ready mix bags.  It was tasteless.  The toppings were good but that's what they were...toppings.  I am amazed that Working Girls gets so much business. What's more WG is all plastic while Boxed Foods uses paper and compostible utensils. Totally first class.  Only one problem....I have to drive 50 miles to get here!
author: Norma P.

description: The famous Chicken Salad sandwich wasn't available, so I went with what appeared to be a similar product (chicken, apple, pesto, bacon). Overall result was decent, but a bit heavy on the oil and more subdued flavor that I would want from pesto, apple and bacon. The salad dressing was very bland and oily. The ingredients tasted fresh and high quality; I'll give them another try but at this point, Urban Picnic (a block away) is a clear winner.
author: Colin M.

description: I really like the salads and sandwichs.... but truly disappointed with the morning coffee and pastries. : (
author: Steven N.

description:
Fantastic! Had the Box Food Chicken Sandwich and it was wonderful. I can't believe I've been working in FiDi for 2 weeks, it's 1 block from my work and hadn't found it on my own! (got the Yelp email directing me towards it today).

The chicken was fresh and well seasoned, bacon crisp, bread soft and the salad and dressing was great.

It's pricey. But I'm realizing that this part of the neighborhood, good food does not come cheap.
author: C S.

description:
I always forget about this place cuz it's so damn small and hidden, but the food is pretty good.

Today I went and they didn't have any salads available, none at all.  Which make me think they ran out of lettuce which is pretty much the one universal ingredient in their salads.

So imagine my surprise when my sandwich came with a friggin' side salad!  With lettuce!  WTF?

Either way it was pretty good.  I think they put a whole chicken on my sandwich; I had to get a fork to finish it.  Not bad for $8.
author: Brian W.

description: my first introduction to boxed foods company was on my way into work one morning.  was running late, no time for breakfast at home, so i decided to check this place out.  i was very impressed with my first glance at the menu: wholesome, organic unique selections.    the staff was great, the music was right and i was able to peruse the selection of cool magazines the have on the counter while i waited.  it was an overall pleasant experience, a great way to start the day.  i have been in several times since, for lunch, and have not been in the least bit disappointed.  the chicken trust me is always fun and fabulous!  i have not yet encountered a staff member who was not patient, pleasant and friendly.  well worth the price.
author: Bernadette M.

description: this place is seriously overrated.  why anyone would wait in line for this makes absolutely no sense.  maybe its the salads?
author: Raj D.

description: the pear and brie press is fantastic! the long line sucks!
author: vincent m.

description: We went here for lunch mainly based on the exceptional Yelps.  This place did not live up to its rating.  It was better than average food, but we did have some problems.  First, they messed up my friend's order.  What he received was still good, but just not what he ordered.  Second, my friend purchased a bottled tea there that cost $5.  The fact that they would even offer such rip-off is inexcusable.   Overall a good sandwich and salad place, but don't believe the 5 star hype.
author: Bryan J.

description: overpriced but delicious.  and it makes me feel cool to eat there, like i'm some sort of urban trend-setter.  except, i'm not an urban trend-setter and i don't know how long my wallet and i can keep up the charade.
author: Samantha W.

description:
***update 9/13/07***

thx to pete s. for the heads-up re: requesting herb slab!  i was wondering why they swtiched over to the soft roll (which was fine but not as heavenly as the original foccacia-like sandwich...it doesn't hurt to ask!
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
have you ever eaten a sandwich so good that after one bite you were ready to yelp about it even before you even finished eating?  such was my first boxed foods experience...(but i managed to hold off until after i finished before i started typing, to spare my keyboard from crumbs and sandwich fallout)

the boxed chicken salad sandwich is SOOOO good.   as described in a review below, it's moist and well-seasoned shreds of chicken mixed with fresh herbs, olive oil and citrus - such a californian version of chicken salad! - served on this incredible foccacia-like bread with apples, bacon (no, they didn't forget!) and a walnut pesto sauce.   it's a pretty decent sized sandwich with a good ratio of filling to bread, plus it comes with an equally decent sized side salad of mixed greens (mesclun?).  and the raspberry (?) vinaigrette comes on the side so your sandwich doesn't get soggy!  i had brought a bag of chips to work thinking i might need to supplement my lunch (after an experience with a miniscule sandwich and side salad from sellers market - i'm holding off on writing that review until i return and give that place a chance to redeem itself) but didn't even bother opening the bag, the meal was that substantial.

$8.25 plus tax for the sandwich is a bit pricey, but the freshness, taste and substance is worth it.  i'm pleasantly full and have a feeling i won't be suffering midafternoon munchies (but i do have my chips just in case!)  i'm looking forward to returning and trying more of their sandwiches and maybe salads too - their steak salad is cheaper than mixt greens!

tip:  come in early or late to avoid the lunch crowd (and to ensure you aren't jipped on the bacon) - i went after 1:30 and i was able to place and order and walk out with sandwich in hand in less than five minutes, there wasn't even a line.
author: Jen P.

description:
Horrible experience. I am a vegetarian and have eaten at this place once before. The food was pretty good and i thought i'd give it another try in my never-ending quest to find "the lunch spot" near my office. I ordered the "silken tofu caesar salad" for $8.00. Fifteen minutes later i get my salad and walk back to the office, only to discover that there is bacon / pancetta / something sprinkled all over the salad. i am furious and walk back to get a new salad. the manager smiles, shows it to the salad-maker who just kind of shrugs. the manager says she'll have him make me a new one. no offer for refund, no apology, no other restitution... a simply horrible reponse!
I proceeded to stand around and wait another 15 minutes... eventually, i got another salad, only to discover that the "silken tofu" part of the salad is non-existent. For $8.35, after tax, i wasnt expecting a few pieces of romaine with some sub-par creamy dressing sprinkled on top. 
this experience was a horrible disaster, and the complete lack of responsiveness and customer service after their foul-up was inadequate. i work next door and could have been a multi-hundred $ lifetime value customer... they messed up and now i will happily get my salads from working girl cafe and lee's deli.. goodbye overpriced, evil, unfriendly boxed food company!
author: David F.

description: about as gourmet as you can get with sandwiches. i have yet to find anything on it's menu that isn't appealing. a good cure for boring lunch blues.
author: Tom H.

description: not that this place needs another review, but tried it last week, and i must agree with most everyone else.  it was quite yummy. had the grilled chicken salad.  the ingredients were fresh, and the chicken breast was cooked to perfection.. nice and juicy but not dry.  came around 12:30, but didn't have to wait too long (maybe 15 minutes in total to order and p/u the food).  i think next time i'll need to come back and try a sandwich.
author: Waynele Y.

description: been stopping in here more regularly lately.  so far have only tried a few varieties of their sandwiches but i have to say they were quite delicious!   so fresh tasting, and the bread is fantastic!!  and i love that the sandwiches come with a salad.  most sandwiches seem to be around $8 but i'm always filled up, so i think it's worth it for what you are getting.  mmmmm now i'm getting hungry!!  greeeeeat....
author: Yvette H.

description: i love this place.  i love the nice hipsters (contradiction in terms?) who work there.  i get bummed when they're out of tempeh, and i wish they would toss the salads without being asked, but i come here all the time.  the food is fresh and healthy.  i dig it.
author: K H.

description: delicious, unique sandwiches and salads. everyone there is really nice, and it's better than 'wichcraft!
author: Domenique B.

description: grilled chicken salad is totally worth the $8.  mine came with a wonderfully huge slice of goat cheese and wedge of fresh mango.  it was awesome!
author: Tabatha Y.

description: just had their chicken lime honey deal based on other yelpers recommendations, and i must say you guys didn't let me down.  quite a tasty sandwich with everything being balanced well.  it's pretty easy to over-do red onions, nope not here!  there's just a hint of lime and honey, but that ended up being the perfect amount for me . . . yum
author: Jeffrey H.

description: yums. totally. gotta love their wheat walnut bread for sandwiches...
author: Alexandra D.

description: I really liked this place for breakfast pastry and coffee/espresso drink.  Had for lunch too and it was good.
author: Brian S.

description: The boxed chicken salad is delicious. I love the dressing. Usually not a bad fan of salad, but I just can't stop thinking about this place. The food  at Boxed Food are organic. I'd give it two thumbs up. However, it is a bit pricey for a salad though.
author: Anna Z.

description: *out of tempeh* Oh, i see. Why do i always want what the hordes line up for? Jesus, those sappy bureaucrats reprimanding my sought after vegan protein transmitters (has nothing to do with the fact marsha z probably had the last one from a single package purchased 4 months prior...). Sure, yeah, better get that 10 dollar salad, yeah, ill take the flavorless carbonated horseradish root "SO DEEE" allright..... 11.50. Hey ya'll, how much brita filter attention was bestowed upon my organic white pepper mango inverted cipollini sage vin across the bed of translucent semolina sprigs? It's like im licking a dressing container in whole foods....in fact, if i was there right now, affordability would glide across my word pool. But you already knew that didn't you......yeah, that's right.....ill be back for that tempeh flambe, you marmeset perineums. ( hot cashier....control rage.....don't order something just to talk to her and further your impossibility debt....hey, yeah, im cool with free range.....no, not really......ah well, the subterranean enclave awaits....)
author: Christopher J.

description: put it this way: i know where i'm going to lunch next time i visit my company's SF office...
author: mitch b.

description: This place is fast and good. Perfect for a financial district worker.  The brie and pear pressed sandwich is delicious!!! Also, the honey-lime chicken sandwich will make you drool. It is becoming a little pricey and sucks that the food doesn't come in a box anymore. Plus, they run out of ingredients a little too much.
author: pat j.

description: I work in the Financial District and am addicted to Boxed Foods.  Despite their unbelievable lunch rush (and consequent wait), the atmosphere and decor is calming and casually upscale, which would be an apt description of the food as well.  The prices are spot-on (some complain, but this is the Financial District-good luck finding this quality for cheaper) and the service is friendly and efficient.  The menu is inventive and different, while the small focus places an emphasis on making each menu item unique.  Furthermore, the sandwiches (which come with a petite side salad) are the perfect size for a moderate lunch-filling but not super-sized.  The only reason I haven't ranked this eatery with 5 stars is because they need to get a handle on their popularity-while they take the rush in stride with smiles, they routinely close early after running out of some or all of their base ingredients.  The quality scale also has some variation-it's all good, but some of the menu items are so close to perfect (asparagus sandwich, honey-lime chicken) that the less-than-perfect items suffer in comparison.
author: V. A.
